  33  /**
  34   * Call a method for all modules in a row
  35   *
  36   * @param string the name of the method which should be called
  37   * @param array params
  38   * @return array[module_name][return value], or NULL if the method doesn't have any return value
  39   */
  40  function modules_call_method( $method_name, $params = NULL )
  41  {
  42      global $modules;
  43  
  44      $result = NULL;
  45  
  46      foreach( $modules as $module )
  47      {
  48          $Module = & $GLOBALS[$module.'_Module'];
  49          if( $params == NULL )
  50          {
  51              $ret = $Module->{$method_name}();
  52          }
  53          else
  54          {
  55              $ret = $Module->{$method_name}( $params );
  56          }
  57          if( isset( $ret ) )
  58          {
  59              $result[$module] = $ret;
  60          }
  61      }
  62  
  63      return $result;
  64  }

  67  /**
  68   * Loads the b2evo database scheme.
  69   *
  70   * This gets updated through {@link db_delta()} which generates the queries needed to get
  71   * to this scheme.
  72   *
  73   * @param boolean set true to load installed plugins table as well, leave it on false otherwise
  74   *        - currently used only on table normalization
  75   *
  76   * Please see {@link db_delta()} for things to take care of.
  77   */
  78  function load_db_schema( $inlcude_plugins = false )
  79  {
  80      global $schema_queries;
  81      global $modules, $inc_path;
  82      global $db_storage_charset, $DB;
  83  
  84      if( empty( $db_storage_charset ) )
  85      { // If no specific charset has been requested for datstorage, use the one of the current connection (optimize for speed - no conversions)
  86          $db_storage_charset = $DB->connection_charset;
  87      }
  88  
  89      // Load modules:
  90      foreach( $modules as $module )
  91      {
  92          echo 'Loading module: <code>'.$module.'/model/_'.$module.'.install.php</code><br />';
  93          require_once $inc_path.$module.'/model/_'.$module.'.install.php';
  94      }
  95  
  96      if( $inlcude_plugins )
  97      { // Load all plugins table into the schema queries
  98          global $Plugins;
  99  
 100          if( empty( $Plugins ) )
 101          {
 102              load_class( 'plugins/model/_plugins.class.php', 'Plugins' );
 103              $Plugins = new Plugins();
 104          }
 105  
 106          $admin_Plugins = & get_Plugins_admin();
 107          $admin_Plugins->restart();
 108          while( $loop_Plugin = & $admin_Plugins->get_next() )
 109          { // loop through all installed plugins
 110              $create_table_queries = $loop_Plugin->GetDbLayout();
 111              foreach( $create_table_queries as $create_table_query )
 112              {
 113                  if( ! preg_match( '|^\s*CREATE TABLE\s+(IF NOT EXISTS\s+)?([^\s(]+).*$|is', $create_table_query, $match) )
 114                  { // Could not parse the CREATE TABLE command
 115                      continue;
 116                  }
 117                  $schema_queries[$match[2]] = array( 'Creating table for plugin', $create_table_query );
 118                  $DB->dbaliases[] = '#\b'.$match[2].'\b#';
 119                  $DB->dbreplaces[] = $match[2];
 120              }
 121          }
 122      }
 123  }

 126  /**
 127   * @deprecated kept only for plugin backward compatibility (core is being modified to call getters directly)
 128   * To be removed, maybe in b2evo v5.
 129   *
 130   * @return DataObjectCache
 131   */
 132  function & get_Cache( $objectName )
 133  {
 134      global $Plugins;
 135      global $$objectName;
 136  
 137      if( isset( $$objectName ) )
 138      {    // Cache already exists:
 139          return $$objectName;
 140      }
 141  
 142      $func_name = 'get_'.$objectName;
 143  
 144      if( function_exists($func_name) )
 145      {
 146          return $func_name();
 147      }
 148      else
 149      {
 150          debug_die( 'getCache(): Unknown Cache type get function:'.$func_name.'()' );
 151      }
 152  }

 165  /**
 166   * Shutdown function: save HIT and update session!
 167   *
 168   * This is registered in _main.inc.php with register_shutdown_function()
 169   * This is called by PHP at the end of the script.
 170   *
 171   * NOTE: before PHP 4.1 nothing can be echoed here any more, but the minimum PHP requirement for b2evo is PHP 4.3
 172   */
 173  function shutdown()
 174  {
 175      /**
 176       * @var Hit
 177       */
 178      global $Hit;
 179  
 180      /**
 181       * @var Session
 182       */
 183      global $Session;
 184  
 185      global $Settings;
 186      global $Debuglog;
 187  
 188      global $Timer;
 189  
 190      // Try forking a background process and let the parent return as fast as possbile.
 191      if( is_callable('pcntl_fork') && function_exists('posix_kill') && defined('STDIN') )
 192      {
 193          if( $pid = pcntl_fork() )
 194              return; // Parent
 195  
 196  		function shutdown_kill()
 197          {
 198              posix_kill(posix_getpid(), SIGHUP);
 199          }
 200  
 201          if ( ob_get_level() )
 202          {    // Discard the output buffer and close
 203              ob_end_clean();
 204          }
 205  
 206          fclose(STDIN);  // Close all of the standard
 207          fclose(STDOUT); // file descriptors as we
 208          fclose(STDERR); // are running as a daemon.
 209  
 210          register_shutdown_function('shutdown_kill');
 211  
 212          if( posix_setsid() < 0 )
 213              return;
 214  
 215          if( $pid = pcntl_fork() )
 216              return;     // Parent
 217  
 218          // Now running as a daemon. This process will even survive
 219          // an apachectl stop.
 220      }
 221  
 222      $Timer->resume('shutdown');
 223  
 224      // echo '*** SHUTDOWN FUNC KICKING IN ***';
 225  
 226      // fp> do we need special processing if we are in CLI mode?  probably earlier actually
 227      // if( ! $is_cli )
 228  
 229      // Note: it might be useful at some point to do special processing if the script has been aborted or has timed out
 230      // connection_aborted()
 231      // connection_status()
 232  
 233      // Save the current HIT, but set delayed since the hit ID will not be required here:
 234      $Hit->log( true );
 235  
 236      // Update the SESSION:
 237      $Session->dbsave();
 238  
 239      // Get updates here instead of slowing down normal display of the dashboard
 240      load_funcs( 'dashboard/model/_dashboard.funcs.php' );
 241      b2evonet_get_updates();
 242  
 243      // Auto pruning of old HITS, old SESSIONS and potentially MORE analytics data:
 244      if( $Settings->get( 'auto_prune_stats_mode' ) == 'page' )
 245      { // Autopruning is requested
 246          load_class( 'sessions/model/_hitlist.class.php', 'Hitlist' );
 247          Hitlist::dbprune(); // will prune once per day, according to Settings
 248      }
 249  
 250      // Calling debug_info() here will produce complete data but it will be after </html> hence invalid.
 251      // Then again, it's for debug only, so it shouldn't matter that much.
 252      debug_info();
 253  
 254      // Update the SESSION again, at the very end:
 255      // (e.g. "Debuglogs" may have been removed in debug_info())
 256      $Session->dbsave();
 257  
 258      $Timer->pause('shutdown');
 259  }

 264  /**
 265   * Format a string/content for being output
 266   *
 267   * @author fplanque
 268   * @todo htmlspecialchars() takes a charset argument, which we could provide ($evo_charset?)
 269   * @param string raw text
 270   * @param string format, can be one of the following
 271   * - raw: do nothing
 272   * - htmlbody: display in HTML page body: allow full HTML
 273   * - entityencoded: Special mode for RSS 0.92: allow full HTML but escape it
 274   * - htmlhead: strips out HTML (mainly for use in Title)
 275   * - htmlattr: use as an attribute: escapes quotes, strip tags
 276   * - formvalue: use as a form value: escapes quotes and < > but leaves code alone
 277   * - text: use as plain-text, e.g. for ascii-mails
 278   * - xml: use in an XML file: strip HTML tags
 279   * - xmlattr: use as an attribute: strips tags and escapes quotes
 280   * @return string formatted text
 281   */
 282  function format_to_output( $content, $format = 'htmlbody' )
 283  {
 284      global $Plugins, $evo_charset;
 285  
 286      switch( $format )
 287      {
 288          case 'raw':
 289              // do nothing!
 290              break;
 291  
 292          case 'htmlbody':
 293              // display in HTML page body: allow full HTML
 294              $content = convert_chars($content, 'html');
 295              break;
 296  
 297          case 'urlencoded':
 298              // Encode string to be passed as part of an URL
 299              $content = rawurlencode( $content );
 300              break;
 301  
 302          case 'entityencoded':
 303              // Special mode for RSS 0.92: apply renders and allow full HTML but escape it
 304              $content = convert_chars($content, 'html');
 305              $content = htmlspecialchars( $content, ENT_QUOTES, $evo_charset );
 306              break;
 307  
 308          case 'htmlfeed':
 309              // For use in RSS <content:encoded><![CDATA[ ... ]]></content:encoded>
 310              // allow full HTML + absolute URLs...
 311              $content = make_rel_links_abs($content);
 312              $content = convert_chars($content, 'html');
 313              $content = str_replace(']]>', ']]&gt;', $content); // encode CDATA closing tag to prevent injection/breaking of the <![CDATA[ ... ]]>
 314              break;
 315  
 316          case 'htmlhead':
 317              // Strips out HTML (mainly for use in Title)
 318              $content = strip_tags($content);
 319              $content = convert_chars($content, 'html');
 320              break;
 321  
 322          case 'htmlattr':
 323              // use as an attribute: strips tags and escapes quotes
 324              // TODO: dh> why not just htmlspecialchars?fp> because an attribute can never contain a tag? dh> well, "onclick='return 1<2;'" would get stripped, too. I'm just saying: why mess with it, when we can just use htmlspecialchars.. fp>ok
 325              $content = strip_tags($content);
 326              $content = convert_chars($content, 'html');
 327              $content = str_replace( array('"', "'"), array('&quot;', '&#039;'), $content );
 328              break;
 329  
 330          case 'htmlspecialchars':
 331          case 'formvalue':
 332              // use as a form value: escapes &, quotes and < > but leaves code alone
 333              $content = htmlspecialchars( $content, ENT_QUOTES, $evo_charset );  // Handles &, ", ', < and >
 334              break;
 335  
 336          case 'xml':
 337              // use in an XML file: strip HTML tags
 338              $content = strip_tags($content);
 339              $content = convert_chars($content, 'xml');
 340              break;
 341  
 342          case 'xmlattr':
 343              // use as an attribute: strips tags and escapes quotes
 344              $content = strip_tags($content);
 345              $content = convert_chars($content, 'xml');
 346              $content = str_replace( array('"', "'"), array('&quot;', '&#039;'), $content );
 347              break;
 348  
 349          case 'text':
 350              // use as plain-text, e.g. for ascii-mails
 351              $content = strip_tags( $content );
 352              $trans_tbl = get_html_translation_table( HTML_ENTITIES );
 353              $trans_tbl = array_flip( $trans_tbl );
 354              $content = strtr( $content, $trans_tbl );
 355              $content = preg_replace( '/[ \t]+/', ' ', $content);
 356              $content = trim($content);
 357              break;
 358  
 359          default:
 360              debug_die( 'Output format ['.$format.'] not supported.' );
 361      }
 362  
 363      return $content;
 364  }

 368   * autobrize(-)

 370  function autobrize($content) {
 371      $content = callback_on_non_matching_blocks( $content, '~<code>.+?</code>~is', 'autobrize_callback' );
 372      return $content;
 373  }

 375  /**
 376   * Adds <br>'s to non code blocks
 377   *
 378   * @param string $content
 379   * @return string content with <br>'s added
 380   */
 381  function autobrize_callback( $content )
 382  {
 383      $content = preg_replace("/<br>\n/", "\n", $content);
 384      $content = preg_replace("/<br \/>\n/", "\n", $content);
 385      $content = preg_replace("/(\015\012)|(\015)|(\012)/", "<br />\n", $content);
 386      return($content);
 387  }
 388  
 389  /*
 390   * unautobrize(-)
 391   */
 392  function unautobrize($content)
 393  {
 394      $content = callback_on_non_matching_blocks( $content, '~<code>.+?</code>~is', 'unautobrize_callback' );
 395      return $content;
 396  }
 397  
 398  /**
 399   * Removes <br>'s from non code blocks
 400   *
 401   * @param string $content
 402   * @return string content with <br>'s removed
 403   */
 404  function unautobrize_callback( $content )
 405  {
 406      $content = preg_replace("/<br>\n/", "\n", $content);   //for PHP versions before 4.0.5
 407      $content = preg_replace("/<br \/>\n/", "\n", $content);
 408      return($content);
 409  }

 411  /**
 412   * Add leading zeroes to a number when necessary.
 413   *
 414   * @param string The original number.
 415   * @param integer How many digits shall the number have?
 416   * @return string The padded number.
 417   */
 418  function zeroise( $number, $threshold )
 419  {
 420      return str_pad( $number, $threshold, '0', STR_PAD_LEFT );

 424  /**
 425   * Get a limited text-only excerpt
 426   *
 427   * @param string
 428   * @param int Maximum length
 429   * @return string
 430   */
 431  function excerpt( $str, $maxlen = 254, $tail = '&hellip;' )
 432  {
 433      // Add spaces
 434      $str = str_replace( array( '<p>', '<br' ), array( ' <p>', ' <br' ), $str );
 435  
 436      // Remove <code>
 437      $str = preg_replace( '#<code>(.+)</code>#i', '', $str );
 438  
 439      // fp> Note: I'm not sure about using 'text' here, but there should definitely be no rendering here.
 440      $str = format_to_output( $str, 'text' );
 441  
 442      // Ger rid of all new lines and Display the html tags as source text:
 443      $str = trim( preg_replace( '#[\r\n\t\s]+#', ' ', $str ) );
 444  
 445      $str = strmaxlen( $str, $maxlen, $tail, 'raw', true );
 446  
 447      return $str;
 448  }

 451  /**
 452   * Crop string to maxlen with &hellip; (default tail) at the end if needed.
 453   *
 454   * If $format is not "raw", we make sure to not cut in the middle of an
 455   * HTML entity, so that strmaxlen('1&amp;2', 3, NULL, 'formvalue') will not
 456   * become/stay '1&amp;&hellip;'.
 457   *
 458   * @param string
 459   * @param int Maximum length
 460   * @param string Tail to use, when string gets cropped. Its length gets
 461   *               substracted from the total length (with HTML entities
 462   *               being decoded). Default is "&hellip;" (HTML entity)
 463   * @param string Format, see {@link format_to_output()}
 464   * @param boolean Crop at whitespace, if possible?
 465   *        (any word split at the end will get its head removed)
 466   * @return string
 467   */
 468  function strmaxlen( $str, $maxlen = 50, $tail = NULL, $format = 'raw', $cut_at_whitespace = false  )
 469  {
 470      if( is_null($tail) )
 471      {
 472          $tail = '&hellip;';
 473      }
 474  
 475      $str = utf8_rtrim($str);
 476  
 477      if( utf8_strlen( $str ) > $maxlen )
 478      {
 479          // Replace all HTML entities by a single char. html_entity_decode for example
 480          // would not handle &hellip;.
 481          $tail_for_length = preg_replace('~&\w+?;~', '.', $tail);
 482          $tail_length = utf8_strlen( html_entity_decode($tail_for_length) );
 483          $len = $maxlen-$tail_length;
 484          if( $len < 1 )
 485          { // special case; $tail length is >= $maxlen
 486              $len = 0;
 487          }
 488          $str_cropped = utf8_substr( $str, 0, $len );
 489          if( $format != 'raw' )
 490          { // if the format isn't raw we make sure that we do not cut in the middle of an HTML entity
 491              $maxlen_entity = 7; # "&amp;" is 5, min 3!
 492              $str_inspect = utf8_substr($str_cropped, 1-$maxlen_entity);
 493              $pos_amp = utf8_strpos($str_inspect, '&');
 494              if( $pos_amp !== false )
 495              { // there's an ampersand at the end of the cropped string
 496                  $look_until = $pos_amp;
 497                  $str_cropped_len = utf8_strlen($str_cropped);
 498                  if( $str_cropped_len < $maxlen_entity )
 499                  { // we have to look at least for the length of an entity
 500                      $look_until += $maxlen_entity-$str_cropped_len;
 501                  }
 502                  if( strpos(utf8_substr($str, $len, $look_until), ';') !== false )
 503                  {
 504                      $str_cropped = utf8_substr( $str, 0, $len-utf8_strlen($str_inspect)+$pos_amp);
 505                  }
 506              }
 507          }
 508  
 509          if( $cut_at_whitespace )
 510          {
 511              // Get the first character being cut off. Note: we can't use $str[index] in case of utf8 strings!
 512              $first_cut_off_char = utf8_substr( $str, utf8_strlen( $str_cropped ), 1 );
 513              if( ! ctype_space( $first_cut_off_char ) )
 514              { // first character being cut off is not whitespace
 515                  // Get the chars as an array from the cropped string to be able to get chars by position
 516                  $str_cropped_chars = preg_split('//u',$str_cropped, -1, PREG_SPLIT_NO_EMPTY);
 517                  $i = utf8_strlen($str_cropped);
 518                  while( $i && isset( $str_cropped_chars[ --$i ] ) && ! ctype_space( $str_cropped_chars[ $i ] ) )
 519                  {}
 520                  if( $i )
 521                  {
 522                      $str_cropped = utf8_substr($str_cropped, 0, $i);
 523                  }
 524              }
 525          }
 526  
 527          $str = format_to_output(utf8_rtrim($str_cropped), $format);
 528          $str .= $tail;
 529  
 530          return $str;
 531      }
 532      else
 533      {
 534          return format_to_output($str, $format);
 535      }
 536  }

 538  
 539  /**
 540   * Crop string to maxwords preserving tags.
 541   *
 542   * @param string
 543   * @param int Maximum number words
 544   * @param mixed array Optional parameters
 545   * @return string
 546   */
 547  function strmaxwords( $str, $maxwords = 50, $params = array() )
 548  {
 549      $params = array_merge( array(
 550              'continued_link' => '',
 551              'continued_text' => '&hellip;',
 552              'always_continue' => false,
 553          ), $params );
 554      $open = false;
 555      $have_seen_non_whitespace = false;
 556      $end = utf8_strlen( $str );
 557      for( $i = 0; $i < $end; $i++ )
 558      {
 559          switch( $char = $str[$i] )
 560          {
 561              case '<' :    // start of a tag
 562                  $open = true;
 563                  break;
 564              case '>' : // end of a tag
 565                  $open = false;
 566                  break;
 567  
 568              case ctype_space($char):
 569                  if( ! $open )
 570                  { // it's a word gap
 571                      // Eat any other whitespace.
 572                      while( isset($str[$i+1]) && ctype_space($str[$i+1]) )
 573                      {
 574                          $i++;
 575                      }
 576                      if( isset($str[$i+1]) && $have_seen_non_whitespace )
 577                      { // only decrement words, if there's a non-space char left.
 578                          --$maxwords;
 579                      }
 580                  }
 581                  break;
 582  
 583              default:
 584                  $have_seen_non_whitespace = true;
 585                  break;
 586          }
 587          if( $maxwords < 1 ) break;
 588      }
 589  
 590      // restrict content to required number of words and balance the tags out
 591      $str = balance_tags( utf8_substr( $str, 0, $i ) );
 592  
 593      if( $params['always_continue'] || $maxwords == false )
 594      { // we want a continued text
 595          if( $params['continued_link'] )
 596          { // we have a url
 597              $str .= ' <a href="'.$params['continued_link'].'">'.$params['continued_text'].'</a>';
 598          }
 599          else
 600          { // we don't have a url
 601              $str .= ' '.$params['continued_text'];
 602          }
 603      }
 604      // remove empty tags
 605      $str = preg_replace( '~<([\s]+?)[^>]*?></\1>~is', '', $str );
 606  
 607      return $str;
 608  }

 611  /**
 612   * Convert all non ASCII chars (except if UTF-8, GB2312 or CP1251) to &#nnnn; unicode references.
 613   * Also convert entities to &#nnnn; unicode references if output is not HTML (eg XML)
 614   *
 615   * Preserves < > and quotes.
 616   *
 617   * fplanque: simplified
 618   * sakichan: pregs instead of loop
 619   */
 620  function convert_chars( $content, $flag = 'html' )
 621  {
 622      global $b2_htmltrans, $evo_charset;
 623  
 624      /**
 625       * Translation of invalid Unicode references range to valid range.
 626       * These are Windows CP1252 specific characters.
 627       * They would look weird on non-Windows browsers.
 628       * If you've ever pasted text from MSWord, you'll understand.
 629       *
 630       * You should not have to change this.
 631       */
 632      static $b2_htmltranswinuni = array(
 633          '&#128;' => '&#8364;', // the Euro sign
 634          '&#130;' => '&#8218;',
 635          '&#131;' => '&#402;',
 636          '&#132;' => '&#8222;',
 637          '&#133;' => '&#8230;',
 638          '&#134;' => '&#8224;',
 639          '&#135;' => '&#8225;',
 640          '&#136;' => '&#710;',
 641          '&#137;' => '&#8240;',
 642          '&#138;' => '&#352;',
 643          '&#139;' => '&#8249;',
 644          '&#140;' => '&#338;',
 645          '&#142;' => '&#382;',
 646          '&#145;' => '&#8216;',
 647          '&#146;' => '&#8217;',
 648          '&#147;' => '&#8220;',
 649          '&#148;' => '&#8221;',
 650          '&#149;' => '&#8226;',
 651          '&#150;' => '&#8211;',
 652          '&#151;' => '&#8212;',
 653          '&#152;' => '&#732;',
 654          '&#153;' => '&#8482;',
 655          '&#154;' => '&#353;',
 656          '&#155;' => '&#8250;',
 657          '&#156;' => '&#339;',
 658          '&#158;' => '&#382;',
 659          '&#159;' => '&#376;'
 660      );
 661  
 662      // Convert highbyte non ASCII/UTF-8 chars to urefs:
 663      if( ! in_array(strtolower($evo_charset), array( 'utf8', 'utf-8', 'gb2312', 'windows-1251') ) )
 664      { // This is a single byte charset
 665          // fp> why do we actually bother doing this:?
 666          $content = preg_replace_callback(
 667              '/[\x80-\xff]/',
 668              create_function( '$j', 'return "&#".ord($j[0]).";";' ),
 669              $content);
 670      }
 671  
 672      // Convert Windows CP1252 => Unicode (valid HTML)
 673      // TODO: should this go to input conversions instead (?)
 674      $content = strtr( $content, $b2_htmltranswinuni );
 675  
 676      if( $flag == 'html' )
 677      { // we can use entities
 678          // Convert & chars that are not used in an entity
 679          $content = preg_replace('/&(?![#A-Za-z0-9]{2,20};)/', '&amp;', $content);
 680      }
 681      else
 682      { // unicode, xml...
 683          // Convert & chars that are not used in an entity
 684          $content = preg_replace('/&(?![#A-Za-z0-9]{2,20};)/', '&#38;', $content);
 685  
 686          // Convert HTML entities to urefs:
 687          $content = strtr($content, $b2_htmltrans);
 688      }
 689  
 690      return( $content );
 691  }
 692  
 693  
 694  /**
 695   * Get number of bytes in $string. This works around mbstring.func_overload, if
 696   * activated for strlen/mb_strlen.
 697   * @param string
 698   * @return int
 699   */
 700  function evo_bytes( $string )
 701  {
 702      $fo = ini_get('mbstring.func_overload');
 703      if( $fo && $fo & 2 && function_exists('mb_strlen') )
 704      { // overloading of strlen is enabled
 705          return mb_strlen( $string, 'ASCII' );
 706      }
 707      return strlen($string);
 708  }

 711  /**
 712   * mbstring wrapper for strtolower function
 713   *
 714   * @deprecated by {@link utf8_strtolower()}
 715   *
 716   * fp> TODO: instead of those "when used" ifs, it would make more sense to redefine
 717   * mb_strtolower beforehand if it doesn"t exist (it would then just be a fallback
 718   * to the strtolower + a Debuglog->add() )
 719   *
 720   * @param string
 721   * @return string
 722   */
 723  function evo_strtolower( $string )
 724  {
 725      global $current_charset;
 726  
 727      if( $current_charset != 'iso-8859-1' && $current_charset != '' && function_exists('mb_strtolower') )
 728      {
 729          return mb_strtolower( $string, $current_charset );
 730      }
 731  
 732      return strtolower($string);
 733  }

 742   * @return string
 743   */
 744  function evo_strlen( $string )
 745  {
 746      global $current_charset;
 747  
 748      if( $current_charset != 'iso-8859-1' && $current_charset != '' && function_exists('mb_strlen') )
 749      {
 750          return mb_strlen( $string, $current_charset );
 751      }
 752  
 753      return strlen($string);

 756  /**
 757   * mbstring wrapper for strpos function
 758   *
 759   * @deprecated by {@link utf8_strpos()}
 760   *
 761   * @param string
 762   * @param string
 763   * @return int
 764   */
 765  function evo_strpos( $string , $needle , $offset = null )
 766  {
 767      global $current_charset;
 768  
 769      if( $current_charset != 'iso-8859-1' && $current_charset != '' && function_exists('mb_strpos') )
 770      {
 771          return mb_strpos( $string, $needle, $offset ,$current_charset );
 772      }
 773  
 774      return strpos( $string , $needle , $offset );
 775  }

 778  /**
 779   * mbstring wrapper for substr function
 780   *
 781   * @deprecated by {@link utf8_substr()}
 782   *
 783   * @param string
 784   * @param int start position
 785   * @param int string length
 786   * @return string
 787   */
 788  function evo_substr( $string, $start = 0, $length = '#' )
 789  {
 790      global $current_charset;
 791  
 792      if( ! $length )
 793      { // make mb_substr and substr behave consistently (mb_substr returns string for length=0)
 794          return '';
 795      }
 796      if( $length == '#' )
 797      {
 798          $length = utf8_strlen($string);
 799      }
 800  
 801      if( $current_charset != 'iso-8859-1' && $current_charset != '' && function_exists('mb_substr') )
 802      {
 803          return mb_substr( $string, $start, $length, $current_charset );
 804      }
 805  
 806      return substr( $string, $start, $length );
 807  }

 810  /**
 811   * Split $text into blocks by using $pattern and call $callback on the non-matching blocks.
 812   *
 813   * The non-matching block's text is the first param to $callback and additionally $params gets passed.
 814   *
 815   * This gets used to make links clickable or replace smilies.
 816   *
 817   * E.g., to replace only in non-HTML tags, call it like:
 818   * <code>callback_on_non_matching_blocks( $text, '~<[^>]*>~s', 'your_callback' );</code>
 819   *
 820   * {@internal This function gets tested in misc.funcs.simpletest.php.}}
 821   *
 822   * @param string Text to handle
 823   * @param string Regular expression pattern that defines blocks to exclude.
 824   * @param callback Function name or object/method array to use as callback.
 825   *               Each non-matching block gets passed as first param, additional params may be
 826   *               passed with $params.
 827   * @param array Of additional ("static") params to $callback.
 828   * @return string
 829   */
 830  function callback_on_non_matching_blocks( $text, $pattern, $callback, $params = array() )
 831  {
 832      if( preg_match_all( $pattern, $text, $matches, PREG_OFFSET_CAPTURE | PREG_PATTERN_ORDER ) )
 833      {    // $pattern matches, call the callback method on full text except of matching blocks
 834  
 835          // Create an unique string in order to replace all matching blocks temporarily
 836          $unique_replacement = md5( mktime() + rand() );
 837  
 838          $matches_search = array();
 839          $matches_replace = array();
 840          foreach( $matches[0] as $l => $l_matching )
 841          {    // Build arrays with a source code of the matching blocks and with temporary replacement
 842              $matches_source[] = $l_matching[0];
 843              $matches_temp[] = '?'.$l.$unique_replacement.$l.'?';
 844          }
 845  
 846          // Replace all matching blocks with temporary text like '?X219a33da9c1b8f4e335bffc015df8c96X?'
 847          // where X is index of match block in array $matches[0]
 848          // It is used to avoid any changes in the matching blocks
 849          $text = str_ireplace( $matches_source, $matches_temp, $text );
 850  
 851          // Callback:
 852          $callback_params = $params;
 853          array_unshift( $callback_params, $text );
 854          $text = call_user_func_array( $callback, $callback_params );
 855  
 856          // Revert a source code of the matching blocks in content
 857          $text = str_ireplace( $matches_temp, $matches_source, $text );
 858  
 859          return $text;
 860      }
 861  
 862      $callback_params = $params;
 863      array_unshift( $callback_params, $text );
 864      return call_user_func_array( $callback, $callback_params );
 865  }
 866  
 867  
 868  /**
 869   * Replace content outside blocks <code></code>, <pre></pre> and markdown codeblocks
 870   *
 871   * @param array|string Search list
 872   * @param array|string Replace list
 873   * @param string Source content
 874   * @param string Callback function name
 875   * @param string Type of callback function: 'preg' -> preg_replace(), 'str' -> str_replace() (@see replace_content())
 876   * @return string Replaced content
 877   */
 878  function replace_content_outcode( $search, $replace, $content, $replace_function_callback = 'replace_content', $replace_function_type = 'preg' )
 879  {
 880      if( !empty( $search ) )
 881      {
 882          if( stristr( $content, '<code' ) !== false || stristr( $content, '<pre' ) !== false || strstr( $content, '`' ) !== false )
 883          { // Call replace_content() on everything outside code/pre and markdown codeblocks:
 884              $content = callback_on_non_matching_blocks( $content,
 885                  '~(`|<(code|pre)[^>]*>).*?(\1|</\2>)~is',
 886                  $replace_function_callback, array( $search, $replace, $replace_function_type ) );
 887          }
 888          else
 889          { // No code/pre blocks, replace on the whole thing
 890              $content = call_user_func( $replace_function_callback, $content, $search, $replace, $replace_function_type );
 891          }
 892      }
 893  
 894      return $content;
 895  }
 896  
 897  
 898  /**
 899   * Replace content, Used for function callback_on_non_matching_blocks(), because there is different order of params
 900   *
 901   * @param string Source content
 902   * @param array|string Search list
 903   * @param array|string Replace list
 904   * @param string Type of function: 'preg' -> preg_replace(), 'str' -> str_replace()
 905   * @return string Replaced content
 906   */
 907  function replace_content( $content, $search, $replace, $type = 'preg' )
 908  {
 909      if( $type == 'str' )
 910      {
 911          return str_replace( $search, $replace, $content );
 912      }
 913      else
 914      {
 915          return preg_replace( $search, $replace, $content );
 916      }
 917  }

 920  /**
 921   * Replace content by callback, Used for function callback_on_non_matching_blocks(), because there is different order of params
 922   *
 923   * @param string Source content
 924   * @param array|string Search list
 925   * @param array|string Replace callback
 926   * @return string Replaced content
 927   */
 928  function replace_content_callback( $content, $search, $replace_callback )
 929  {
 930      return preg_replace_callback( $search, $replace_callback, $content );
 931  }

 933  
 934  /**
 935   * Split a content by separators outside <code> and <pre> blocks
 936   *
 937   * @param string|array Separators
 938   * @param string Content
 939   * @param boolean TRUE - parenthesized expression of separator will be captured and returned as well
 940   * @return array The result of explode() function
 941   */
 942  function split_outcode( $separators, $content, $capture_separator = false )
 943  {
 944      // Check if the separators exists in content
 945      if( ! is_array( $separators ) )
 946      { // Convert string to array with one element
 947          $separators = array( $separators );
 948      }
 949      $separators_exists = false;
 950      if( is_array( $separators ) )
 951      { // Find in array
 952          foreach( $separators as $separator )
 953          {
 954              if( strpos( $content, $separator ) !== false )
 955              { // Separator is found
 956                  $separators_exists = true;
 957                  break;
 958              }
 959          }
 960      }
 961  
 962      if( $separators_exists )
 963      { // There are separators in content, Split the content:
 964  
 965          // Initialize temp values for replace the separators
 966          if( $capture_separator )
 967          {
 968              $rplc_separators = array();
 969              foreach( $separators as $s => $separator )
 970              {
 971                  $rplc_separators[] = '#separator'.$s.'='.md5( rand() ).'#';
 972              }
 973          }
 974          else
 975          {
 976              $rplc_separators = '#separator='.md5( rand() ).'#';
 977          }
 978          // Replace the content separators with temp value
 979          if( strpos( $content, '<code' ) !== false || strpos( $content, '<pre' ) !== false )
 980          { // Call replace_separators_callback() on everything outside code/pre:
 981              $content = callback_on_non_matching_blocks( $content,
 982                  '~<(code|pre)[^>]*>.*?</\1>~is',
 983                  'replace_content', array( $separators, $rplc_separators, 'str' ) );
 984          }
 985          else
 986          { // No code/pre blocks, replace on the whole thing
 987              $content = str_replace( $separators, $rplc_separators, $content );
 988          }
 989  
 990          if( $capture_separator )
 991          { // Save the separators
 992              $split_regexp = '~('.implode( '|', $rplc_separators ).')~s';
 993              $content_parts = preg_split( $split_regexp, $content, -1, PREG_SPLIT_DELIM_CAPTURE );
 994              foreach( $content_parts as $c => $content_part )
 995              {
 996                  if( ( $s = array_search( $content_part, $rplc_separators ) ) !== false )
 997                  { // Replace original separator back
 998                      $content_parts[ $c ] = $separators[ $s ];
 999                  }
1000              }
1001              return $content_parts;
1002          }
1003          else
1004          { // Return only splitted content(without separators)
1005              return explode( $rplc_separators, $content );
1006          }
1007      }
1008      else
1009      { // No separators in content, Return whole content as one element of array
1010          return array( $content );
1011      }
1012  }
1013  
1014  
1015  /**
1016   * Make links clickable in a given text.
1017   *
1018   * It replaces only text which is not between <a> tags already.
1019   *
1020   * @todo dh> this should not replace links in tags! currently fails for something
1021   *           like '<img src=" http://example.com/" />' (not usual though!)
1022   * fp> I am trying to address this by not replacing anything inside tags
1023   * fp> This should be replaced by a clean state machine (one single variable for current state)
1024   *
1025   * {@internal This function gets tested in misc.funcs.simpletest.php.}}
1026   *
1027   * @param string Text
1028   * @param string Url delimeter
1029   * @param string Callback function name
1030   * @param string Additional attributes for tag <a>
1031   * @return string
1032   */
1033  function make_clickable( $text, $moredelim = '&amp;', $callback = 'make_clickable_callback', $additional_attrs = '' )
1034  {
1035      $r = '';
1036      $inside_tag = false;
1037      $in_a_tag = false;
1038      $in_code_tag = false;
1039      $in_tag_quote = false;
1040      $from_pos = 0;
1041      $i = 0;
1042      $n = strlen($text);
1043  
1044      // Not using callback_on_non_matching_blocks(), because it requires
1045      // wellformed HTML and the implementation below should be
1046      // faster and less memory intensive (tested for some example content)
1047      while( $i < $n )
1048      {    // Go through each char in string... (we will fast forward from tag to tag)
1049          if( $inside_tag )
1050          {    // State: We're currently inside some tag:
1051              switch( $text[$i] )
1052              {
1053                  case '>':
1054                      if( $in_tag_quote )
1055                      { // This is in a quoted string so it doesn't really matter...
1056                          break;
1057                      }
1058                      // end of tag:
1059                      $inside_tag = false;
1060                      $r .= substr($text, $from_pos, $i-$from_pos+1);
1061                      $from_pos = $i+1;
1062                      // $r .= '}';
1063                      break;
1064  
1065                  case '"':
1066                  case '\'':
1067                      // This is the beginning or the end of a quoted string:
1068                      if( ! $in_tag_quote )
1069                      {
1070                          $in_tag_quote = $text[$i];
1071                      }
1072                      elseif( $in_tag_quote == $text[$i] )
1073                      {
1074                          $in_tag_quote = false;
1075                      }
1076                      break;
1077              }
1078          }
1079          elseif( $in_a_tag )
1080          {    // In a link but no longer inside <a>...</a> tag or any other embedded tag like <strong> or whatever
1081              switch( $text[$i] )
1082              {
1083                  case '<':
1084                      if( strtolower(substr($text, $i+1, 3)) == '/a>' )
1085                      {    // Ok, this is the end tag of the link:
1086                          // $r .= substr($text, $from_pos, $i-$from_pos+4);
1087                          // $from_pos = $i+4;
1088                          $i += 4;
1089                          // pre_dump( 'END A TAG: '.substr($text, $from_pos, $i-$from_pos) );
1090                          $r .= substr($text, $from_pos, $i-$from_pos);
1091                          $from_pos = $i;
1092                          $in_a_tag = false;
1093                          $in_tag_quote = false;
1094                      }
1095                      break;
1096              }
1097          }
1098          elseif( $in_code_tag )
1099          {    // In a code but no longer inside <code>...</code> tag or any other embedded tag like <strong> or whatever
1100              switch( $text[$i] )
1101              {
1102                  case '<':
1103                      if( strtolower(substr($text, $i+1, 5)) == '/code' )
1104                      {    // Ok, this is the end tag of the code:
1105                          // $r .= substr($text, $from_pos, $i-$from_pos+4);
1106                          // $from_pos = $i+4;
1107                          $i += 7;
1108                          // pre_dump( 'END A TAG: '.substr($text, $from_pos, $i-$from_pos) );
1109                          $r .= substr($text, $from_pos, $i-$from_pos);
1110                          $from_pos = $i;
1111                          $in_code_tag = false;
1112                          $in_tag_quote = false;
1113                      }
1114                      break;
1115              }
1116          }
1117          else
1118          { // State: we're not currently in any tag:
1119              // Find next tag opening:
1120              $i = strpos($text, '<', $i);
1121              if( $i === false )
1122              { // No more opening tags:
1123                  break;
1124              }
1125  
1126              $inside_tag = true;
1127              $in_tag_quote = false;
1128              // s$r .= '{'.$text[$i+1];
1129  
1130              if( ($text[$i+1] == 'a' || $text[$i+1] == 'A') && ctype_space($text[$i+2]) )
1131              { // opening "A" tag
1132                  $in_a_tag = true;
1133              }
1134  
1135              if( ( substr( $text, $i+1, 4 ) == 'code') )
1136              { // opening "code" tag
1137                  $in_code_tag = true;
1138              }
1139  
1140              // Make the text before the opening < clickable:
1141              if( is_array($callback) )
1142              {
1143                  $r .= $callback[0]->$callback[1]( substr($text, $from_pos, $i-$from_pos), $moredelim, $additional_attrs );
1144              }
1145              else
1146              {
1147                  $r .= $callback( substr($text, $from_pos, $i-$from_pos), $moredelim, $additional_attrs );
1148              }
1149              $from_pos = $i;
1150  
1151              // $i += 2;
1152          }
1153  
1154          $i++;
1155      }
1156  
1157      // the remaining part:
1158      if( $in_a_tag )
1159      { // may happen for invalid html:
1160          $r .= substr($text, $from_pos);
1161      }
1162      else
1163      {    // Make remplacements in the remaining part:
1164          if( is_array($callback) )
1165          {
1166              $r .= $callback[0]->$callback[1]( substr($text, $from_pos), $moredelim, $additional_attrs );
1167          }
1168          else
1169          {
1170              $r .= $callback( substr($text, $from_pos), $moredelim, $additional_attrs );
1171          }
1172      }
1173  
1174      return $r;
1175  }
1176  
1177  
1178  /**
1179   * Callback function for {@link make_clickable()}.
1180   *
1181   * original function: phpBB, extended here for AIM & ICQ
1182   * fplanque restricted :// to http:// and mailto://
1183   * Fixed to not include trailing dot and comma.
1184   *
1185   * fp> I'm thinking of moving this into the autolinks plugin (only place where it's used)
1186   *     and break it up into something more systematic.
1187   *
1188   * @param string Text
1189   * @param string Url delimeter
1190   * @param string Additional attributes for tag <a>
1191   * @return string The clickable text.
1192   */
1193  function make_clickable_callback( $text, $moredelim = '&amp;', $additional_attrs = '' )
1194  {
1195      if( !empty( $additional_attrs ) )
1196      {
1197          $additional_attrs = ' '.trim( $additional_attrs );
1198      }
1199      //return $text;
1200      /*preg_match( '/<code>([.\r\n]+?)<\/code>/i', $text, $matches );
1201      pre_dump( $text, $matches );*/
1202  
1203      $pattern_domain = '([\p{L}0-9\-]+\.[\p{L}0-9\-.\~]+)'; // a domain name (not very strict)
1204      $text = preg_replace(
1205          /* Tblue> I removed the double quotes from the first RegExp because
1206                    it made URLs in tag attributes clickable.
1207                    See http://forums.b2evolution.net/viewtopic.php?p=92073 */
1208          array( '#(^|[\s>\(]|\[url=)(https?|mailto)://([^<>{}\s]+[^.,:;!\?<>{}\s\]\)])#i',
1209              '#(^|[\s>\(]|\[url=)aim:([^,<\s\]\)]+)#i',
1210              '#(^|[\s>\(]|\[url=)icq:(\d+)#i',
1211              '#(^|[\s>\(]|\[url=)www\.'.$pattern_domain.'([^<>{}\s]*[^.,:;!\?\s\]\)])#i',
1212              '#(^|[\s>\(]|\[url=)([a-z0-9\-_.]+?)@'.$pattern_domain.'([^.,:;!\?<\s\]\)]+)#i', ),
1213          array( '$1<a href="$2://$3"'.$additional_attrs.'>$2://$3</a>',
1214              '$1<a href="aim:goim?screenname=$2$3'.$moredelim.'message='.rawurlencode(T_('Hello')).'"'.$additional_attrs.'>$2$3</a>',
1215              '$1<a href="http://wwp.icq.com/scripts/search.dll?to=$2"'.$additional_attrs.'>$2</a>',
1216              '$1<a href="http://www.$2$3$4"'.$additional_attrs.'>www.$2$3$4</a>',
1217              '$1<a href="mailto:$2@$3$4"'.$additional_attrs.'>$2@$3$4</a>', ),
1218          $text );
1219  
1220      return $text;
1221  }

1225  
1226  /**
1227   * Convert timestamp to MySQL/ISO format.
1228   *
1229   * @param integer UNIX timestamp
1230   * @return string Date formatted as "Y-m-d H:i:s"
1231   */
1232  function date2mysql( $ts )
1233  {
1234      return date( 'Y-m-d H:i:s', $ts );
1235  }
1236  
1237  /**
1238   * Convert a MYSQL date to a UNIX timestamp.
1239   *
1240   * @param string Date formatted as "Y-m-d H:i:s"
1241   * @param boolean true to use GM time
1242   * @return integer UNIX timestamp
1243   */
1244  function mysql2timestamp( $m, $useGM = false )
1245  {
1246      $func = $useGM ? 'gmmktime' : 'mktime';
1247      return $func( substr( $m, 11, 2 ), substr( $m, 14, 2 ), substr( $m, 17, 2 ), substr( $m, 5, 2 ), substr( $m, 8, 2 ), substr( $m, 0, 4 ) );
1248  }
1249  
1250  /**
1251   * Convert a MYSQL date -- WITHOUT the time -- to a UNIX timestamp
1252   *
1253   * @param string Date formatted as "Y-m-d"
1254   * @param boolean true to use GM time
1255   * @return integer UNIX timestamp
1256   */
1257  function mysql2datestamp( $m, $useGM = false )
1258  {
1259      $func = $useGM ? 'gmmktime' : 'mktime';
1260      return $func( 0, 0, 0, substr($m,5,2), substr($m,8,2), substr($m,0,4) );
1261  }
1262  
1263  /**
1264   * Format a MYSQL date to current locale date format.
1265   *
1266   * @param string MYSQL date YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS
1267   */
1268  function mysql2localedate( $mysqlstring )
1269  {
1270      return mysql2date( locale_datefmt(), $mysqlstring );
1271  }
1272  
1273  function mysql2localetime( $mysqlstring )
1274  {
1275      return mysql2date( locale_timefmt(), $mysqlstring );
1276  }
1277  
1278  function mysql2localedatetime( $mysqlstring )
1279  {
1280      return mysql2date( locale_datefmt().' '.locale_timefmt(), $mysqlstring );
1281  }
1282  
1283  function mysql2localedatetime_spans( $mysqlstring, $datefmt = NULL, $timefmt = NULL )
1284  {
1285      if( is_null( $datefmt ) )
1286      {
1287          $datefmt = locale_datefmt();
1288      }
1289      if( is_null( $timefmt ) )
1290      {
1291          $timefmt = locale_timefmt();
1292      }
1293  
1294      return '<span class="date">'
1295                      .mysql2date( $datefmt, $mysqlstring )
1296                      .'</span> <span class="time">'
1297                      .mysql2date( $timefmt, $mysqlstring )
1298                      .'</span>';
1299  }
1300  
1301  
1302  /**
1303   * Format a MYSQL date.
1304   *
1305   * @param string enhanced format string
1306   * @param string MYSQL date YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS
1307   * @param boolean true to use GM time
1308   */
1309  function mysql2date( $dateformatstring, $mysqlstring, $useGM = false )
1310  {
1311      $m = $mysqlstring;
1312      if( empty($m) || ($m == '0000-00-00 00:00:00' ) )
1313          return false;
1314  
1315      // Get a timestamp:
1316      $unixtimestamp = mysql2timestamp( $m );
1317  
1318      return date_i18n( $dateformatstring, $unixtimestamp, $useGM );
1319  }
1320  
1321  
1322  /**
1323   * Date internationalization: same as date() formatting but with i18n support.
1324   *
1325   * @todo dh> support for MySQL date format instead of $unixtimestamp? This would simplify callees, where currently mktime() is used.
1326   * @param string enhanced format string
1327   * @param integer UNIX timestamp
1328   * @param boolean true to use GM time
1329   */
1330  function date_i18n( $dateformatstring, $unixtimestamp, $useGM = false )
1331  {
1332      global $month, $month_abbrev, $weekday, $weekday_abbrev, $weekday_letter;
1333      global $localtimenow, $time_difference;
1334  
1335      if( $dateformatstring == 'isoZ' )
1336      { // full ISO 8601 format
1337          $dateformatstring = 'Y-m-d\TH:i:s\Z';
1338      }
1339  
1340      if( $useGM )
1341      { // We want a Greenwich Meridian time:
1342          // TODO: dh> what's the point of the substraction? UNIX timestamp should contain no time_difference in the first place?! Otherwise it should be substracted for !$useGM, too.
1343          // TODO: dh> Why does $useGM do not get the special symbols handling?
1344          $r = gmdate($dateformatstring, ($unixtimestamp - $time_difference));
1345      }
1346      else
1347      { // We want default timezone time:
1348  
1349          /*
1350          Special symbols:
1351              'b': wether it's today (1) or not (0)
1352              'l': weekday
1353              'D': weekday abbrev
1354              'e': weekday letter
1355              'F': month
1356              'M': month abbrev
1357          */
1358  
1359          #echo $dateformatstring, '<br />';
1360  
1361          // protect special symbols, that date() would need proper locale set for
1362          $protected_dateformatstring = preg_replace( '/(?<!\\\)([blDeFM])/', '@@@\\\$1@@@', $dateformatstring );
1363  
1364          #echo $protected_dateformatstring, '<br />';
1365  
1366          $r = date( $protected_dateformatstring, $unixtimestamp );
1367  
1368          if( $protected_dateformatstring != $dateformatstring )
1369          { // we had special symbols, replace them
1370  
1371              $istoday = ( date('Ymd',$unixtimestamp) == date('Ymd',$localtimenow) ) ? '1' : '0';
1372              $datemonth = date('m', $unixtimestamp);
1373              $dateweekday = date('w', $unixtimestamp);
1374  
1375              // replace special symbols
1376              $r = str_replace( array(
1377                          '@@@b@@@',
1378                          '@@@l@@@',
1379                          '@@@D@@@',
1380                          '@@@e@@@',
1381                          '@@@F@@@',
1382                          '@@@M@@@',
1383                          ),
1384                      array( $istoday,
1385                          trim(T_($weekday[$dateweekday])),
1386                          trim(T_($weekday_abbrev[$dateweekday])),
1387                          trim(T_($weekday_letter[$dateweekday])),
1388                          trim(T_($month[$datemonth])),
1389                          trim(T_($month_abbrev[$datemonth])) ),
1390                      $r );
1391          }
1392      }
1393  
1394      return $r;
1395  }
1396

1398  /**
1399   * Add given # of days to a timestamp
1400   *
1401   * @param integer timestamp
1402   * @param integer days
1403   * @return integer timestamp
1404   */
1405  function date_add_days( $timestamp, $days )
1406  {
1407      return mktime( date('H',$timestamp), date('m',$timestamp), date('s',$timestamp),
1408                                  date('m',$timestamp), date('d',$timestamp)+$days, date('Y',$timestamp)  );
1409  }

1411  /**
1412   * Format dates into a string in a way similar to sprintf()
1413   */
1414  function date_sprintf( $string, $timestamp )
1415  {
1416      global $date_sprintf_timestamp;
1417      $date_sprintf_timestamp = $timestamp;
1418  
1419      return preg_replace_callback( '/%\{(.*?)\}/', 'date_sprintf_callback', $string );
1420  }
1421  
1422  function date_sprintf_callback( $matches )
1423  {
1424      global $date_sprintf_timestamp;
1425  
1426      return date_i18n( $matches[1], $date_sprintf_timestamp );
1427  }

1429  
1430  /**
1431   * Get date name when date was happened
1432   *
1433   * @param integer Timestamp
1434   * @return string Name of date (Today, Yesterday, x days ago, x months ago, x years ago)
1435   */
1436  function date_ago( $timestamp )
1437  {
1438      global $servertimenow;
1439  
1440      $days = floor( ( $servertimenow - $timestamp ) / 86400 );
1441      $months = ceil( $days / 31 );
1442  
1443      if( $days < 1 )
1444      {    // Today
1445          return T_('Today');
1446      }
1447      elseif( $days == 1 )
1448      {    // Yesterday
1449          return T_('Yesterday');
1450      }
1451      elseif( $days > 1 && $days <= 31 )
1452      {    // Days
1453          return sprintf( T_('%s days ago'), $days );
1454      }
1455      elseif( $days > 31 && $months <= 12 )
1456      {    // Months
1457          return sprintf( $months == 1 ? T_('%s month ago') : T_('%s months ago'), $months );
1458      }
1459      else
1460      {    // Years
1461          $years = floor( $months / 12 );
1462          return sprintf( $years == 1 ? T_('%s year ago') : T_('%s years ago'), $years );
1463      }
1464  }
1465  
1466  
1467  /**
1468   * Convert seconds to readable period
1469   *
1470   * @param integer Seconds
1471   * @return string Readable time period
1472   */
1473  function seconds_to_period( $seconds )
1474  {
1475      $periods = array(
1476          array( 31536000, T_('1 year'),   T_('%s years') ), // 365 days
1477          array( 2592000,  T_('1 month'),  T_('%s months') ), // 30 days
1478          array( 86400,    T_('1 day'),    T_('%s days') ),
1479          array( 3600,     T_('1 hour'),   T_('%s hours') ),
1480          array( 60,       T_('1 minute'), T_('%s minutes') ),
1481          array( 1,        T_('1 second'), T_('%s seconds') ),
1482      );
1483  
1484      foreach( $periods as $p_info )
1485      {
1486          $period_value = intval( $seconds / $p_info[0] * 10 ) /10;
1487          if( $period_value >= 1 )
1488          { // Stop on this period
1489              if( $period_value == 1 )
1490              { // One unit of period
1491                  $period_text = $p_info[1];
1492              }
1493              else
1494              { // Two and more units of period
1495                  $period_text = sprintf( $p_info[2], $period_value );
1496              }
1497              break;
1498          }
1499      }
1500  
1501      if( !isset( $period_text ) )
1502      { // 0 seconds
1503          $period_text = sprintf( T_('%s seconds'), 0 );
1504      }
1505  
1506      return $period_text;
1507  }

1509  
1510  /**
1511   * Converts an ISO 8601 date to MySQL DateTime format.
1512   *
1513   * @param string date and time in ISO 8601 format {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601}.
1514   * @return string date and time in MySQL DateTime format Y-m-d H:i:s.
1515   */
1516  function iso8601_to_datetime( $iso_date )
1517  {
1518      return preg_replace('#([0-9]{4})([0-9]{2})([0-9]{2})T([0-9]{2}):([0-9]{2}):([0-9]{2})(Z|[\+|\-][0-9]{2,4}){0,1}#', '$1-$2-$3 $4:$5:$6', $iso_date);
1519  }
1520  
1521  
1522  /**
1523   * Converts a MySQL DateTime to ISO 8601 date format.
1524   *
1525   * @param string date and time in MySQL DateTime format Y-m-d H:i:s
1526   * @return string date and time in ISO 8601 format {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601}.
1527   */
1528  function datetime_to_iso8601( $datetime, $useGM = false )
1529  {
1530      $iso_date = mysql2date('U', $datetime);
1531  
1532      if( $useGM )
1533      {
1534          $iso_date = gmdate('Ymd', $iso_date).'T'.gmdate('H:i:s', $iso_date);
1535      }
1536      else
1537      {
1538          $iso_date = date('Ymd', $iso_date).'T'.date('H:i:s', $iso_date);
1539      }
1540  
1541      return $iso_date;
1542  }
1543  
1544  
1545  /**
1546   *
1547   * @param integer year
1548   * @param integer month (0-53)
1549   * @param integer 0 for sunday, 1 for monday
1550   */
1551  function get_start_date_for_week( $year, $week, $startofweek )
1552  {
1553      $new_years_date = mktime( 0, 0, 0, 1, 1, $year );
1554      $weekday = date('w', $new_years_date);
1555      // echo '<br> 1st day is a: '.$weekday;
1556  
1557      // How many days until start of week:
1558      $days_to_new_week = (7 - $weekday + $startofweek) % 7;
1559      // echo '<br> days to new week: '.$days_to_new_week;
1560  
1561      // We now add the required number of days to find the 1st sunday/monday in the year:
1562      //$first_week_start_date = $new_years_date + $days_to_new_week * 86400;
1563      //echo '<br> 1st week starts on '.date( 'Y-m-d H:i:s', $first_week_start_date );
1564  
1565      // We add the number of requested weeks:
1566      // This will fail when passing to Daylight Savings Time: $date = $first_week_start_date + (($week-1) * 604800);
1567      $date = mktime( 0, 0, 0, 1, $days_to_new_week + 1 + ($week-1) * 7, $year );
1568      // echo '<br> week '.$week.' starts on '.date( 'Y-m-d H:i:s', $date );
1569  
1570      return $date;
1571  }
1572  
1573  
1574  
1575  /**
1576   * Get start and end day of a week, based on day f the week and start-of-week
1577   *
1578   * Used by Calendar
1579   *
1580   * @param date
1581   * @param integer 0 for Sunday, 1 for Monday
1582   */
1583  function get_weekstartend( $date, $startOfWeek )
1584  {
1585      while( date('w', $date) <> $startOfWeek )
1586      {
1587          // echo '<br />'.date('Y-m-d H:i:s w', $date).' - '.$startOfWeek;
1588          // mktime is needed so calculations work for DST enabling. Example: March 30th 2008, start of week 0 sunday
1589          $date = mktime( 0, 0, 0, date('m',$date), date('d',$date)-1, date('Y',$date) );
1590      }
1591      // echo '<br />'.date('Y-m-d H:i:s w', $date).' = '.$startOfWeek;
1592      $week['start'] = $date;
1593      $week['end']   = $date + 604800; // 7 days
1594  
1595      // pre_dump( 'weekstartend: ', date( 'Y-m-d', $week['start'] ), date( 'Y-m-d', $week['end'] ) );
1596  
1597      return( $week );
1598  }

1600  
1601  /**
1602   * Get datetime rounded to lower minute. This is meant to remove seconds and
1603   * leverage MySQL's query cache by having SELECT queries remain identical for 60 seconds instead of just 1.
1604   *
1605   * @param integer UNIX timestamp
1606   * @param string Format (defaults to "Y-m-d H:i"). Use "U" for UNIX timestamp.
1607   */
1608  function remove_seconds($timestamp, $format = 'Y-m-d H:i')
1609  {
1610      return date($format, floor($timestamp/60)*60);
1611  }
1612  
1613  
1614  /**
1615   * Convert from seconds to months, days, hours, minutes and seconds
1616   *
1617   * @param integer duration in seconds
1618   * @return array of [ years, months, days, hours, minutes, seconds ]
1619   */
1620  function get_duration_fields( $duration )
1621  {
1622      $result = array();
1623  
1624      $year_seconds = 31536000; // 1 year
1625      $years = floor( $duration / $year_seconds );
1626      $duration = $duration - $years * $year_seconds;
1627      $result[ 'years' ] = $years;
1628  
1629      $month_seconds = 2592000; // 1 month
1630      $months = floor( $duration / $month_seconds );
1631      $duration = $duration - $months * $month_seconds;
1632      $result[ 'months' ] = $months;
1633  
1634      $day_seconds = 86400; // 1 day
1635      $days = floor( $duration / $day_seconds );
1636      $duration = $duration - $days * $day_seconds;
1637      $result[ 'days' ] = $days;
1638  
1639      $hour_seconds = 3600; // 1 hour
1640      $hours = floor( $duration / $hour_seconds );
1641      $duration = $duration - $hours * $hour_seconds;
1642      $result[ 'hours' ] = $hours;
1643  
1644      $minute_seconds = 60; // 1 minute
1645      $minutes = floor( $duration / $minute_seconds );
1646      $duration = $duration - $minutes * $minute_seconds;
1647      $result[ 'minutes' ] = $minutes;
1648  
1649      $result[ 'seconds' ] = $duration;
1650      return $result;
1651  }
1652  
1653  
1654  /**
1655   * Get a title of duration
1656   *
1657   * @param integer Duration in seconds
1658   * @param array Titles
1659   * @return string Duration title
1660   */
1661  function get_duration_title( $duration, $titles = array() )
1662  {
1663      $titles = array_merge( array(
1664          'year'   => T_('Last %d years'),
1665          'month'  => T_('Last %d months'),
1666          'day'    => T_('Last %d days'),
1667          'hour'   => T_('Last %d hours'),
1668          'minute' => T_('Last %d minutes'),
1669          'second' => T_('Last %d seconds'),
1670          ), $titles );
1671  
1672      $delay_fields = get_duration_fields( $duration );
1673  
1674      if( ! empty( $delay_fields[ 'years' ] ) )
1675      { // Years
1676          return sprintf( $titles['year'], $delay_fields[ 'years' ] );
1677      }
1678      elseif( ! empty( $delay_fields[ 'months' ] ) )
1679      { // Months
1680          return sprintf( $titles['month'], $delay_fields[ 'months' ] );
1681      }
1682      elseif( ! empty( $delay_fields[ 'days' ] ) )
1683      { // Days
1684          return sprintf( $titles['day'], $delay_fields[ 'days' ] );
1685      }
1686      elseif( ! empty( $delay_fields[ 'hours' ] ) )
1687      { // Hours
1688          return sprintf( $titles['hour'], $delay_fields[ 'hours' ] );
1689      }
1690      elseif( ! empty( $delay_fields[ 'minutes' ] ) )
1691      { // Minutes
1692          return sprintf( $titles['minute'], $delay_fields[ 'minutes' ] );
1693      }
1694      else
1695      { // Seconds
1696          return sprintf( $titles['second'], $delay_fields[ 'seconds' ] );
1697      }
1698  }

1700  
1701  /**
1702   * Validate variable
1703   *
1704   * @param string param name
1705   * @param string validator function name
1706   * @param boolean true if variable value can't be empty
1707   * @param custom error message
1708   * @return boolean true if OK
1709   */
1710  function param_validate( $variable, $validator, $required = false, $custom_msg = NULL )
1711  {
1712      /* Tblue> Note: is_callable() does not check whether a function is
1713       *        disabled (http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.is-callable.php#79151).
1714       */
1715      if( ! is_callable( $validator ) )
1716      {
1717          debug_die( 'Validator function '.$validator.'() is not callable!' );
1718      }
1719  
1720      if( ! isset( $GLOBALS[$variable] ) )
1721      {    // Variable not set, we cannot handle this using the validator function...
1722          if( $required )
1723          {    // Add error:
1724              param_check_not_empty( $variable, $custom_msg );
1725              return false;
1726          }
1727  
1728          return true;
1729      }
1730  
1731      if( $GLOBALS[$variable] === '' && ! $required )
1732      {    // Variable is empty or not set. That's fine since it isn't required:
1733          return true;
1734      }
1735  
1736      $msg = $validator( $GLOBALS[$variable] );
1737  
1738      if( !empty( $msg ) )
1739      {
1740          if( !empty( $custom_msg ) )
1741          {
1742              $msg = $custom_msg;
1743          }
1744  
1745          param_error( $variable, $msg );
1746          return false;
1747      }
1748  
1749      return true;
1750  }

1753  /**
1754   * Checks if the param is a decimal number
1755   *
1756   * @param string decimal to check
1757   * @return boolean true if OK
1758   */
1759  function is_decimal( $decimal )
1760  {
1761      return preg_match( '#^[0-9]*(\.[0-9]+)?$#', $decimal );
1762  }

1765  /**
1766   * Checks if the param is an integer (no float, e.g. 3.14).
1767   *
1768   * @param string number to check
1769   * @return boolean true if OK
1770   */
1771  function is_number( $number )
1772  {
1773      return preg_match( '#^[0-9]+$#', $number );
1774  }

1776  
1777  /**
1778   * Check that email address looks valid.
1779   *
1780   * @param string email address to check
1781   * @param string Format to use ('simple', 'rfc')
1782   *    'simple':
1783   *      Single email address.
1784   *    'rfc':
1785   *      Full email address, may include name (RFC2822)
1786   *      - example@example.org
1787   *      - Me <example@example.org>
1788   *      - "Me" <example@example.org>
1789   * @param boolean Return the match or boolean
1790   *
1791   * @return bool|array Either true/false or the match (see {@link $return_match})
1792   */
1793  function is_email( $email, $format = 'simple', $return_match = false )
1794  {
1795      #$chars = "/^([a-z0-9_]|\\-|\\.)+@(([a-z0-9_]|\\-)+\\.)+[a-z]{2,4}\$/i";
1796  
1797      switch( $format )
1798      {
1799          case 'rfc':
1800          case 'rfc2822':
1801              /**
1802               * Regexp pattern converted from: http://www.regexlib.com/REDetails.aspx?regexp_id=711
1803               * Extended to allow escaped quotes.
1804               */
1805              $pattern_email = '/^
1806                  (
1807                      (?>[a-zA-Z\d!\#$%&\'*+\-\/=?^_`{|}~]+\x20*
1808                          |"( \\\" | (?=[\x01-\x7f])[^"\\\] | \\[\x01-\x7f] )*"\x20*)* # Name
1809                      (<)
1810                  )?
1811                  (
1812                      (?!\.)(?>\.?[a-zA-Z\d!\#$%&\'*+\-\/=?^_`{|}~]+)+
1813                      |"( \\\" | (?=[\x01-\x7f])[^"\\\] | \\[\x01-\x7f] )* " # quoted mailbox name
1814                  )
1815                  @
1816                  (
1817                      ((?!-)[a-zA-Z\d\-]+(?<!-)\.)+[a-zA-Z]{2,}
1818                      |
1819                      \[(
1820                          ( (?(?<!\[)\.)(25[0-5] | 2[0-4]\d | [01]?\d?\d) ){4}
1821                          |
1822                          [a-zA-Z\d\-]*[a-zA-Z\d]:( (?=[\x01-\x7f])[^\\\[\]] | \\[\x01-\x7f] )+
1823                      )\]
1824                  )
1825                  (?(3)>) # match ">" if it was there
1826                  $/x';
1827              break;
1828  
1829          case 'simple':
1830          default:
1831              // '/^\S+@[^\.\s]\S*\.[a-z]{2,}$/i'
1832              $pattern_email = '~^(([_a-z0-9-]+)(\.[_a-z0-9-]+)*@([a-z0-9-]+)(\.[a-z0-9-]+)*(\.[a-z]{2,}))$~i';
1833              break;
1834      }
1835  
1836      if( strpos( $email, '@' ) !== false && strpos( $email, '.' ) !== false )
1837      {
1838          if( $return_match )
1839          {
1840              preg_match( $pattern_email, $email, $match );
1841              return $match;
1842          }
1843          else
1844          {
1845              return (bool)preg_match( $pattern_email, $email );
1846          }
1847      }
1848      else
1849      {
1850          return $return_match ? array() : false;
1851      }
1852  }

1855  /**
1856   * Checks if the phone number is valid
1857   *
1858   * @param string phone number to check
1859   * @return boolean true if OK
1860   */
1861  function is_phone( $phone )
1862  {
1863      return preg_match( '|^\+?[\-*#/(). 0-9]+$|', $phone );
1864  }

1866  
1867  /**
1868   * Checks if the url is valid
1869   *
1870   * @param string url to check
1871   * @return boolean true if OK
1872   */
1873  function is_url( $url )
1874  {
1875      if( validate_url( $url, 'posting', false ) )
1876      {
1877          return false;
1878      }
1879  
1880      return true;
1881  }

1884  /**
1885   * Checks if the word is valid
1886   *
1887   * @param string word to check
1888   * @return boolean true if OK
1889   */
1890  function is_word( $word )
1891  {
1892      return preg_match( '#^[A-Za-z]+$#', $word );
1893  }

1895  
1896  /**
1897   * Check if the login is valid (in terms of allowed chars)
1898   *
1899   * @param string login
1900   * @return boolean true if OK
1901   */
1902  function is_valid_login( $login, $force_strict_logins = false )
1903  {
1904      global $Settings;
1905  
1906      $strict_logins = isset( $Settings ) ? $Settings->get('strict_logins') : 1;
1907  
1908      // NOTE: in some places usernames are typed in by other users (messaging) or admins.
1909      // Having cryptic logins with hard to type letters is a PITA.
1910  
1911      // Step 1
1912      // Forbid the following characters in logins
1913      if( preg_match( '~[\'"><@\s]~', $login ) )
1914      {    // WARNING: allowing ' or " or > or < will open security issues!
1915          // NOTE: allowing @ will make some "average" users use their email address (not good for their spam health)
1916          // NOTE: we do not allow whitespace in logins
1917          return false;
1918      }
1919  
1920      // Step 2
1921      if( ($strict_logins || $force_strict_logins) && ! preg_match( '~^[A-Za-z0-9_.]+$~', $login ) )
1922      {    // WARNING: allowing special chars like latin 1 accented chars ( \xDF-\xF6\xF8-\xFF ) will create issues with
1923          // user media directory names (tested on Max OS X) -- Do no allow any of this until we have a clean & safe media dir name generator.
1924  
1925          // fp> TODO: check why a dash '-' prevents renaming the fileroot
1926          return false;
1927      }
1928      elseif( ! $strict_logins )
1929      {    // We allow any character that is not explicitly forbidden in Step 1
1930          // Enforce additional limitations
1931          $login = preg_replace( '|%([a-fA-F0-9][a-fA-F0-9])|', '', $login ); // Kill octets
1932          $login = preg_replace( '/&.+?;/', '', $login ); // Kill entities
1933      }
1934  
1935      // Step 3
1936      // Special case, the login is valid however we forbid it's usage.
1937      // param_check_valid_login() will display a special error message in this case.
1938      if( preg_match( '~^usr_~', $login ) )
1939      {    // Logins cannot start with 'usr_', this prefix is reserved for system use
1940          // We create user media directories for users with non-ASCII logins in format /media/users/usr_55/, where 55 is user ID
1941          return 'usr';
1942      }
1943  
1944      return true;
1945  }

1949   * Checks if the color is valid
1950   *
1951   * @param string color to check
1952   * @return boolean true if OK
1953   */
1954  function is_color( $color )
1955  {

1957  }

1960  /**
1961   * Check if the login is valid (user exists)
1962   *
1963   * @param string login
1964   * @return boolean true if OK
1965   */
1966  function user_exists( $login )
1967  {
1968      global $DB;
1969  
1970      $SQL = new SQL();
1971      $SQL->SELECT( 'COUNT(*)' );
1972      $SQL->FROM( 'T_users' );
1973      $SQL->WHERE( 'user_login = "'.$DB->escape($login).'"' );
1974  
1975      $var = $DB->get_var( $SQL->get() );
1976      return $var > 0 ? true : false; // PHP4 compatibility
1977  }

1989  /**
1990   * Get all "a" tags from the given content
1991   *
1992   * @param string content
1993   * @return array all <a../a> part from the given content
1994   */
1995  function get_atags( $content )
1996  {
1997      $tag = 'a';
1998      $regexp = '{<'.$tag.'[^>]*>(.*?)</'.$tag.'>}';
1999  
2000      preg_match_all( $regexp, $content, $result );
2001      return $result[0];
2002  }

2005  /**
2006   * Get all "img" tags from the given content
2007   *
2008   * @param string content
2009   * @return array all <img../img> part from the given content
2010   */
2011  function get_imgtags( $content )
2012  {
2013      $tag = 'img';
2014      $regexp = '{<'.$tag.'[^>]*[ (</'.$tag.'>) | (/>) ]}';
2015  
2016      preg_match_all( $regexp, $content, $result );
2017      return $result[0];
2018  }

2021  /**
2022   * Get all urls from the given content
2023   *
2024   * @param string content
2025   * @return array all url from content
2026   */
2027  function get_urls( $content )
2028  {
2029      $regexp = '^(?#Protocol)(?:(?:ht|f)tp(?:s?)\:\/\/|~\/|\/)?(?#Username:Password)(?:\w+:\w+@)?(?#Subdomains)(?:(?:[-\w]+\.)+(?#TopLevel Domains)(?:com|org|net|gov|mil|biz|info|mobi|name|aero|jobs|museum|travel|[a-z]{2,4}))(?#Port)(?::[\d]{1,5})?(?#Directories)(?:(?:(?:\/(?:[-\w~!$+|.,;=]|%[a-f\d]{2})+)+|\/)+|\?|#)?(?#Query)(?:(?:\?(?:[-\w~!$+|.,;*:]|%[a-f\d{2}])+=?(?:[-\w~!$+|.,;*:=]|%[a-f\d]{2})*)(?:&(?:[-\w~!$+|.,;*:]|%[a-f\d{2}])+=?(?:[-\w~!$+|.,;*:=]|%[a-f\d]{2})*)*)*(?#Anchor)(?:#(?:[-\w~!$+|.,;*:=]|%[a-f\d]{2})*)?^';
2030  
2031      preg_match_all( $regexp, $content, $result );
2032      return $result[0];
2033  }

2036  function xmlrpc_getposttitle($content)
2037  {
2038      global $post_default_title;
2039      if (preg_match('/<title>(.+?)<\/title>/is', $content, $matchtitle))
2040      {
2041          $post_title = $matchtitle[1];
2042      }
2043      else
2044      {
2045          $post_title = $post_default_title;
2046      }
2047      return($post_title);
2048  }

2056  function xmlrpc_getpostcategory($content)
2057  {

2059      {
2060          return $matchcat[1];
2061      }
2062  
2063      return false;

2067  /**
2068   * Extract categories out of "<category>" tag from $content.
2069   *
2070   * NOTE: w.bloggar sends something like "<category>00000013,00000001,00000004,</category>" to
2071   *       blogger.newPost.
2072   *
2073   * @return false|array
2074   */
2075  function xmlrpc_getpostcategories($content)
2076  {
2077      $cats = array();
2078  
2079      if( preg_match('~<category>(\d+\s*(,\s*\d*)*)</category>~i', $content, $match) )
2080      {
2081          $cats = preg_split('~\s*,\s*~', $match[1], -1, PREG_SPLIT_NO_EMPTY);
2082          foreach( $cats as $k => $v )
2083          {
2084              $cats[$k] = (int)$v;
2085          }
2086      }
2087  
2088      return $cats;
2089  }

2092  /*
2093   * xmlrpc_removepostdata(-)
2094   */
2095  function xmlrpc_removepostdata($content)
2096  {
2097      $content = preg_replace('/<title>(.*?)<\/title>/si', '', $content);
2098      $content = preg_replace('/<category>(.*?)<\/category>/si', '', $content);
2099      $content = trim($content);
2100      return($content);
2101  }

2104  /**
2105   * Echo the XML-RPC call Result and optionally log into file
2106   *
2107   * @param object XMLRPC response object
2108   * @param boolean true to echo
2109   * @param mixed File resource or == '' for no file logging.
2110   */
2111  function xmlrpc_displayresult( $result, $display = true, $log = '' )
2112  {
2113      if( ! $result )
2114      { // We got no response:
2115          if( $display ) echo T_('No response!')."<br />\n";
2116          return false;
2117      }
2118  
2119      if( $result->faultCode() )
2120      { // We got a remote error:
2121          if( $display ) echo T_('Remote error'), ': ', $result->faultString(), ' (', $result->faultCode(), ")<br />\n";
2122          debug_fwrite($log, $result->faultCode().' -- '.$result->faultString());
2123          return false;
2124      }
2125  
2126      // We'll display the response:
2127      $val = $result->value();
2128      $value = xmlrpc_decode_recurse($result->value());
2129  
2130      if( is_array($value) )
2131      {
2132          $out = '';
2133          foreach($value as $l_value)
2134          {
2135              if( is_array( $l_value ) )
2136              {
2137                  $out .= ' [';
2138                  foreach( $l_value as $lv_key => $lv_val )
2139                  {
2140                      $out .= $lv_key.' => '.( is_array( $lv_val ) ? '{'.implode( '; ', $lv_val ).'}' : $lv_val ).'; ';
2141                  }
2142                  $out .= '] ';
2143              }
2144              else
2145              {
2146                  $out .= ' ['.$l_value.'] ';
2147              }
2148          }
2149      }
2150      else
2151      {
2152          $out = $value;
2153      }
2154  
2155      debug_fwrite($log, $out);
2156  
2157      if( $display ) echo T_('Response').': '.$out."<br />\n";
2158  
2159      return $value;
2160  }
2161  
2162  
2163  /**
2164   * Log the XML-RPC call Result into LOG object
2165   *
2166   * @param object XMLRPC response object
2167   * @param Log object to add messages to
2168   * @return boolean true = success, false = error
2169   */
2170  function xmlrpc_logresult( $result, & $message_Log, $log_payload = true )
2171  {
2172      if( ! $result )
2173      { // We got no response:
2174          $message_Log->add( T_('No response!'), 'error' );
2175          return false;
2176      }
2177  
2178      if( $result->faultCode() )
2179      { // We got a remote error:
2180          $message_Log->add( T_('Remote error').': '.$result->faultString().' ('.$result->faultCode().')', 'error' );
2181          return false;
2182      }
2183  
2184      if( $log_payload )
2185      {
2186          // We got a response:
2187          $value = xmlrpc_decode_recurse($result->value());
2188  
2189          if( is_array($value) )
2190          {
2191              $out = '';
2192              foreach($value as $l_value)
2193              {
2194                  $out .= ' ['.var_export($l_value, true).'] ';
2195              }
2196          }
2197          else
2198          {
2199              $out = $value;
2200          }
2201  
2202          $message_Log->add( T_('Response').': '.$out, 'success' );
2203      }
2204  
2205      return true;
2206  }

2217          return false;
