2240  
2241  /**
2242   * Wrap pre tag around {@link var_dump()} for better debugging.
2243   *
2244   * @param $var__var__var__var__,... mixed variable(s) to dump
2245   * @return true
2246   */
2247  function pre_dump( $var__var__var__var__ )
2248  {
2249      global $is_cli;
2250  
2251      #echo 'pre_dump(): '.debug_get_backtrace(); // see where a pre_dump() comes from
2252  
2253      $func_num_args = func_num_args();
2254      $count = 0;
2255  
2256      if( ! empty($is_cli) )
2257      { // CLI, no encoding of special chars:
2258          $count = 0;
2259          foreach( func_get_args() as $lvar )
2260          {
2261              var_dump($lvar);
2262  
2263              $count++;
2264              if( $count < $func_num_args )
2265              { // Put newline between arguments
2266                  echo "\n";
2267              }
2268          }
2269      }
2270      elseif( function_exists('xdebug_var_dump') )
2271      { // xdebug already does fancy displaying:
2272  
2273          // no limits:
2274          $old_var_display_max_children = ini_set('xdebug.var_display_max_children', -1); // default: 128
2275          $old_var_display_max_data = ini_set('xdebug.var_display_max_data', -1); // max string length; default: 512
2276          $old_var_display_max_depth = ini_set('xdebug.var_display_max_depth', -1); // default: 3
2277  
2278          echo "\n<div style=\"padding:1ex;border:1px solid #00f;\">\n";
2279          foreach( func_get_args() as $lvar )
2280          {
2281              xdebug_var_dump($lvar);
2282  
2283              $count++;
2284              if( $count < $func_num_args )
2285              { // Put HR between arguments
2286                  echo "<hr />\n";
2287              }
2288          }
2289          echo '</div>';
2290  
2291          // restore xdebug settings:
2292          ini_set('xdebug.var_display_max_children', $old_var_display_max_children);
2293          ini_set('xdebug.var_display_max_data', $old_var_display_max_data);
2294          ini_set('xdebug.var_display_max_depth', $old_var_display_max_depth);
2295      }
2296      else
2297      {
2298          $orig_html_errors = ini_set('html_errors', 0); // e.g. xdebug would use fancy html, if this is on; we catch (and use) xdebug explicitly above, but just in case
2299  
2300          echo "\n<pre style=\"padding:1ex;border:1px solid #00f;overflow:auto\">\n";
2301          foreach( func_get_args() as $lvar )
2302          {
2303              ob_start();
2304              var_dump($lvar); // includes "\n"; do not use var_export() because it does not detect recursion by design
2305              $buffer = ob_get_contents();
2306              ob_end_clean();
2307              echo htmlspecialchars($buffer);
2308  
2309              $count++;
2310              if( $count < $func_num_args )
2311              { // Put HR between arguments
2312                  echo "<hr />\n";
2313              }
2314          }
2315          echo "</pre>\n";
2316          ini_set('html_errors', $orig_html_errors);
2317      }
2318      evo_flush();
2319      return true;
2320  }
2321  
2322  
2323  /**
2324   * Get a function trace from {@link debug_backtrace()} as html table.
2325   *
2326   * Adopted from {@link http://us2.php.net/manual/de/function.debug-backtrace.php#47644}.
2327   *
2328   * @todo dh> Add support for $is_cli = true (e.g. in case of MySQL error)
2329   *
2330   * @param integer|NULL Get the last x entries from the stack (after $ignore_from is applied). Anything non-numeric means "all".
2331   * @param array After a key/value pair matches a stack entry, this and the rest is ignored.
2332   *              For example, array('class' => 'DB') would exclude everything after the stack
2333   *              "enters" class DB and everything that got called afterwards.
2334   *              You can also give an array of arrays which means that every condition in one of the given array must match.
2335   * @param integer Number of stack entries to include, after $ignore_from matches.
2336   * @return string HTML table
2337   */
2338  function debug_get_backtrace( $limit_to_last = NULL, $ignore_from = array( 'function' => 'debug_get_backtrace' ), $offset_ignore_from = 0 )
2339  {
2340      if( ! function_exists( 'debug_backtrace' ) ) // PHP 4.3.0
2341      {
2342          return 'Function debug_backtrace() is not available!';
2343      }
2344  
2345      $r = '';
2346  
2347      $backtrace = debug_backtrace();
2348      $count_ignored = 0; // remember how many have been ignored
2349      $limited = false;   // remember if we have limited to $limit_to_last
2350  
2351      if( $ignore_from )
2352      {    // we want to ignore from a certain point
2353          $trace_length = 0;
2354          $break_because_of_offset = false;
2355  
2356          for( $i = count($backtrace); $i > 0; $i-- )
2357          {    // Search the backtrace from behind (first call).
2358              $l_stack = & $backtrace[$i-1];
2359  
2360              if( $break_because_of_offset && $offset_ignore_from < 1 )
2361              { // we've respected the offset, but need to break now
2362                  break; // ignore from here
2363              }
2364  
2365              foreach( $ignore_from as $l_ignore_key => $l_ignore_value )
2366              {    // Check if we want to ignore from here
2367                  if( is_array($l_ignore_value) )
2368                  {    // It's an array - all must match
2369                      foreach( $l_ignore_value as $l_ignore_mult_key => $l_ignore_mult_val )
2370                      {
2371                          if( !isset($l_stack[$l_ignore_mult_key]) /* not set with this stack entry */
2372                              || strcasecmp($l_stack[$l_ignore_mult_key], $l_ignore_mult_val) /* not this value (case-insensitive) */ )
2373                          {
2374                              continue 2; // next ignore setting, because not all match.
2375                          }
2376                      }
2377                      if( $offset_ignore_from-- > 0 )
2378                      {
2379                          $break_because_of_offset = true;
2380                          break;
2381                      }
2382                      break 2; // ignore from here
2383                  }
2384                  elseif( isset($l_stack[$l_ignore_key])
2385                      && !strcasecmp($l_stack[$l_ignore_key], $l_ignore_value) /* is equal case-insensitive */ )
2386                  {
2387                      if( $offset_ignore_from-- > 0 )
2388                      {
2389                          $break_because_of_offset = true;
2390                          break;
2391                      }
2392                      break 2; // ignore from here
2393                  }
2394              }
2395              $trace_length++;
2396          }
2397  
2398          $count_ignored = count($backtrace) - $trace_length;
2399  
2400          $backtrace = array_slice( $backtrace, 0-$trace_length ); // cut off ignored ones
2401      }
2402  
2403      $count_backtrace = count($backtrace);
2404      if( is_numeric($limit_to_last) && $limit_to_last < $count_backtrace )
2405      {    // we want to limit to a maximum number
2406          $limited = true;
2407          $backtrace = array_slice( $backtrace, 0, $limit_to_last );
2408          $count_backtrace = $limit_to_last;
2409      }
2410  
2411      $r .= '<div style="padding:1ex; margin-bottom:1ex; text-align:left; color:#000; background-color:#ddf;">
2412                      <h3>Backtrace:</h3>'."\n";
2413      if( $count_backtrace )
2414      {
2415          $r .= '<ol style="font-family:monospace;">';
2416  
2417          $i = 0;
2418          foreach( $backtrace as $l_trace )
2419          {
2420              if( ++$i == $count_backtrace )
2421              {
2422                  $r .= '<li style="padding:0.5ex 0;">';
2423              }
2424              else
2425              {
2426                  $r .= '<li style="padding:0.5ex 0; border-bottom:1px solid #77d;">';
2427              }
2428              $args = array();
2429              if( isset($l_trace['args']) && is_array( $l_trace['args'] ) )
2430              {    // Prepare args:
2431                  foreach( $l_trace['args'] as $l_arg )
2432                  {
2433                      $l_arg_type = gettype($l_arg);
2434                      switch( $l_arg_type )
2435                      {
2436                          case 'integer':
2437                          case 'double':
2438                              $args[] = $l_arg;
2439                              break;
2440                          case 'string':
2441                              $args[] = '"'.strmaxlen(str_replace("\n", '\n', $l_arg), 255, NULL, 'htmlspecialchars').'"';
2442                              break;
2443                          case 'array':
2444                              $args[] = 'Array('.count($l_arg).')';
2445                              break;
2446                          case 'object':
2447                              $args[] = 'Object('.get_class($l_arg).')';
2448                              break;
2449                          case 'resource':
2450                              $args[] = htmlspecialchars((string)$l_arg);
2451                              break;
2452                          case 'boolean':
2453                              $args[] = $l_arg ? 'true' : 'false';
2454                              break;
2455                          default:
2456                              $args[] = $l_arg_type;
2457                      }
2458                  }
2459              }
2460  
2461              $call = "<strong>\n";
2462              if( isset($l_trace['class']) )
2463              {
2464                  $call .= htmlspecialchars($l_trace['class']);
2465              }
2466              if( isset($l_trace['type']) )
2467              {
2468                  $call .= htmlspecialchars($l_trace['type']);
2469              }
2470              $call .= htmlspecialchars($l_trace['function'])."( </strong>\n";
2471              if( $args )
2472              {
2473                  $call .= ' '.implode( ', ', $args ).' ';
2474              }
2475              $call .='<strong>)</strong>';
2476  
2477              $r .= $call."<br />\n";
2478  
2479              $r .= '<strong>';
2480              if( isset($l_trace['file']) )
2481              {
2482                  $r .= "File: </strong> ".$l_trace['file'];
2483              }
2484              else
2485              {
2486                  $r .= '[runtime created function]</strong>';
2487              }
2488              if( isset($l_trace['line']) )
2489              {
2490                  $r .= ' on line '.$l_trace['line'];
2491              }
2492  
2493              $r .= "</li>\n";
2494          }
2495          $r .= '</ol>';
2496      }
2497      else
2498      {
2499          $r .= '<p>No backtrace available.</p>';
2500      }
2501  
2502      // Extra notes, might be to much, but explains why we stopped at some point. Feel free to comment it out or remove it.
2503      $notes = array();
2504      if( $count_ignored )
2505      {
2506          $notes[] = 'Ignored last: '.$count_ignored;
2507      }
2508      if( $limited )
2509      {
2510          $notes[] = 'Limited to'.( $count_ignored ? ' remaining' : '' ).': '.$limit_to_last;
2511      }
2512      if( $notes )
2513      {
2514          $r .= '<p class="small">'.implode( ' - ', $notes ).'</p>';
2515      }
2516  
2517      $r .= "</div>\n";
2518  
2519      return $r;
2520  }
2521  
2522  
2523  /**
2524   * Outputs Unexpected Error message. When in debug mode it also prints a backtrace.
2525   *
2526   * This should be used instead of die() everywhere.
2527   * This should NOT be used instead of exit() anywhere.
2528   * Dying means the application has encontered an unexpected situation,
2529   * i-e: something that should never occur during normal operation.
2530   * Examples: database broken, user changed URL by hand...
2531   *
2532   * @param string Message to output
2533   * @param array Additional params
2534   *        - "status" (Default: '500 Internal Server Error')
2535   *        - "debug_info" - Use this info instead of $additional_info when debug is ON
2536   */
2537  function debug_die( $additional_info = '', $params = array() )
2538  {
2539      global $debug, $baseurl;
2540      global $log_app_errors, $app_name, $is_cli, $display_errors_on_production;
2541  
2542      $params = array_merge( array(
2543          'status'     => '500 Internal Server Error',
2544          'debug_info' => '',
2545          ), $params );
2546  
2547      if( $debug && ! empty( $params['debug_info'] ) )
2548      { // Display 'debug_info' when debug is ON
2549          $additional_info = $params['debug_info'];
2550      }
2551  
2552      if( $is_cli )
2553      { // Command line interface, e.g. in cron_exec.php:
2554          echo '== '.T_('An unexpected error has occurred!')." ==\n";
2555          echo T_('If this error persists, please report it to the administrator.')."\n";
2556          if( $debug || $display_errors_on_production )
2557          { // Display additional info only in debug mode or when it was explicitly set by display_errors_on_production setting because it can reveal system info to hackers and greatly facilitate exploits
2558              echo T_('Additional information about this error:')."\n";
2559              echo strip_tags( $additional_info )."\n\n";
2560          }
2561      }
2562      else
2563      {
2564          // Attempt to output an error header (will not work if the output buffer has already flushed once):
2565          // This should help preventing indexing robots from indexing the error :P
2566          if( ! headers_sent() )
2567          {
2568              load_funcs('_core/_template.funcs.php');
2569              headers_content_mightcache( 'text/html', 0, '#', false );  // Do NOT cache error messages! (Users would not see they fixed them)
2570              $status_header = $_SERVER['SERVER_PROTOCOL'].' '.$params['status'];
2571              header($status_header);
2572          }
2573  
2574          echo '<div style="background-color: #fdd; padding: 1ex; margin-bottom: 1ex;">';
2575          echo '<h3 style="color:#f00;">'.T_('An unexpected error has occurred!').'</h3>';
2576          echo '<p>'.T_('If this error persists, please report it to the administrator.').'</p>';
2577          echo '<p><a href="'.$baseurl.'">'.T_('Go back to home page').'</a></p>';
2578          echo '</div>';
2579  
2580          if( ! empty( $additional_info ) )
2581          {
2582              echo '<div style="background-color: #ddd; padding: 1ex; margin-bottom: 1ex;">';
2583              if( $debug || $display_errors_on_production )
2584              { // Display additional info only in debug mode or when it was explicitly set by display_errors_on_production setting because it can reveal system info to hackers and greatly facilitate exploits
2585                  echo '<h3>'.T_('Additional information about this error:').'</h3>';
2586                  echo $additional_info;
2587              }
2588              else
2589              {
2590                  echo '<p><i>Enable debugging to get additional information about this error.</i></p>' . get_manual_link('debugging','How to enable debug mode?');
2591              }
2592              echo '</div>';
2593  
2594              // Append the error text to AJAX log if it is AJAX request
2595              global $Ajaxlog;
2596              if( ! empty( $Ajaxlog ) )
2597              {
2598                  $Ajaxlog->add( $additional_info, 'error' );
2599                  $Ajaxlog->display( NULL, NULL, true, 'all',
2600                                  array(
2601                                          'error' => array( 'class' => 'jslog_error', 'divClass' => false ),
2602                                          'note'  => array( 'class' => 'jslog_note',  'divClass' => false ),
2603                                      ), 'ul', 'jslog' );
2604              }
2605          }
2606      }
2607  
2608      if( $log_app_errors > 1 || $debug )
2609      { // Prepare backtrace
2610          $backtrace = debug_get_backtrace();
2611  
2612          if( $log_app_errors > 1 || $is_cli )
2613          {
2614              $backtrace_cli = trim(strip_tags($backtrace));
2615          }
2616      }
2617  
2618      if( $log_app_errors )
2619      { // Log error through PHP's logging facilities:
2620          $log_message = $app_name.' error: ';
2621          if( ! empty($additional_info) )
2622          {
2623              $log_message .= trim( strip_tags($additional_info) );
2624          }
2625          else
2626          {
2627              $log_message .= 'No info specified in debug_die()';
2628          }
2629  
2630          // Get file and line info:
2631          $file = 'Unknown';
2632          $line = 'Unknown';
2633          if( function_exists('debug_backtrace') /* PHP 4.3 */ )
2634          { // get the file and line
2635              foreach( debug_backtrace() as $v )
2636              {
2637                  if( isset($v['function']) && $v['function'] == 'debug_die' )
2638                  {
2639                      $file = isset($v['file']) ? $v['file'] : 'Unknown';
2640                      $line = isset($v['line']) ? $v['line'] : 'Unknown';
2641                      break;
2642                  }
2643              }
2644          }
2645          $log_message .= ' in '.$file.' at line '.$line;
2646  
2647          if( $log_app_errors > 1 )
2648          { // Append backtrace:
2649              // indent after newlines:
2650              $backtrace_cli = preg_replace( '~(\S)(\n)(\S)~', '$1  $2$3', $backtrace_cli );
2651              $log_message .= "\nBacktrace:\n".$backtrace_cli;
2652          }
2653          $log_message .= "\nREQUEST_URI:  ".( isset($_SERVER['REQUEST_URI']) ? $_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'] : '-' );
2654          $log_message .= "\nHTTP_REFERER: ".( isset($_SERVER['HTTP_REFERER']) ? $_SERVER['HTTP_REFERER'] : '-' );
2655  
2656          error_log( str_replace("\n", ' / ', $log_message), 0 /* PHP's system logger */ );
2657      }
2658  
2659  
2660      // DEBUG OUTPUT:
2661      if( $debug )
2662      {
2663          if( $is_cli )
2664              echo $backtrace_cli;
2665          else
2666              echo $backtrace;
2667      }
2668  
2669      // EXIT:
2670      if( ! $is_cli )
2671      { // Attempt to keep the html valid (but it doesn't really matter anyway)
2672          echo '</body></html>';
2673      }
2674  
2675      die(1);    // Error code 1. Note: This will still call the shutdown function.
2676  }
2677  
2678  
2679  /**
2680   * Outputs Bad request Error message. When in debug mode it also prints a backtrace.
2681   *
2682   * This should be used when a bad user input is detected.
2683   *
2684   * @param string Message to output (HTML)
2685   */
2686  function bad_request_die( $additional_info = '' )
2687  {
2688      global $debug, $baseurl;
2689  
2690      // Attempt to output an error header (will not work if the output buffer has already flushed once):
2691      // This should help preventing indexing robots from indexing the error :P
2692      if( ! headers_sent() )
2693      {
2694          load_funcs('_core/_template.funcs.php');
2695          headers_content_mightcache( 'text/html', 0, '#', false );        // Do NOT cache error messages! (Users would not see they fixed them)
2696          header_http_response('400 Bad Request');
2697      }
2698  
2699      if( ! function_exists( 'T_' ) )
2700      {    // Load locale funcs to initialize function "T_" because it is used below:
2701          load_funcs( 'locales/_locale.funcs.php' );
2702      }
2703  
2704      echo '<div style="background-color: #fdd; padding: 1ex; margin-bottom: 1ex;">';
2705      echo '<h3 style="color:#f00;">'.T_('Bad Request!').'</h3>';
2706      echo '<p>'.T_('The parameters of your request are invalid.').'</p>';
2707      echo '<p>'.T_('If you have obtained this error by clicking on a link INSIDE of this site, please report the bad link to the administrator.').'</p>';
2708      echo '<p><a href="'.$baseurl.'">'.T_('Go back to home page').'</a></p>';
2709      echo '</div>';
2710  
2711      if( !empty( $additional_info ) )
2712      {
2713          echo '<div style="background-color: #ddd; padding: 1ex; margin-bottom: 1ex;">';
2714          if( $debug )
2715          {    // Display additional info only in debug mode because it can reveal system info to hackers and greatly facilitate exploits
2716              echo '<h3>'.T_('Additional information about this error:').'</h3>';
2717              echo $additional_info;
2718          }
2719          else
2720          {
2721              echo '<p><i>Enable debugging to get additional information about this error.</i></p>' . get_manual_link('debugging','How to enable debug mode?');
2722          }
2723          echo '</div>';
2724  
2725          // Append the error text to AJAX log if it is AJAX request
2726          global $Ajaxlog;
2727          if( ! empty( $Ajaxlog ) )
2728          {
2729              $Ajaxlog->add( $additional_info, 'error' );
2730              $Ajaxlog->display( NULL, NULL, true, 'all',
2731                              array(
2732                                      'error' => array( 'class' => 'jslog_error', 'divClass' => false ),
2733                                      'note'  => array( 'class' => 'jslog_note',  'divClass' => false ),
2734                                  ), 'ul', 'jslog' );
2735          }
2736      }
2737  
2738      if( $debug )
2739      {
2740          echo debug_get_backtrace();
2741      }
2742  
2743      // Attempt to keep the html valid (but it doesn't really matter anyway)
2744      echo '</body></html>';
2745  
2746      die(2); // Error code 2. Note: this will still call the shutdown function.
2747  }
2748

2750  /**
2751   * Outputs debug info, according to {@link $debug} or $force param. This gets called typically at the end of the page.
2752   *
2753   * @param boolean true to force output regardless of {@link $debug}
2754   * @param boolean true to force clean output (without HTML) regardless of {@link $is_cli}
2755   */
2756  function debug_info( $force = false, $force_clean = false )
2757  {
2758      global $debug, $debug_done, $debug_jslog, $debug_jslog_done, $Debuglog, $DB, $obhandler_debug, $Timer, $ReqHost, $ReqPath, $is_cli;
2759      global $cache_imgsize, $cache_File;
2760      global $Session;
2761      global $db_config, $tableprefix, $http_response_code, $disp, $disp_detail, $robots_index, $robots_follow, $content_type_header;
2762      /**
2763       * @var Hit
2764       */
2765      global $Hit;
2766  
2767      // Detect content-type
2768      $content_type = NULL;
2769      foreach(headers_list() as $header)
2770      {
2771          if( stripos($header, 'content-type:') !== false )
2772          { // content type sent
2773              # "Content-Type:text/html;charset=utf-8" => "text/html"
2774              $content_type = trim(array_shift(explode(';', array_pop(explode(':', $header, 2)))));
2775              break;
2776          }
2777      }
2778  
2779      // ---- Print AJAX Log
2780      if( empty( $debug_jslog_done ) && ( $debug || $debug_jslog ) && $content_type == 'text/html' )
2781      {    // Display debug jslog once
2782          global $rsc_url, $app_version_long;
2783  
2784          require_js( '#jqueryUI#', 'rsc_url', false, true );
2785          require_css( '#jqueryUI_css#', 'rsc_url', NULL, NULL, '#', true );
2786          require_js( 'debug_jslog.js', 'rsc_url', false, true );
2787          require_js( 'jquery/jquery.cookie.min.js', 'rsc_url', false, true );
2788  
2789          $jslog_style_cookies = param_cookie( 'jslog_style', 'string' );
2790          $jslog_styles = array();
2791          if( !empty( $jslog_style_cookies ) )
2792          {    // Get styles only from cookies
2793              $jslog_style_cookies = explode( ';', $jslog_style_cookies );
2794              foreach( $jslog_style_cookies as $jsc => $style )
2795              {
2796                  if( strpos( $style, 'height' ) !== false /*|| ( strpos( $style, 'display' ) !== false && !$debug_jslog )*/ )
2797                  {    // Unset the height param from defined styles ( and the display param if jslog is disabled )
2798                      unset( $jslog_style_cookies[$jsc] );
2799                  }
2800              }
2801              $jslog_styles[] = implode( ';', $jslog_style_cookies );
2802          }
2803          else
2804          {
2805              if( !is_logged_in() )
2806              {    // Align top when evobar is hidden
2807                  $jslog_styles[] = 'top:0';
2808              }
2809              if( $debug_jslog )
2810              {    // Display the jslog
2811                  $jslog_styles[] = 'display:block';
2812              }
2813          }
2814          $jslog_styles = count( $jslog_styles ) > 0 ? ' style="'.implode( ';', $jslog_styles ).'"' : '';
2815  
2816          $close_url = url_add_param( $_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'], 'jslog' );
2817          echo '<div id="debug_ajax_info" class="debug"'.$jslog_styles.'>';
2818          echo '<div class="jslog_titlebar">'.
2819                  'AJAX Debug log'.get_manual_link('ajax_debug_log').
2820                  action_icon( T_('Close'), 'close', $close_url, NULL, NULL, NULL, array( 'class' => 'jslog_switcher' ) ).
2821              '</div>';
2822          echo '<div id="jslog_container"></div>';
2823          echo '<div class="jslog_statusbar">'.
2824                  '<a href="'.$_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'].'#" class="jslog_clear">'.T_('Clear').'</a>'.
2825              '</div>';
2826          echo '</div>';
2827  
2828          // Make sure debug jslog output only happens once:
2829          $debug_jslog_done = true;
2830      }
2831      // ----
2832  
2833      // clean output:
2834      $clean = $is_cli || $force_clean;
2835  
2836      if( ! $force )
2837      {
2838          if( ! empty( $debug_done ) )
2839          { // Already displayed!
2840              return;
2841          }
2842  
2843          if( empty( $debug ) || // No debug output desired:
2844              ( $debug < 2 && $content_type != 'text/html' ) ) // Do not display, if no content-type header has been sent or it's != "text/html" (debug > 1 skips this)
2845          {
2846              global $evo_last_handled_error;
2847              if( ! empty( $evo_last_handled_error ) )
2848              { // If script has been stoppped by some error
2849                  // Display a message when debug is OFF and error has occured
2850                  $debug_off_title = 'An unexpected error has occured!';
2851                  $debug_off_msg1 = 'We apologize for the inconvenience.';
2852                  $debug_off_msg2 = 'This error has been automatically reported and we will work to resolve it as fast as possible.';
2853                  if( $clean )
2854                  { // CLI mode
2855                      echo '*** '.$debug_off_title.' ***'."\n\n"
2856                          .$debug_off_msg1."\n"
2857                          .$debug_off_msg2;
2858                  }
2859                  else
2860                  { // View from browser
2861                      echo '<div style="margin:1em auto;padding:10px;background:#FEFFFF;border:2px solid #F00;border-radius:6px;text-align:center;">'
2862                              .'<h2 style="margin:0;color:#F00;">'.$debug_off_title.'</h2>'
2863                              .'<p>'.$debug_off_msg1.'</p>'
2864                              .'<p style="margin-bottom:0">'.$debug_off_msg2.'</p>'
2865                          .'</div>';
2866                  }
2867              }
2868              return;
2869          }
2870      }
2871      //Make sure debug output only happens once:
2872      $debug_done = true;
2873  
2874      $printf_format = '| %-45s | %-5s | %-7s | %-5s |';
2875      $table_headerlen = 73;
2876      /* This calculates the number of dashes to print e. g. on the top and
2877       * bottom of the table and after the header, making the table look
2878       * better (looks like the tables of the mysql command line client).
2879       * Normally, the value won't change, so it's hardcoded above. If you
2880       * change the printf() format above, this might be useful.
2881      preg_match_all( '#\d+#', $printf_format, $table_headerlen );
2882      $table_headerlen = array_sum( $table_headerlen[0] ) +
2883                                      strlen( preg_replace( '#[^ \|]+#', '',
2884                                                  $printf_format ) ) - 2;
2885      */
2886  
2887      $ReqHostPathQuery = $ReqHost.$ReqPath.( empty( $_SERVER['QUERY_STRING'] ) ? '' : '?'.$_SERVER['QUERY_STRING'] );
2888  
2889      echo "\n\n\n";
2890      echo ( $clean ? '*** Debug info ***'."\n\n" : '<div class="debug" id="debug_info"><h2>Debug info</h2>' );
2891  
2892      if( !$obhandler_debug )
2893      { // don't display changing items when we want to test obhandler
2894  
2895          // ---------------------------
2896  
2897          echo '<div class="log_container"><div>';
2898  
2899          echo 'HTTP Response code: '.$http_response_code;
2900          echo $clean ? "\n" : '<br />';
2901  
2902          echo '$content_type_header: '.$content_type_header;
2903          echo $clean ? "\n" : '<br />';
2904  
2905          echo '$disp: '.$disp.' -- detail: '.$disp_detail;
2906          echo $clean ? "\n" : '<br />';
2907  
2908          echo '$robots_index: '.$robots_index;
2909          echo $clean ? "\n" : '<br />';
2910  
2911          echo '$robots_follow: '.$robots_follow;
2912          echo $clean ? "\n" : '<br />';
2913  
2914          echo '</div></div>';
2915  
2916          // ================================== DB Summary ================================
2917          if( isset($DB) )
2918          {
2919              echo '<div class="log_container"><div>';
2920              echo $DB->num_queries.' SQL queries executed in '.$Timer->get_duration( 'SQL QUERIES' )." seconds\n";
2921              if( ! $clean )
2922              {
2923                  echo ' &nbsp; <a href="'.$ReqHostPathQuery.'#evo_debug_queries">scroll down to details</a><p>';
2924              }
2925              echo '</div></div>';
2926          }
2927  
2928          // ========================== Timer table ================================
2929          $time_page = $Timer->get_duration( 'total' );
2930          $timer_rows = array();
2931          foreach( $Timer->get_categories() as $l_cat )
2932          {
2933              if( $l_cat == 'sql_query' )
2934              {
2935                  continue;
2936              }
2937              $timer_rows[ $l_cat ] = $Timer->get_duration( $l_cat );
2938          }
2939          // Don't sort to see orginal order of creation
2940          // arsort( $timer_rows );
2941          // ksort( $timer_rows );
2942  
2943          // Remove "total", it will get output as the last one:
2944          $total_time = $timer_rows['total'];
2945          unset($timer_rows['total']);
2946  
2947          $percent_total = $time_page > 0 ? number_format( 100/$time_page * $total_time, 2 ) : '0';
2948  
2949          if( $clean )
2950          {
2951              echo '== Timers =='."\n\n";
2952              echo '+'.str_repeat( '-', $table_headerlen ).'+'."\n";
2953              printf( $printf_format."\n", 'Category', 'Time', '%', 'Count' );
2954              echo '+'.str_repeat( '-', $table_headerlen ).'+'."\n";
2955          }
2956          else
2957          {
2958              echo '<table class="debug_timer"><thead>'
2959                  .'<tr><td colspan="4" class="center">Timers</td></tr>' // dh> TODO: should be TH. Workaround so that tablesorter does not pick it up. Feedback from author requested.
2960                  .'<tr><th>Category</th><th>Time</th><th>%</th><th>Count</th></tr>'
2961                  .'</thead>';
2962  
2963              // Output "total":
2964              echo "\n<tfoot><tr>"
2965                  .'<td>total</td>'
2966                  .'<td class="right red">'.$total_time.'</td>'
2967                  .'<td class="right">'.$percent_total.'%</td>'
2968                  .'<td class="right">'.$Timer->get_count('total').'</td></tr></tfoot>';
2969  
2970              echo '<tbody>';
2971          }
2972  
2973          $table_rows_collapse = array();
2974          foreach( $timer_rows as $l_cat => $l_time )
2975          {
2976              $percent_l_cat = $time_page > 0 ? number_format( 100/$time_page * $l_time, 2 ) : '0';
2977  
2978              if( $clean )
2979              {
2980                  $row = sprintf( $printf_format, $l_cat, $l_time, $percent_l_cat.'%', $Timer->get_count( $l_cat ) );
2981              }
2982              else
2983              {
2984                  $row = "\n<tr>"
2985                      .'<td>'.$l_cat.'</td>'
2986                      .'<td class="right">'.$l_time.'</td>'
2987                      .'<td class="right">'.$percent_l_cat.'%</td>'
2988                      .'<td class="right">'.$Timer->get_count( $l_cat ).'</td></tr>';
2989              }
2990  
2991              // Maybe ignore this row later, but not for clean display.
2992              if( ! $clean && ( $percent_l_cat < 1  ) )
2993              {    // Hide everything that tool less tahn 5% of the time
2994                  $table_rows_collapse[] = $row;
2995              }
2996              else
2997              {
2998                  echo $row."\n";
2999              }
3000          }
3001          $count_collapse = count($table_rows_collapse);
3002          // Collapse ignored rows, allowing to expand them with Javascript:
3003          if( $count_collapse > 5 )
3004          {
3005              echo '<tr><td colspan="4" class="center" id="evo-debuglog-timer-long-header">';
3006              echo '<a href="" onclick="var e = document.getElementById(\'evo-debuglog-timer-long\'); e.style.display = (e.style.display == \'none\' ? \'\' : \'none\'); return false;">+ '.$count_collapse.' queries &lt; 1%</a> </td></tr>';
3007              echo '</tbody>';
3008              echo '<tbody id="evo-debuglog-timer-long" style="display:none;">';
3009          }
3010          echo implode( "\n", $table_rows_collapse )."\n";
3011  
3012          if ( $clean )
3013          { // "total" (done in tfoot for html above)
3014              echo sprintf( $printf_format, 'total', $total_time, $percent_total.'%', $Timer->get_count('total') );
3015              echo '+'.str_repeat( '-', $table_headerlen ).'+'."\n\n";
3016          }
3017          else
3018          {
3019              echo "\n</tbody></table>";
3020  
3021              // add jquery.tablesorter to the "Debug info" table.
3022              require_js( 'jquery/jquery.tablesorter.min.js', 'rsc_url', true, true );
3023              echo '
3024              <script type="text/javascript">
3025              (function($){
3026                  var clicked_once;
3027                  jQuery("table.debug_timer th").click( function(event) {
3028                      if( clicked_once ) return; else clicked_once = true;
3029                      jQuery("#evo-debuglog-timer-long tr").appendTo(jQuery("table.debug_timer tbody")[0]);
3030                      jQuery("#evo-debuglog-timer-long-header").remove();
3031                      // click for tablesorter:
3032                      jQuery("table.debug_timer").tablesorter();
3033                      jQuery(event.currentTarget).click();
3034                  });
3035              })(jQuery);
3036              </script>';
3037          }
3038  
3039  
3040          // ================================ Opcode caching ================================
3041          echo '<div class="log_container"><div>';
3042          echo 'Opcode cache: '.get_active_opcode_cache();
3043          echo $clean ? "\n" : '<p>';
3044          echo '</div></div>';
3045  
3046          // ================================ Memory Usage ================================
3047          echo '<div class="log_container"><div>';
3048  
3049          foreach( array( // note: 8MB is default for memory_limit and is reported as 8388608 bytes
3050              'memory_get_usage' => array( 'display' => 'Memory usage', 'high' => 8000000 ),
3051              'memory_get_peak_usage' /* PHP 5.2 */ => array( 'display' => 'Memory peak usage', 'high' => 8000000 ) ) as $l_func => $l_var )
3052          {
3053              if( function_exists( $l_func ) )
3054              {
3055                  $_usage = $l_func();
3056  
3057                  if( $_usage > $l_var['high'] )
3058                  {
3059                      echo $clean ? '[!!] ' : '<span style="color:red; font-weight:bold">';
3060                  }
3061  
3062                  echo $l_var['display'].': '.bytesreadable( $_usage, ! $clean );
3063  
3064                  if( ! $clean && $_usage > $l_var['high'] )
3065                  {
3066                      echo '</span>';
3067                  }
3068                  echo $clean ? "\n" : '<br />';
3069              }
3070          }
3071  
3072          echo 'Len of serialized $cache_imgsize: '.strlen(serialize($cache_imgsize));
3073          echo $clean ? "\n" : '<br />';
3074          echo 'Len of serialized $cache_File: '.strlen(serialize($cache_File));
3075          echo $clean ? "\n" : '<br />';
3076  
3077          echo '</div></div>';
3078      }
3079  
3080  
3081      // DEBUGLOG(s) FROM PREVIOUS SESSIONS, after REDIRECT(s) (with list of categories at top):
3082      if( isset($Session) && ($sess_Debuglogs = $Session->get('Debuglogs')) && ! empty($sess_Debuglogs) )
3083      {
3084          $count_sess_Debuglogs = count($sess_Debuglogs);
3085          if( $count_sess_Debuglogs > 1 )
3086          { // Links to those Debuglogs:
3087              if ( $clean )
3088              {    // kind of useless, but anyway...
3089                  echo "\n".'There are '.$count_sess_Debuglogs.' Debuglogs from redirected pages.'."\n";
3090              }
3091              else
3092              {
3093                  echo '<p>There are '.$count_sess_Debuglogs.' Debuglogs from redirected pages: ';
3094                  for( $i = 1; $i <= $count_sess_Debuglogs; $i++ )
3095                  {
3096                      echo '<a href="'.$ReqHostPathQuery.'#debug_sess_debuglog_'.$i.'">#'.$i.'</a> ';
3097                  }
3098                  echo '</p>';
3099              }
3100          }
3101  
3102          foreach( $sess_Debuglogs as $k => $sess_Debuglog )
3103          {
3104              $log_categories = array( 'error', 'note', 'all' ); // Categories to output (in that order)
3105  
3106              if( $clean )
3107              {
3108                  $log_container_head = "\n".'== Debug messages from redirected page (#'.($k+1).') =='."\n"
3109                                       .'See below for the Debuglog from the current request.'."\n";
3110                  echo format_to_output(
3111                      $sess_Debuglog->display( array(
3112                              'container' => array( 'string' => $log_container_head, 'template' => false ),
3113                              'all' => array( 'string' => '= %s ='."\n\n", 'template' => false ) ),
3114                          '', false, $log_categories, '', 'raw', false ),
3115                      'raw' );
3116              }
3117              else
3118              {
3119                  $log_container_head = '<h3 id="debug_sess_debuglog_'.($k+1).'" style="color:#f00;">Debug messages from redirected page (#'.($k+1).')</h3>'
3120                      // link to real Debuglog:
3121                      .'<p><a href="'.$ReqHostPathQuery.'#debug_debuglog">See below for the Debuglog from the current request.</a></p>';
3122                  $log_cats = array_keys($sess_Debuglog->get_messages( $log_categories )); // the real list (with all replaced and only existing ones)
3123                  $log_head_links = array();
3124  
3125                  foreach( $log_cats as $l_cat )
3126                  {
3127                      $log_head_links[] .= '<a href="'.$ReqHostPathQuery.'#debug_redir_'.($k+1).'_info_cat_'.str_replace( ' ', '_', $l_cat ).'">'.$l_cat.'</a>';
3128                  }
3129                  $log_container_head .= implode( ' | ', $log_head_links );
3130  
3131                  echo '<div style="border:1px solid #F00;background:#aaa">'.
3132                      format_to_output(
3133                          $sess_Debuglog->display( array(
3134                                  'container' => array( 'string' => $log_container_head, 'template' => false ),
3135                                  'all' => array( 'string' => '<h4 id="debug_redir_'.($k+1).'_info_cat_%s">%s:</h4>', 'template' => false ) ),
3136                              '', false, $log_categories ),
3137                          'htmlbody' ).
3138                      '</div>';
3139              }
3140          }
3141  
3142          // Delete logs since they have been displayed...
3143          // EXCEPT if we are redirecting, because in this case we won't see these logs in a browser (only in request debug tools)
3144          // So in that case we want them to move over to the next page...
3145          if( $http_response_code < 300 || $http_response_code >= 400 )
3146          {    // This is NOT a 3xx redirect, assume debuglogs have been seen & delete them:
3147              $Session->delete( 'Debuglogs' );
3148          }
3149      }
3150  
3151  
3152      // CURRENT DEBUGLOG (with list of categories at top):
3153      $log_categories = array( 'error', 'note', 'all' ); // Categories to output (in that order)
3154      $log_container_head = $clean ? ( "\n".'== Debug messages =='."\n" ) : '<h3 id="debug_debuglog">Debug messages</h3>';
3155      if( ! empty($sess_Debuglogs) )
3156      { // link to first sess_Debuglog:
3157          if ( $clean )
3158          {
3159              $log_container_head .= 'See above for the Debuglog(s) from before the redirect.'."\n";
3160          }
3161          else
3162          {
3163              $log_container_head .= '<p><a href="'.$ReqHostPathQuery.'#debug_sess_debuglog_1">See above for the Debuglog(s) from before the redirect.</a></p>';
3164          }
3165      }
3166  
3167      if ( ! $clean )
3168      {
3169          $log_cats = array_keys($Debuglog->get_messages( $log_categories )); // the real list (with all replaced and only existing ones)
3170          $log_head_links = array();
3171          foreach( $log_cats as $l_cat )
3172          {
3173              $log_head_links[] .= '<a href="'.$ReqHostPathQuery.'#debug_info_cat_'.str_replace( ' ', '_', $l_cat ).'">'.$l_cat.'</a>';
3174          }
3175          $log_container_head .= implode( ' | ', $log_head_links );
3176  
3177          echo format_to_output(
3178              $Debuglog->display( array(
3179                      'container' => array( 'string' => $log_container_head, 'template' => false ),
3180                      'all' => array( 'string' => '<h4 id="debug_info_cat_%s">%s:</h4>', 'template' => false ) ),
3181                  '', false, $log_categories ),
3182              'htmlbody' );
3183  
3184          echo '<h3 id="evo_debug_queries">DB</h3>';
3185      }
3186      else
3187      {
3188          echo format_to_output(
3189              $Debuglog->display( array(
3190                      'container' => array( 'string' => $log_container_head, 'template' => false ),
3191                      'all' => array( 'string' => '= %s ='."\n\n", 'template' => false ) ),
3192                  '', false, $log_categories, '', 'raw', false ),
3193              'raw' );
3194  
3195          echo "\n".'== DB =='."\n\n";
3196      }
3197  
3198      if($db_config)
3199      {
3200          if ( ! $clean )
3201          {
3202              echo '<pre>';
3203          }
3204  
3205          echo 'Config DB Username: '.$db_config['user']."\n".
3206              'Config DB Database: '.$db_config['name']."\n".
3207               'Config DB Host: '.(isset($db_config['host']) ? $db_config['host'] : 'unset (localhost)')."\n".
3208               'Config DB tables prefix: '.$tableprefix."\n".
3209               'Config DB connection charset: '.$db_config['connection_charset']."\n";
3210  
3211          echo $clean ? "\n" : '</pre>';
3212      }
3213  
3214      if( !isset($DB) )
3215      {
3216          echo 'No DB object.'.( $clean ? "\n" : '' );
3217      }
3218      else
3219      {
3220          echo '<pre>Current DB charset: '.$DB->connection_charset."</pre>\n";
3221  
3222          $DB->dump_queries( ! $clean );
3223      }
3224  
3225      if ( ! $clean )
3226      {
3227          echo '</div>';
3228      }
3229  }

3232  /**
3233   * Exit when request is blocked
3234   *
3235   * @param string Block type: 'IP', 'Domain', 'Country'
3236   * @param string Debug message
3237   * @param string Syslog origin type: 'core', 'plugin'
3238   * @param integer Syslog origin ID
3239   */
3240  function exit_blocked_request( $block_type, $debug_message, $syslog_origin_type = 'core', $syslog_origin_ID = NULL )
3241  {
3242      global $debug;
3243  
3244      // Write system log for the request:
3245      syslog_insert( $debug_message, 'warning', NULL, NULL, $syslog_origin_type, $syslog_origin_ID );
3246  
3247      // Print out this text to inform an user:
3248      echo 'Blocked.';
3249  
3250      if( $debug )
3251      { // Display additional info on debug mode:
3252          echo ' ('.$block_type.')';
3253      }
3254  
3255      // EXIT:
3256      exit( 0 );
3257  }

3260  /**
3261   * Check if the current request exceed the post max size limit.
3262   * If too much data was sent add an error message and call header redirect.
3263   */
3264  function check_post_max_size_exceeded()
3265  {
3266      global $Messages;
3267  
3268      if( ( $_SERVER['REQUEST_METHOD'] == 'POST' ) && empty( $_POST ) && empty( $_FILES ) && ( $_SERVER['CONTENT_LENGTH'] > 0 ) )
3269      {
3270          // Check post max size ini setting
3271          $post_max_size = ini_get( 'post_max_size' );
3272  
3273          // Convert post_max_size value to bytes
3274          switch ( substr( $post_max_size, -1 ) )
3275          {
3276              case 'G':
3277                  $post_max_size = $post_max_size * 1024;
3278              case 'M':
3279                  $post_max_size = $post_max_size * 1024;
3280              case 'K':
3281                  $post_max_size = $post_max_size * 1024;
3282          }
3283  
3284          // Add error message and redirect back to the referer url
3285          $Messages->add( sprintf( T_('You have sent too much data (too many large files?) for the server to process (%s sent / %s maximum). Please try again by sending less data/files at a time.'), bytesreadable( $_SERVER['CONTENT_LENGTH'] ), bytesreadable( $post_max_size ) ) );
3286          header_redirect( $_SERVER['HTTP_REFERER'] );
3287          exit(0); // Already exited here
3288      }
3289  }

3292  /**
3293   * Prevent email header injection.
3294   */
3295  function mail_sanitize_header_string( $header_str, $close_brace = false )
3296  {
3297      // Prevent injection! (remove everything after (and including) \n or \r)
3298      $header_str = preg_replace( '~(\r|\n).*$~s', '', trim($header_str) );
3299  
3300      if( $close_brace && strpos( $header_str, '<' ) !== false && strpos( $header_str, '>' ) === false )
3301      { // We have probably stripped the '>' at the end!
3302          $header_str .= '>';
3303      }
3304  
3305      return $header_str;
3306  }
3307  
3308  /**
3309   * Encode to RFC 1342 "Representation of Non-ASCII Text in Internet Message Headers"
3310   *
3311   * @param string
3312   * @param string 'Q' for Quoted printable, 'B' for base64
3313   */
3314  function mail_encode_header_string( $header_str, $mode = 'Q' )
3315  {
3316      global $evo_charset;
3317  
3318      /* mbstring way  (did not work for Alex RU)
3319      if( function_exists('mb_encode_mimeheader') )
3320      { // encode subject
3321          $orig = mb_internal_encoding();
3322          mb_internal_encoding('utf-8');
3323          $r = mb_encode_mimeheader( $header_str, 'utf-8', $mode );
3324          mb_internal_encoding($orig);
3325          return $r;
3326      }
3327      */
3328  
3329      if( preg_match( '~[^a-z0-9!*+\-/ ]~i', $header_str ) )
3330      { // If the string actually needs some encoding
3331          if( $mode == 'Q' )
3332          { // Quoted printable is best for reading with old/text terminal mail reading/debugging stuff:
3333              $header_str = preg_replace_callback( '#[^a-z0-9!*+\-/ ]#i', 'mail_encode_header_string_callback', $header_str );
3334              $header_str = str_replace( ' ', '_', $header_str );
3335              $header_str = '=?'.$evo_charset.'?Q?'.$header_str.'?=';
3336          }
3337          else
3338          { // Base 64 -- Alex RU way:
3339              $header_str = '=?'.$evo_charset.'?B?'.base64_encode( $header_str ).'?=';
3340          }
3341      }
3342  
3343      return $header_str;
3344  }
3345  
3346  
3347  /**
3348   * Callback function for mail header encoding
3349   *
3350   * @param array Matches
3351   * @return string
3352   */
3353  function mail_encode_header_string_callback( $matches )
3354  {
3355      return sprintf( '=%02x', ord( stripslashes( $matches[0] ) ) );
3356  }

3359  /**
3360   * Get setting's value from General or User's settings
3361   *
3362   * @param integer User ID
3363   * @param string Setting ( email | name )
3364   * @return string Setting's value
3365   */
3366  function user_get_notification_sender( $user_ID, $setting )
3367  {
3368      global $Settings;
3369  
3370      $setting_name = 'notification_sender_'.$setting;
3371  
3372      if( empty( $user_ID ) )
3373      {    // Get value from general settings
3374          return $Settings->get( $setting_name );
3375      }
3376  
3377      $UserCache = & get_UserCache();
3378      if( $User = & $UserCache->get_by_ID( $user_ID ) )
3379      {
3380          if( $User->check_status( 'is_validated' ) )
3381          {    // User is Activated or Autoactivated
3382              global $UserSettings;
3383              if( $UserSettings->get( $setting_name, $user_ID ) == '' )
3384              {    // The user's setting is not defined yet
3385                  // Update the user's setting from general setting
3386                  $UserSettings->set( $setting_name, $Settings->get( $setting_name ), $user_ID );
3387                  $UserSettings->dbupdate();
3388              }
3389              else
3390              {    // User has a defined setting; Use this
3391                  return $UserSettings->get( $setting_name, $user_ID );
3392              }
3393          }
3394      }
3395  
3396      return $Settings->get( $setting_name );
3397  }

3400  /**
3401   * Sends an email, wrapping PHP's mail() function.
3402   * ALL emails sent by b2evolution must be sent through this function (for consistency and for logging)
3403   *
3404   * {@link $current_locale} will be used to set the charset.
3405   *
3406   * Note: we use a single \n as line ending, though it does not comply to {@link http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc2822 RFC2822}, but seems to be safer,
3407   * because some mail transfer agents replace \n by \r\n automatically.
3408   *
3409   * @todo Unit testing with "nice addresses" This gets broken over and over again.
3410   *
3411   * @param string Recipient email address.
3412   * @param string Recipient name.
3413   * @param string Subject of the mail
3414   * @param string|array The message text OR Array: 'charset', 'full', 'html', 'text'
3415   * @param string From address, being added to headers (we'll prevent injections); see {@link http://securephp.damonkohler.com/index.php/Email_Injection}.
3416   *               Defaults to {@link GeneralSettings::get('notification_sender_email') } if NULL.
3417   * @param string From name.
3418   * @param array Additional headers ( headername => value ). Take care of injection!
3419   * @param integer User ID
3420   * @return boolean True if mail could be sent (not necessarily delivered!), false if not - (return value of {@link mail()})
3421   */
3422  function send_mail( $to, $to_name, $subject, $message, $from = NULL, $from_name = NULL, $headers = array(), $user_ID = NULL )
3423  {
3424      global $servertimenow;
3425  
3426      // Stop a request from the blocked IP addresses or Domains
3427      antispam_block_request();
3428  
3429      global $debug, $app_name, $app_version, $current_locale, $current_charset, $evo_charset, $locales, $Debuglog, $Settings, $demo_mode, $sendmail_additional_params;
3430  
3431      $message_data = $message;
3432      if( is_array( $message_data ) && isset( $message_data['full'] ) )
3433      { // If content is multipart
3434          $message = $message_data['full'];
3435      }
3436      elseif( is_string( $message_data ) )
3437      { // Convert $message_data to array
3438          $message_data = array( 'full' => $message );
3439      }
3440  
3441      // Replace secret content in the mail logs message body
3442      $message = preg_replace( '~\$secret_content_start\$.*\$secret_content_end\$~', '***secret-content-removed***', $message );
3443      // Remove secret content marks from the message
3444      $message_data = str_replace( array( '$secret_content_start$', '$secret_content_end$' ), '', $message_data );
3445  
3446      // Memorize email address
3447      $to_email_address = $to;
3448  
3449      $NL = "\r\n";
3450  
3451      if( $demo_mode )
3452      { // Debug mode restriction: Sending email in debug mode is not allowed
3453          return false;
3454      }
3455  
3456      if( !is_array( $headers ) )
3457      { // Make sure $headers is an array
3458          $headers = array( $headers );
3459      }
3460  
3461      if( empty( $from ) )
3462      {
3463          $from = user_get_notification_sender( $user_ID, 'email' );
3464      }
3465  
3466      if( empty( $from_name ) )
3467      {
3468          $from_name = user_get_notification_sender( $user_ID, 'name' );
3469      }
3470  
3471      // Pass these data for SMTP mailer
3472      $message_data['to_email'] = $to;
3473      $message_data['to_name'] = empty( $to_name ) ? NULL : $to_name;
3474      $message_data['from_email'] = $from;
3475      $message_data['from_name'] = empty( $from_name ) ? NULL : $from_name;
3476  
3477      $return_path = $Settings->get( 'notification_return_path' );
3478  
3479      // Add real name into $from...
3480      if( ! is_windows() )
3481      {    // fplanque: Windows XP, Apache 1.3, PHP 4.4, MS SMTP : will not accept "nice" addresses.
3482          if( !empty( $to_name ) )
3483          {
3484              $to = '"'.mail_encode_header_string($to_name).'" <'.$to.'>';
3485          }
3486          if( !empty( $from_name ) )
3487          {
3488              $from = '"'.mail_encode_header_string($from_name).'" <'.$from.'>';
3489          }
3490      }
3491  
3492      $from = mail_sanitize_header_string( $from, true );
3493      // From has to go into headers
3494      $headers['From'] = $from;
3495      if( !empty( $return_path ) )
3496      {    // Set a return path
3497          $headers['Return-Path'] = $return_path;
3498      }
3499  
3500      // echo 'sending email to: ['.htmlspecialchars($to).'] from ['.htmlspecialchars($from).']';
3501  
3502      $clear_subject = $subject;
3503      $subject = mail_encode_header_string($subject);
3504  
3505      $message = str_replace( array( "\r\n", "\r" ), $NL, $message );
3506  
3507      // Convert encoding of message (from internal encoding to the one of the message):
3508      // fp> why do we actually convert to $current_charset?
3509      // dh> I do not remember. Appears to make sense sending it unconverted in $evo_charset.
3510      // asimo> converting the message creates wrong output, no need for conversion, however this needs further investigation
3511      // $message = convert_charset( $message, $current_charset, $evo_charset );
3512  
3513      if( !isset( $headers['Content-Type'] ) )
3514      {    // Specify charset and content-type of email
3515          $headers['Content-Type'] = 'text/plain; charset='.$current_charset;
3516      }
3517      $headers['MIME-Version'] = '1.0';
3518  
3519      $headers['Date'] = gmdate( 'r', $servertimenow );
3520  
3521      // ADDITIONAL HEADERS:
3522      $headers['X-Mailer'] = $app_name.' '.$app_version.' - PHP/'.phpversion();
3523      $ip_list = implode( ',', get_ip_list() );
3524      if( !empty( $ip_list ) )
3525      { // Add X-Remote_Addr param only if its value is not empty
3526          $headers['X-Remote-Addr'] = $ip_list;
3527      }
3528  
3529      // COMPACT HEADERS:
3530      $headerstring = get_mail_headers( $headers, $NL );
3531  
3532      // Set an additional parameter for the return path:
3533      if( ! empty( $sendmail_additional_params ) )
3534      {
3535          $additional_parameters = str_replace(
3536              array( '$from-address$', '$return-address$' ),
3537              array( $from, ( empty( $return_path ) ? $from : $return_path ) ),
3538              $sendmail_additional_params );
3539      }
3540      else
3541      {
3542          $additional_parameters = '';
3543      }
3544  
3545      if( mail_is_blocked( $to_email_address ) )
3546      { // Check if the email address is blocked
3547          $Debuglog->add( 'Sending mail to &laquo;'.htmlspecialchars( $to_email_address ).'&raquo; FAILED, because this email marked with spam or permanent errors.', 'error' );
3548  
3549          mail_log( $user_ID, $to_email_address, $clear_subject, $message, $headerstring, 'blocked' );
3550  
3551          return false;
3552      }
3553  
3554      // SEND MESSAGE:
3555      if( $debug > 1 )
3556      { // We agree to die for debugging...
3557          if( ! evo_mail( $to, $subject, $message_data, $headers, $additional_parameters ) )
3558          {
3559              mail_log( $user_ID, $to_email_address, $clear_subject, $message, $headerstring, 'error' );
3560  
3561              debug_die( 'Sending mail from &laquo;'.htmlspecialchars($from).'&raquo; to &laquo;'.htmlspecialchars($to).'&raquo;, Subject &laquo;'.htmlspecialchars($subject).'&raquo; FAILED.' );
3562          }
3563      }
3564      else
3565      { // Soft debugging only....
3566          if( ! evo_mail( $to, $subject, $message_data, $headers, $additional_parameters ) )
3567          {
3568              $Debuglog->add( 'Sending mail from &laquo;'.htmlspecialchars($from).'&raquo; to &laquo;'.htmlspecialchars($to).'&raquo;, Subject &laquo;'.htmlspecialchars($subject).'&raquo; FAILED.', 'error' );
3569  
3570              mail_log( $user_ID, $to_email_address, $clear_subject, $message, $headerstring, 'error' );
3571  
3572              return false;
3573          }
3574      }
3575  
3576      $Debuglog->add( 'Sent mail from &laquo;'.htmlspecialchars($from).'&raquo; to &laquo;'.htmlspecialchars($to).'&raquo;, Subject &laquo;'.htmlspecialchars($subject).'&raquo;.' );
3577  
3578      mail_log( $user_ID, $to_email_address, $clear_subject, $message, $headerstring, 'ok' );
3579  
3580      return true;
3581  }
3582  
3583  
3584  /**
3585   * Sends an email to User
3586   *
3587   * @param integer Recipient ID.
3588   * @param string Subject of the mail
3589   * @param string Email template name
3590   * @param array Email template params
3591   * @param boolean Force to send this email even if the user is not activated. By default not activated user won't get emails.
3592   *                Pasword reset, and account activation emails must be always forced.
3593   * @param array Additional headers ( headername => value ). Take care of injection!
3594   * @param string Use this param if you want use different email address instead of $User->email
3595   * @return boolean True if mail could be sent (not necessarily delivered!), false if not - (return value of {@link mail()})
3596   */
3597  function send_mail_to_User( $user_ID, $subject, $template_name, $template_params = array(), $force_on_non_activated = false, $headers = array(), $force_email_address = '' )
3598  {
3599      global $UserSettings, $Settings, $current_charset;
3600  
3601      $UserCache = & get_UserCache();
3602      if( $User = $UserCache->get_by_ID( $user_ID ) )
3603      {
3604          if( !$User->check_status( 'can_receive_any_message' ) )
3605          { // user status doesn't allow to receive nor emails nor private messages
3606              return false;
3607          }
3608  
3609          if( !( $User->check_status( 'is_validated' ) || $force_on_non_activated ) )
3610          { // user is not activated and non activated users should not receive emails, unless force_on_non_activated is turned on
3611              return false;
3612          }
3613  
3614          // Check if a new email to User with the corrensponding email type is allowed
3615          switch( $template_name )
3616          {
3617              case 'account_activate':
3618                  if( $Settings->get( 'validation_process' ) == 'easy' && !$template_params['is_reminder'] )
3619                  { // this is not a notification email
3620                      break;
3621                  }
3622              case 'private_message_new':
3623              case 'private_messages_unread_reminder':
3624              case 'post_new':
3625              case 'comment_new':
3626              case 'account_activated':
3627              case 'account_closed':
3628              case 'account_reported':
3629              case 'account_changed':
3630                  // this is a notificaiton email
3631                  $email_limit_setting = 'notification_email_limit';
3632                  $email_counter_setting = 'last_notification_email';
3633                  if( !check_allow_new_email( $email_limit_setting, $email_counter_setting, $User->ID ) )
3634                  { // more notification email is not allowed today
3635                      return false;
3636                  }
3637                  break;
3638              case 'newsletter':
3639                  // this is a newsletter email
3640                  $email_limit_setting = 'newsletter_limit';
3641                  $email_counter_setting = 'last_newsletter';
3642                  if( !check_allow_new_email( $email_limit_setting, $email_counter_setting, $User->ID ) )
3643                  { // more newsletter email is not allowed today
3644                      return false;
3645                  }
3646                  break;
3647              case 'newsletter_test':
3648                  // this is a newsletter email, used to send test email by current admin
3649                  $template_name = 'newsletter';
3650                  break;
3651          }
3652  
3653          // Update notification sender's info from General settings
3654          $User->update_sender();
3655  
3656          switch( $UserSettings->get( 'email_format', $User->ID ) )
3657          {    // Set Content-Type from user's setting "Email format"
3658              case 'auto':
3659                  $template_params['boundary'] = 'b2evo-'.md5( rand() );
3660                  $headers['Content-Type'] = 'multipart/mixed; boundary="'.$template_params['boundary'].'"';
3661                  break;
3662              case 'html':
3663                  $headers['Content-Type'] = 'text/html; charset='.$current_charset;
3664                  break;
3665              case 'text':
3666                  $headers['Content-Type'] = 'text/plain; charset='.$current_charset;
3667                  break;
3668          }
3669  
3670          if( ! isset( $template_params['recipient_User'] ) )
3671          { // Set recipient User, it should be defined for each template because of email footer
3672              $template_params['recipient_User'] = $User;
3673          }
3674  
3675          // Get a message text from template file
3676          $message = mail_template( $template_name, $UserSettings->get( 'email_format', $User->ID ), $template_params, $User );
3677  
3678          // Autoinsert user's data
3679          $subject = mail_autoinsert_user_data( $subject, $User );
3680          $message = mail_autoinsert_user_data( $message, $User );
3681  
3682          $to_email = !empty( $force_email_address ) ? $force_email_address : $User->email;
3683  
3684          if( send_mail( $to_email, NULL, $subject, $message, NULL, NULL, $headers, $user_ID ) )
3685          { // email was sent, update last email settings;
3686              if( isset( $email_limit_setting, $email_counter_setting ) )
3687              { // User Settings(email counters) need to be updated
3688                  update_user_email_counter( $email_limit_setting, $email_counter_setting, $user_ID );
3689              }
3690              return true;
3691          }
3692      }
3693  
3694      // No user or email could not be sent
3695      return false;
3696  }
3697  
3698  
3699  /**
3700   * Autoinsert user's data into subject or message of the email
3701   *
3702   * @param string Text
3703   * @param object User
3704   * @return string Text
3705  */
3706  function mail_autoinsert_user_data( $text, $User = NULL )
3707  {
3708      if( !$User )
3709      {    // No user
3710          return $text;
3711      }
3712  
3713      $rpls_from = array( '$login$' , '$email$', '$user_ID$', '$unsubscribe_key$' );
3714      $rpls_to = array( $User->login, $User->email, $User->ID, '$secret_content_start$'.md5( $User->ID.$User->unsubscribe_key ).'$secret_content_end$' );
3715  
3716      return str_replace( $rpls_from, $rpls_to, $text );
3717  }
3718  
3719  
3720  /**
3721   * Get a mail message text by template name
3722   *
3723   * @param string Template name
3724   * @param string Email format ( auto | html | text )
3725   * @param array Params
3726   * @param object User
3727   * @return string|array Mail message OR Array of the email contents when message is multipart content
3728   */
3729  function mail_template( $template_name, $format = 'auto', $params = array(), $User = NULL )
3730  {
3731      global $current_charset;
3732  
3733      if( !empty( $params['locale'] ) )
3734      { // Switch to locale for current email template
3735          locale_temp_switch( $params['locale'] );
3736      }
3737  
3738      // Set extension of template
3739      $template_exts = array();
3740      switch( $format )
3741      {
3742          case 'auto':
3743              // $template_exts['non-mime'] = '.txt.php'; // The area that is ignored by MIME-compliant clients
3744              $template_exts['text'] = '.txt.php';
3745              $template_exts['html'] = '.html.php';
3746              $boundary = $params['boundary'];
3747              $boundary_alt = 'b2evo-alt-'.md5( rand() );
3748              $template_headers = array(
3749                      'text' => 'Content-Type: text/plain; charset='.$current_charset,
3750                      'html' => 'Content-Type: text/html; charset='.$current_charset,
3751                  );
3752              // Store all contents in this array for multipart message
3753              $template_contents = array(
3754                      'charset' => $current_charset, // Charset for email message
3755                      'full' => '', // Full content with html and plain
3756                      'html' => '', // HTML
3757                      'text' => '', // Plain text
3758                  );
3759              break;
3760  
3761          case 'html':
3762              $template_exts['html'] = '.html.php';
3763              break;
3764  
3765          case 'text':
3766              $template_exts['text'] = '.txt.php';
3767              break;
3768      }
3769  
3770      $template_message = '';
3771  
3772      if( isset( $boundary, $boundary_alt ) )
3773      { // Start new boundary content
3774          $template_message .= "\n".'--'.$boundary."\n";
3775          $template_message .= 'Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="'.$boundary_alt.'"'."\n\n";
3776      }
3777  
3778      foreach( $template_exts as $format => $ext )
3779      {
3780          $formated_message = '';
3781  
3782          if( isset( $boundary, $boundary_alt ) && $format != 'non-mime' )
3783          { // Start new boundary alt content
3784              $template_message .= "\n".'--'.$boundary_alt."\n";
3785          }
3786  
3787          if( isset( $template_headers[ $format ] ) )
3788          { // Header data for each content
3789              $template_message .= $template_headers[ $format ]."\n\n";
3790          }
3791  
3792          // Get mail template
3793          ob_start();
3794          emailskin_include( $template_name.$ext, $params );
3795          $formated_message .= ob_get_clean();
3796  
3797          if( !empty( $User ) )
3798          { // Replace $login$ with gender colored link + icon in HTML format,
3799            //   and with simple login text in PLAIN TEXT format
3800              $user_login = $format == 'html' ? $User->get_colored_login( array( 'mask' => '$avatar$ $login$', 'use_style' => true ) ) : $User->login;
3801              $formated_message = str_replace( '$login$', $user_login, $formated_message );
3802          }
3803  
3804          if( $format == 'html' )
3805          { // Use "http://" for protocol-relative urls because email browsers cannot load such urls:
3806              $formated_message = preg_replace( '~(src|href)="//~', '$1="http://', $formated_message );
3807          }
3808  
3809          $template_message .= $formated_message;
3810          if( isset( $template_contents ) )
3811          { // Multipart content
3812              $template_contents[ $format ] = $formated_message;
3813          }
3814      }
3815  
3816      if( isset( $boundary, $boundary_alt ) )
3817      { // End all boundary contents
3818          $template_message .= "\n".'--'.$boundary_alt.'--'."\n";
3819          $template_message .= "\n".'--'.$boundary.'--'."\n";
3820      }
3821  
3822      if( !empty( $params['locale'] ) )
3823      { // Restore previous locale
3824          locale_restore_previous();
3825      }
3826  
3827      if( isset( $template_contents ) )
3828      { // Return array for multipart content
3829          $template_contents['full'] = $template_message;
3830          return $template_contents;
3831      }
3832      else
3833      { // Return string if email message contains one content (html or text)
3834          return $template_message;
3835      }
3836  }
3837  
3838  
3839  /**
3840   * Include email template from folder /skins_email/custom/ or /skins_email/
3841   *
3842   * @param string Template name
3843   * @param array Params
3844   */
3845  function emailskin_include( $template_name, $params = array() )
3846  {
3847      global $emailskins_path, $rsc_url;
3848  
3849      /**
3850      * @var Log
3851      */
3852      global $Debuglog;
3853      global $Timer;
3854  
3855      $timer_name = 'emailskin_include('.$template_name.')';
3856      $Timer->resume( $timer_name );
3857  
3858      $is_customized = false;
3859  
3860      // Try to include custom template firstly
3861      $template_path = $emailskins_path.'custom/'.$template_name;
3862      if( file_exists( $template_path ) )
3863      { // Include custom template file if it exists
3864          $Debuglog->add( 'emailskin_include: '.rel_path_to_base( $template_path ), 'skins' );
3865          require $template_path;
3866          // This template is customized, Don't include standard template
3867          $is_customized = true;
3868      }
3869  
3870      if( !$is_customized )
3871      { // Try to include standard template only if custom template doesn't exist
3872          $template_path = $emailskins_path.$template_name;
3873          if( file_exists( $template_path ) )
3874          { // Include standard template file if it exists
3875              $Debuglog->add( 'emailskin_include: '.rel_path_to_base( $template_path ), 'skins' );
3876              require $template_path;
3877          }
3878      }
3879  
3880      $Timer->pause( $timer_name );
3881  }

3883  
3884  /**
3885   * Get attribute "style" by class name for element in email templates
3886   *
3887   * @param string Class name
3888   * @param boolean TRUE to return string as ' style="css_properties"' otherwise only 'css_properties'
3889   * @return string
3890   */
3891  function emailskin_style( $class, $set_attr_name = true )
3892  {
3893      global $emailskins_styles;
3894  
3895      if( ! is_array( $emailskins_styles ) )
3896      { // Load email styles only first time
3897          global $emailskins_path;
3898          require_once $emailskins_path.'_email_style.php';
3899  
3900          foreach( $emailskins_styles as $classes => $styles )
3901          {
3902              if( strpos( $classes, ',' ) !== false )
3903              { // This style is used for several classes
3904                  unset( $emailskins_styles[ $classes ] );
3905                  $classes = explode( ',', $classes );
3906                  foreach( $classes as $class_name )
3907                  {
3908                      $class_name = trim( $class_name );
3909                      if( isset( $emailskins_styles[ $class_name ] ) )
3910                      {
3911                          $emailskins_styles[ $class_name ] .= $styles;
3912                      }
3913                      else
3914                      {
3915                          $emailskins_styles[ $class_name ] = $styles;
3916                      }
3917                  }
3918              }
3919          }
3920      }
3921  
3922      if( strpos( $class, '+' ) !== false )
3923      { // Several classes should be applied this
3924          $classes = explode( '+', $class );
3925          $style = '';
3926          foreach( $classes as $c => $class )
3927          {
3928              $style .= emailskin_style( $class, false );
3929          }
3930  
3931          return empty( $style ) ? '' : ( $set_attr_name ? ' style="'.$style.'"' : $style );
3932      }
3933      elseif( isset( $emailskins_styles[ $class ] ) )
3934      { // One class
3935          $style = trim( str_replace( array( "\r", "\n", "\t" ), '', $emailskins_styles[ $class ] ) );
3936          $style = str_replace( ': ', ':', $style );
3937  
3938          return $set_attr_name ? ' style="'.$style.'"' : $style;
3939      }
3940  
3941      return '';
3942  }
3943  
3944  
3945  /**
3946   * If first parameter evaluates to true printf() gets called using the first parameter
3947   * as args and the second parameter as print-pattern
3948   *
3949   * @param mixed variable to test and output if it's true or $disp_none is given
3950   * @param string printf-pattern to use (%s gets replaced by $var)
3951   * @param string printf-pattern to use, if $var is numeric and > 1 (%s gets replaced by $var)
3952   * @param string printf-pattern to use if $var evaluates to false (%s gets replaced by $var)
3953   */
3954  function disp_cond( $var, $disp_one, $disp_more = NULL, $disp_none = NULL )
3955  {
3956      if( is_numeric($var) && $var > 1 )
3957      {
3958          printf( ( $disp_more === NULL ? $disp_one : $disp_more ), $var );
3959          return true;
3960      }
3961      elseif( $var )
3962      {
3963          printf( $disp_one, $var );
3964          return true;
3965      }
3966      else
3967      {
3968          if( $disp_none !== NULL )
3969          {
3970              printf( $disp_none, $var );
3971              return false;
3972          }
3973      }
3974  }
