3976  
3977  /**
3978   * Create IMG tag for an action icon.
3979   *
3980   * @param string TITLE text (IMG and A link)
3981   * @param string icon code for {@link get_icon()}
3982   * @param string URL where the icon gets linked to (empty to not wrap the icon in a link)
3983   * @param string word to be displayed after icon (if no icon gets displayed, $title will be used instead!)
3984   * @param integer 1-5: weight of the icon. The icon will be displayed only if its weight is >= than the user setting threshold.
3985   *                     Use 5, if it's a required icon - all others could get disabled by the user. (Default: 4)
3986   * @param integer 1-5: weight of the word. The word will be displayed only if its weight is >= than the user setting threshold.
3987   *                     (Default: 1)
3988   * @param array Additional attributes to the A tag. The values must be properly encoded for html output (e.g. quotes).
3989   *        It may also contain these params:
3990   *         - 'use_js_popup': if true, the link gets opened as JS popup. You must also pass an "id" attribute for this!
3991   *         - 'use_js_size': use this to override the default popup size ("500, 400")
3992   *         - 'class': defaults to 'action_icon', if not set; use "" to not use it
3993   * @param array Attributes for the icon
3994   * @return string The generated action icon link.
3995   */
3996  function action_icon( $title, $icon, $url, $word = NULL, $icon_weight = NULL, $word_weight = NULL, $link_attribs = array(), $icon_attribs = array() )
3997  {
3998      global $UserSettings;
3999  
4000      $link_attribs['href'] = $url;
4001      $link_attribs['title'] = $title;
4002  
4003      if( is_null($icon_weight) )
4004      {
4005          $icon_weight = 4;
4006      }
4007      if( is_null($word_weight) )
4008      {
4009          $word_weight = 1;
4010      }
4011  
4012      if( ! isset($link_attribs['class']) )
4013      {
4014          $link_attribs['class'] = 'action_icon';
4015      }
4016  
4017      if( get_icon( $icon, 'rollover' ) )
4018      {
4019          if( empty($link_attribs['class']) )
4020          {
4021              $link_attribs['class'] = 'rollover';
4022          }
4023          else
4024          {
4025              $link_attribs['class'] .= ' rollover';
4026          }
4027  
4028          if( get_icon( $icon, 'sprite' ) )
4029          { // Set class "rollover_sprite" If image uses sprite
4030              $link_attribs['class'] .= '_sprite';
4031          }
4032      }
4033      //$link_attribs['class'] .= $icon != '' ? ' '.$icon : ' noicon';
4034  
4035      // "use_js_popup": open link in a JS popup
4036      // TODO: this needs to be rewritten with jQuery instead
4037      if( false && ! empty($link_attribs['use_js_popup']) )
4038      {
4039          $popup_js = 'var win = new PopupWindow(); win.setUrl( \''.$link_attribs['href'].'\' ); win.setSize(  ); ';
4040  
4041          if( isset($link_attribs['use_js_size']) )
4042          {
4043              if( ! empty($link_attribs['use_js_size']) )
4044              {
4045                  $popup_size = $link_attribs['use_js_size'];
4046              }
4047          }
4048          else
4049          {
4050              $popup_size = '500, 400';
4051          }
4052          if( isset($popup_size) )
4053          {
4054              $popup_js .= 'win.setSize( '.$popup_size.' ); ';
4055          }
4056          $popup_js .= 'win.showPopup(\''.$link_attribs['id'].'\'); return false;';
4057  
4058          if( empty( $link_attribs['onclick'] ) )
4059          {
4060              $link_attribs['onclick'] = $popup_js;
4061          }
4062          else
4063          {
4064              $link_attribs['onclick'] .= $popup_js;
4065          }
4066          unset($link_attribs['use_js_popup']);
4067          unset($link_attribs['use_js_size']);
4068      }
4069  
4070      $display_icon = empty( $UserSettings ) ? false : ($icon_weight >= $UserSettings->get('action_icon_threshold'));
4071      $display_word = empty( $UserSettings ) ? false : ($word_weight >= $UserSettings->get('action_word_threshold'));
4072  
4073      $a_body = '';
4074  
4075      if( $display_icon || ! $display_word )
4076      {    // We MUST display an action icon in order to make the user happy:
4077          // OR we default to icon because the user doesn't want the word either!!
4078  
4079          $icon_attribs = array_merge( array(
4080                  'title' => $title
4081              ), $icon_attribs );
4082  
4083          if( $icon_s = get_icon( $icon, 'imgtag', $icon_attribs, true ) )
4084          {
4085              $a_body .= $icon_s;
4086          }
4087          else
4088          { // fallback to word
4089              $display_word = true;
4090          }
4091      }
4092  
4093      if( $display_word )
4094      {    // We MUST display an action word in order to make the user happy:
4095  
4096          if( $display_icon )
4097          { // We already have an icon, display a SHORT word:
4098              if( !empty($word) )
4099              {    // We have provided a short word:
4100                  $a_body .= $word;
4101              }
4102              else
4103              {    // We fall back to alt:
4104                  $a_body .= get_icon( $icon, 'legend' );
4105              }
4106          }
4107          else
4108          {    // No icon display, let's display a LONG word/text:
4109              $a_body .= trim( $title, ' .!' );
4110          }
4111  
4112          // Add class "hoverlink" for icon with text
4113          $link_attribs['class'] .= ' hoverlink';
4114      }
4115  
4116  
4117      // NOTE: We do not use format_to_output with get_field_attribs_as_string() here, because it interferes with the Results class (eval() fails on entitied quotes..) (blueyed)
4118      return '<a'.get_field_attribs_as_string( $link_attribs, false ).'>'.$a_body.'</a>';
4119  }
4120  
4121  
4122  /**
4123   * Get properties of an icon.
4124   *
4125   * Note: to get a file type icon, use {@link File::get_icon()} instead.
4126   *
4127   * @uses get_icon_info()
4128   * @param string icon for what? (key)
4129   * @param string what to return for that icon ('imgtag', 'alt', 'legend', 'file', 'url', 'size' {@link imgsize()})
4130   * @param array additional params
4131   *   - 'class' => class name when getting 'imgtag',
4132   *   - 'size' => param for 'size',
4133   *   - 'title' => title attribute for 'imgtag'
4134   * @param boolean true to include this icon into the legend at the bottom of the page (works for 'imgtag' only)
4135   * @return mixed False on failure, string on success.
4136   */
4137  function get_icon( $iconKey, $what = 'imgtag', $params = NULL, $include_in_legend = false )
4138  {
4139      global $admin_subdir, $Debuglog, $use_strict;
4140      global $conf_path;
4141      global $rsc_path, $rsc_uri;
4142  
4143      if( ! function_exists('get_icon_info') )
4144      {
4145          require_once $conf_path.'_icons.php';
4146      }
4147  
4148      $icon = get_icon_info($iconKey);
4149      if( ! $icon )
4150      {
4151          $Debuglog->add('No image defined for '.var_export( $iconKey, true ).'!', 'icons');
4152          return false;
4153      }
4154  
4155      if( !isset( $icon['file'] ) && $what != 'imgtag' )
4156      {
4157          $icon['file'] = 'icons/icons_sprite.png';
4158      }
4159  
4160      switch( $what )
4161      {
4162          case 'rollover':
4163              if( isset( $icon['rollover'] ) )
4164              { // Image has rollover available
4165                  global $b2evo_icons_type;
4166  
4167                  if( isset( $b2evo_icons_type ) && ( ! empty( $icon['glyph'] ) || ! empty( $icon['fa'] ) ) )
4168                  { // Glyph and font-awesome icons don't have rollover effect
4169                      return false;
4170                  }
4171                  return $icon['rollover'];
4172              }
4173              return false;
4174              /* BREAK */
4175  
4176  
4177          case 'file':
4178              return $rsc_path.$icon['file'];
4179              /* BREAK */
4180  
4181  
4182          case 'alt':
4183              if( isset( $icon['alt'] ) )
4184              { // alt tag from $map_iconfiles
4185                  return $icon['alt'];
4186              }
4187              else
4188              { // fallback to $iconKey as alt-tag
4189                  return $iconKey;
4190              }
4191              /* BREAK */
4192  
4193  
4194          case 'legend':
4195              if( isset( $icon['legend'] ) )
4196              { // legend tag from $map_iconfiles
4197                  return $icon['legend'];
4198              }
4199              else
4200              if( isset( $icon['alt'] ) )
4201              { // alt tag from $map_iconfiles
4202                  return $icon['alt'];
4203              }
4204              else
4205              { // fallback to $iconKey as alt-tag
4206                  return $iconKey;
4207              }
4208              /* BREAK */
4209  
4210  
4211          case 'class':
4212              if( isset($icon['class']) )
4213              {
4214                  return $icon['class'];
4215              }
4216              else
4217              {
4218                  return '';
4219              }
4220              /* BREAK */
4221  
4222          case 'url':
4223              return $rsc_uri.$icon['file'];
4224              /* BREAK */
4225  
4226          case 'size':
4227              if( !isset( $icon['size'] ) )
4228              {

4609   * @param string time
4610   */
4611  function form_date( $date, $time = '' )

4614  }

4616  
4617  /**
4618   * Get list of client IP addresses from REMOTE_ADDR and HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR,
4619   * in this order. '' is used when no IP could be found.
4620   *
4621   * @param boolean True, to get only the first IP (probably REMOTE_ADDR)
4622   * @param boolean True, to convert IPv6 to IPv4 format
4623   * @return array|string Depends on first param.
4624   */
4625  function get_ip_list( $firstOnly = false, $convert_to_ipv4 = false )
4626  {
4627      $r = array();
4628  
4629      if( ! empty( $_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'] ) )
4630      {
4631          foreach( explode( ',', $_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'] ) as $l_ip )
4632          {
4633              $l_ip = trim( $l_ip );
4634              if( ! empty( $l_ip ) )
4635              {
4636                  if( $convert_to_ipv4 )
4637                  { // Convert IP address to IPv4 format(if it is in IPv6 format)
4638                      $l_ip = int2ip( ip2int( $l_ip ) );
4639                  }
4640                  $r[] = $l_ip;
4641              }
4642          }
4643      }
4644  
4645      if( ! empty( $_SERVER['HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR'] ) )
4646      { // IP(s) behind Proxy - this can be easily forged!
4647          foreach( explode( ',', $_SERVER['HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR'] ) as $l_ip )
4648          {
4649              $l_ip = trim( $l_ip );
4650              if( ! empty( $l_ip ) && $l_ip != 'unknown' )
4651              {
4652                  if( $convert_to_ipv4 )
4653                  { // Convert IP address to IPv4 format(if it is in IPv6 format)
4654                      $l_ip = int2ip( ip2int( $l_ip ) );
4655                  }
4656                  $r[] = $l_ip;
4657              }
4658          }
4659      }
4660  
4661      if( ! isset( $r[0] ) )
4662      { // No IP found.
4663          $r[] = '';
4664      }
4665  
4666      // Remove the duplicates
4667      $r = array_unique( $r );
4668  
4669      return $firstOnly ? $r[0] : $r;
4670  }
4671  
4672  
4673  /**
4674   * Get list of IP addresses with link to back-office page if User has an access
4675   *
4676   * @param object|NULL User
4677   * @param array|NULL List of IP addresses
4678   * @param string Text of link, Use '#' to display IP address
4679   * @return array List of IP addresses
4680   */
4681  function get_linked_ip_list( $ip_list = NULL, $User = NULL, $link_text = '#' )
4682  {
4683      if( $User === NULL )
4684      { // Get current User by default
4685          global $current_User;
4686          $User = & $current_User;
4687      }
4688  
4689      if( $ip_list === NULL )
4690      { // Get IP addresses by function get_ip_list()
4691          $ip_list = get_ip_list( false, true );
4692      }
4693  
4694      if( ! empty( $User ) &&
4695          $User->check_perm( 'admin', 'restricted' ) &&
4696          $User->check_perm( 'spamblacklist', 'view' ) )
4697      { // User has an access to backoffice, Display a link for each IP address
4698          global $admin_url;
4699          foreach( $ip_list as $i => $ip_address )
4700          {
4701              if( $link_text == '#' )
4702              { // Use IP address aslink text
4703                  $link_text = $ip_address;
4704              }
4705              $ip_list[ $i ] = '<a href="'.$admin_url.'?ctrl=antispam&amp;tab3=ipranges&amp;ip_address='.$ip_address.'">'.$link_text.'</a>';
4706          }
4707      }
4708  
4709      return $ip_list;
4710  }

4712  
4713  /**
4714   * Get the base domain (without protocol and any subdomain) of an URL.
4715   *
4716   * Gets a max of 3 domain parts (x.y.tld)
4717   *
4718   * @param string URL
4719   * @return string the base domain (may become empty, if found invalid)
4720   */
4721  function get_base_domain( $url )
4722  {
4723      global $evo_charset;
4724  
4725      //echo '<p>'.$url;
4726      // Chop away the http part and the path:
4727      $domain = preg_replace( '~^([a-z]+://)?([^:/#]+)(.*)$~i', '\\2', $url );
4728  
4729      if( empty($domain) || preg_match( '~^(\d+\.)+\d+$~', $domain ) )
4730      {    // Empty or All numeric = IP address, don't try to cut it any further
4731          return $domain;
4732      }
4733  
4734      //echo '<br>'.$domain;
4735  
4736      // Get the base domain up to 3 levels (x.y.tld):
4737      // NOTE: "_" is not really valid, but for Windows it is..
4738      // NOTE: \w includes "_"
4739  
4740      // convert URL to IDN:
4741      $domain = idna_encode($domain);
4742  
4743      $domain_pattern = '~ ( \w (\w|-|_)* \. ){0,2}   \w (\w|-|_)* $~ix';
4744      if( ! preg_match( $domain_pattern, $domain, $match ) )
4745      {
4746          return '';
4747      }
4748      $base_domain = convert_charset(idna_decode($match[0]), $evo_charset, 'UTF-8');
4749  
4750      // Remove any www. prefix:
4751      $base_domain = preg_replace( '~^www\.~i', '', $base_domain );
4752  
4753      //echo '<br>'.$base_domain.'</p>';
4754  
4755      return $base_domain;
4756  }
4757  
4758  
4759  /**
4760   * Generate a valid key of size $length.
4761   *
4762   * @param integer length of key
4763   * @param string chars to use in generated key
4764   * @return string key
4765   */
4766  function generate_random_key( $length = 32, $keychars = 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ0123456789' )
4767  {
4768      $key = '';
4769      $rnd_max = strlen($keychars) - 1;
4770  
4771      for( $i = 0; $i < $length; $i++ )
4772      {
4773          $key .= $keychars{mt_rand(0, $rnd_max)}; // get a random character out of $keychars
4774      }
4775  
4776      return $key;
4777  }
4778  
4779  
4780  /**
4781   * Generate a random password with no ambiguous chars
4782   *
4783   * @param integer length of password
4784   * @return string password
4785   */
4786  function generate_random_passwd( $length = NULL )
4787  {
4788      // fp> NOTE: do not include any characters that would make autogenerated passwords ambiguous
4789      // 1 (one) vs l (L) vs I (i)
4790      // O (letter) vs 0 (digit)
4791  
4792      if( empty($length) )
4793      {
4794          $length = rand( 8, 14 );
4795      }
4796  
4797      return generate_random_key( $length, 'abcdefghijkmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHJKLMNPQRSTUVWXYZ23456789' );
4798  }

4800  
4801  function is_create_action( $action )
4802  {
4803      $action_parts = explode( '_', $action );
4804  
4805      switch( $action_parts[0] )
4806      {
4807          case 'new':
4808          case 'new_switchtab':
4809          case 'copy':
4810          case 'create':    // we return in this state after a validation error
4811          case 'preview':
4812              return true;
4813  
4814          case 'edit':
4815          case 'edit_switchtab':
4816          case 'update':    // we return in this state after a validation error
4817          case 'delete':
4818          // The following one's a bit far fetched, but can happen if we have no sheet display:
4819          case 'unlink':
4820          case 'view':
4821              return false;
4822  
4823          default:
4824              debug_die( 'Unhandled action in form: '.strip_tags($action_parts[0]) );
4825      }
4826  }

4840  /**
4841   * Decompact a date in a date format ( Y-m-d h:m:s )
4842   *
4843   * @param string date
4844   */
4845  function decompact_date( $date )
4846  {
4847      $date0 = $date;
4848  
4849      return  substr($date0,0,4).'-'.substr($date0,4,2).'-'.substr($date0,6,2).' '
4850                                  .substr($date0,8,2).':'.substr($date0,10,2).':'.substr($date0,12,2);
4851  }
4852  
4853  /**
4854   * Check the format of the phone number param and
4855   * format it in a french number if it is.
4856   *
4857   * @param string phone number
4858   */
4859  function format_phone( $phone, $hide_country_dialing_code_if_same_as_locale = true )
4860  {
4861      global $CountryCache;
4862  
4863      $dialing_code = NULL;
4864  
4865      if( substr( $phone, 0, 1 ) == '+' )
4866      {    // We have a dialing code in the phone, so we extract it:
4867          $dialing_code = $CountryCache->extract_country_dialing_code( substr( $phone, 1 ) );
4868      }
4869  
4870      if( !is_null( $dialing_code ) && ( locale_dialing_code() == $dialing_code )
4871              && $hide_country_dialing_code_if_same_as_locale )
4872      {    // The phone dialing code is same as locale and we want to hide it in this case
4873          if( ( strlen( $phone ) - strlen( $dialing_code ) ) == 10 )
4874          {    // We can format it like a french phone number ( 0x.xx.xx.xx.xx )
4875              $phone_formated = format_french_phone( '0'.substr( $phone, strlen( $dialing_code )+1 ) );
4876          }
4877          else
4878          { // ( 0xxxxxxxxxxxxxx )
4879              $phone_formated = '0'.substr( $phone, strlen( $dialing_code )+1 );
4880          }
4881  
4882      }
4883      elseif( !is_null( $dialing_code ) )
4884      {    // Phone has a dialing code
4885          if( ( strlen( $phone ) - strlen( $dialing_code ) ) == 10 )
4886          { // We can format it like a french phone number with the dialing code ( +dialing x.xx.xx.xx.xx )
4887              $phone_formated = '+'.$dialing_code.format_french_phone( ' '.substr( $phone, strlen( $dialing_code )+1 ) );
4888          }
4889          else
4890          { // ( +dialing  xxxxxxxxxxx )
4891              $phone_formated = '+'.$dialing_code.' '.substr( $phone, strlen( $dialing_code )+1 );
4892          }
4893      }
4894      else
4895      {
4896          if( strlen( $phone ) == 10 )
4897          { //  We can format it like a french phone number ( xx.xx.xx.xx.xx )
4898              $phone_formated = format_french_phone( $phone );
4899          }
4900          else
4901          {    // We don't format phone: TODO generic format phone ( xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx )
4902              $phone_formated = $phone;
4903          }
4904      }
4905  
4906      return $phone_formated;
4907  }
4908  
4909  
4910  /**
4911   * Format a string in a french phone number
4912   *
4913   * @param string phone number
4914   */
4915  function format_french_phone( $phone )
4916  {
4917      return substr($phone, 0 , 2).'.'.substr($phone, 2, 2).'.'.substr($phone, 4, 2)
4918                      .'.'.substr($phone, 6, 2).'.'.substr($phone, 8, 2);
4919  }

4935  /**
4936   * Generate a link to a online help resource.
4937   * testing the concept of online help (aka webhelp).
4938   * this function should be relocated somewhere better if it is taken onboard by the project
4939   *
4940   * @todo replace [?] with icon,
4941   * @todo write url suffix dynamically based on topic and language
4942   *
4943   * QUESTION: launch new window with javascript maybe?
4944   * @param string Topic
4945   *        The topic should be in a format like [\w]+(/[\w]+)*, e.g features/online_help.
4946   * @param string link text, leave it NULL to get link with manual icon
4947   * @param string a word to be displayed after the manual icon (if no icon gets displayed, $title will be used instead!)
4948   * @param integer 1-5: weight of the word. The word will be displayed only if its weight is >= than the user setting threshold. (Default: 1)
4949   * @return string
4950   */
4951  function get_manual_link( $topic, $link_text = NULL, $action_word = NULL, $word_weight = 1 )
4952  {
4953      global $online_help_links;
4954  
4955      if( $online_help_links )
4956      {
4957          $manual_url = get_manual_url( $topic );
4958  
4959          if( $link_text == NULL )
4960          {
4961              if( $action_word == NULL )
4962              {
4963                  $action_word = T_('Manual');
4964              }
4965              $webhelp_link = action_icon( T_('Open relevant page in online manual'), 'manual', $manual_url, $action_word, 5, $word_weight, array( 'target' => '_blank' ) );
4966          }
4967          else
4968          {
4969              $webhelp_link = '<a href="'.$manual_url.'" target = "_blank">'.$link_text.'</a>';
4970          }
4971  
4972          return ' '.$webhelp_link;
4973      }
4974      else
4975      {
4976          return '';
4977      }
4978  }

4981  /**
4982   * Build a string out of $field_attribs, with each attribute
4983   * prefixed by a space character.
4984   *
4985   * @param array Array of field attributes.
4986   * @param boolean Use format_to_output() for the attributes?
4987   * @return string
4988   */
4989  function get_field_attribs_as_string( $field_attribs, $format_to_output = true )
4990  {
4991      $r = '';
4992      foreach( $field_attribs as $l_attr => $l_value )
4993      {
4994          if( $l_value === NULL )
4995          { // don't generate empty attributes (it may be NULL if we pass 'value' => NULL as field_param for example, because isset() does not match it!)
4996              // sam2kb> what about alt="" how do we handle this?
4997              // I've removed the "=== ''" check now. Should not do any harm. IIRC NULL is what we want to avoid here.
4998              continue;
4999          }
5000  
5001          if( $format_to_output )
5002          {
5003              $r .= ' '.$l_attr.'="'.htmlspecialchars($l_value).'"';
5004          }
5005          else
5006          {
5007              $r .= ' '.$l_attr.'="'.$l_value.'"';
5008          }
5009      }
5010  
5011      return $r;
5012  }

5054  /**
5055   * Does the given url require logged in user
5056   *
5057   * @param string url
5058   * @param boolean set true to also check if url is login screen or not
5059   * @return boolean
5060   */
5061  function require_login( $url, $check_login_screen )
5062  {
5063      global $Settings;
5064      if( preg_match( '#/admin.php([&?].*)?$#', $url ) )
5065      { // admin always require logged in user
5066          return true;
5067      }
5068  
5069      if( $check_login_screen &&  preg_match( '#/login.php([&?].*)?$#', $url ) )
5070      {
5071          return true;
5072      }
5073  
5074      $disp_names = 'threads|messages|contacts';
5075      if( !$Settings->get( 'allow_anonymous_user_list' ) )
5076      {
5077          $disp_names .= '|users';
5078      }
5079      if( !$Settings->get( 'allow_anonymous_user_profiles' ) )
5080      {
5081          $disp_names .= '|user';
5082      }
5083      if( $check_login_screen )
5084      {
5085          $disp_names .= '|login';
5086      }
5087      if( preg_match( '#disp=('.$disp_names.')#', $url ) )
5088      { // $url require logged in user
5089          return true;
5090      }
5091  
5092      return false;
5093  }

5096  /**
5097   * Implode array( 'x', 'y', 'z' ) to something like 'x, y and z'. Useful for displaying list to the end user.
5098   *
5099   * If there's one element in the table, it is returned.
5100   * If there are at least two elements, the last one is concatenated using $implode_last, while the ones before are imploded using $implode_by.
5101   *
5102   * @todo dh> I don't think using entities/HTML as default for $implode_last is sane!
5103   *           Use "&" instead and make sure that the output for HTML is HTML compliant..
5104   * @todo Support for locales that have a different kind of enumeration?!
5105   * @return string
5106   */
5107  function implode_with_and( $arr, $implode_by = ', ', $implode_last = ' &amp; ' )
5108  {
5109      switch( count($arr) )
5110      {
5111          case 0:
5112              return '';
5113  
5114          case 1:
5115              $r = array_shift($arr);
5116              return $r;
5117  
5118          default:
5119              $r = implode( $implode_by, array_slice( $arr, 0, -1 ) )
5120                  .$implode_last.array_pop( $arr );
5121              return $r;
5122      }
5123  }

5126  /**
5127   * Display an array as a list:
5128   *
5129   * @param array
5130   * @param string
5131   * @param string
5132   * @param string
5133   * @param string
5134   * @param string
5135   */
5136  function display_list( $items, $list_start = '<ul>', $list_end = '</ul>', $item_separator = '',
5137                                                  $item_start = '<li>', $item_end = '</li>', $force_hash = NULL, $max_items = NULL, $link_params = array() )
5138  {
5139      if( !is_null($max_items) && $max_items < 1 )
5140      {
5141          return;
5142      }
5143  
5144      if( !empty( $items ) )
5145      {
5146          echo $list_start;
5147          $count = 0;
5148          $first = true;
5149  
5150          foreach( $items as $item )
5151          {    // For each list item:
5152  
5153              $link = resolve_link_params( $item, $force_hash, $link_params );
5154              if( empty( $link ) )
5155              {
5156                  continue;
5157              }
5158  
5159              $count++;
5160              if( $count>1 )
5161              {
5162                  echo $item_separator;
5163              }
5164              echo $item_start.$link.$item_end;
5165  
5166              if( !is_null($max_items) && $count >= $max_items )
5167              {
5168                  break;
5169              }
5170          }
5171          echo $list_end;
5172      }
5173  }

5184  
5185  /**
5186   * Resolve a link based on params (credits stuff)
5187   *
5188   * @param array
5189   * @param integer
5190   * @param array
5191   * @return string
5192   */
5193  function resolve_link_params( $item, $force_hash = NULL, $params = array() )
5194  {
5195      global $current_locale;
5196  
5197      // echo 'resolve link ';
5198  
5199      if( is_array( $item ) )
5200      {
5201          if( isset( $item[0] ) )
5202          {    // Older format, which displays the same thing for all locales:
5203              return generate_link_from_params( $item, $params );
5204          }
5205          else
5206          {    // First get the right locale:
5207              // echo $current_locale;
5208              foreach( $item as $l_locale => $loc_item )
5209              {
5210                  if( $l_locale == substr( $current_locale, 0, strlen($l_locale) ) )
5211                  {    // We found a matching locale:
5212                      //echo "[$l_locale/$current_locale]";
5213                      if( is_array( $loc_item[0] ) )
5214                      {    // Randomize:
5215                          $loc_item = hash_link_params( $loc_item, $force_hash );
5216                      }
5217  
5218                      return generate_link_from_params( $loc_item, $params );
5219                  }
5220              }
5221              // No match found!
5222              return '';
5223          }
5224      }
5225  
5226      // Super old format:
5227      return $item;
5228  }

5230  
5231  /**
5232   * Get a link line, based url hash combined with probability percentage in first column
5233   *
5234   * @param array of arrays
5235   * @param display for a specific hash key
5236   */
5237  function hash_link_params( $link_array, $force_hash = NULL )
5238  {
5239      global $ReqHost, $ReqPath, $ReqURI;
5240  
5241      static $hash;
5242  
5243      if( !is_null($force_hash) )
5244      {
5245          $hash = $force_hash;
5246      }
5247      elseif( !isset($hash) )
5248      {
5249          $key = $ReqHost.$ReqPath;
5250  
5251          global $Blog;
5252          if( !empty($Blog) && strpos( $Blog->get_setting('single_links'), 'param_' ) === 0 )
5253          {    // We are on a blog that doesn't even have clean URLs for posts
5254              $key .= $ReqURI;
5255          }
5256  
5257          $hash = 0;
5258          for( $i=0; $i<strlen($key); $i++ )
5259          {
5260              $hash += ord($key[$i]);
5261          }
5262          $hash = $hash % 100 + 1;
5263  
5264          // $hash = rand( 1, 100 );
5265          global $debug, $Debuglog;
5266          if( $debug )
5267          {
5268              $Debuglog->add( 'Hash key: '.$hash, 'request' );
5269          }
5270      }
5271      //    echo "[$hash] ";
5272  
5273      foreach( $link_array as $link_params )
5274      {
5275          // echo '<br>'.$hash.'-'.$link_params[ 0 ];
5276          if( $hash <= $link_params[ 0 ] )
5277          {    // select this link!
5278              // pre_dump( $link_params );
5279              array_shift( $link_params );
5280              return $link_params;
5281          }
5282      }
5283      // somehow no match, return 1st element:
5284      $link_params = $link_array[0];
5285      array_shift( $link_params );
5286      return $link_params;
5287  }
5288  
5289  
5290  /**
5291   * Generate a link from params (credits stuff)
5292   *
5293   * @param array
5294   * @param array
5295   */
5296  function generate_link_from_params( $link_params, $params = array() )
5297  {
5298      $url = $link_params[0];
5299      if( empty( $url ) )
5300      {
5301          return '';
5302      }
5303  
5304      // Make sure we are not missing any param:
5305      $params = array_merge( array(
5306              'type'        => 'link',
5307              'img_url'     => '',
5308              'img_width'   => '',
5309              'img_height'  => '',
5310              'title'       => '',
5311              'target'      => '_blank',
5312          ), $params );
5313  
5314      $text = $link_params[1];
5315      if( is_array($text) )
5316      {
5317          $text = hash_link_params( $text );
5318          $text = $text[0];
5319      }
5320      if( empty( $text ) )
5321      {
5322          return '';
5323      }
5324  
5325      $r = '<a href="'.$url.'"';
5326  
5327      if( !empty($params['target'] ) )
5328      {
5329          $r .= ' target="'.$params['target'].'"';
5330      }
5331  
5332      if( $params['type'] == 'img' )
5333      {
5334          return $r.' title="'.$params['title'].'"><img src="'.$params['img_url'].'" alt="'
5335                          .$text.'" title="'.$params['title'].'" width="'.$params['img_width'].'" height="'.$params['img_height']
5336                          .'" border="0" /></a>';
5337      }
5338  
5339      return $r.'>'.$text.'</a>';
5340  }

5342  
5343  /**
5344   * Send a result as javascript
5345   * automatically includes any Messages ( @see Log::display() )
5346   * no return from function as it terminates processing
5347   *
5348   * @author Yabba
5349   *
5350   * @todo dh> Move this out into some more specific (not always included) file.
5351   *
5352   * @param array $methods javascript funtions to call with array of parameters
5353   *        format : 'function_name' => array( param1, parm2, param3 )
5354   * @param boolean $send_as_html Wrap the script into an html page with script tag; default is to send as js file
5355   * @param string $target prepended to function calls : blank or window.parent
5356   */
5357  function send_javascript_message( $methods = array(), $send_as_html = false, $target = '' )
5358  {
5359      // lets spit out any messages
5360      global $Messages;
5361      ob_start();
5362      $Messages->display();
5363      $output = ob_get_clean();
5364  
5365      // set target
5366      $target = ( $target ? $target : param( 'js_target', 'string' ) );
5367      if( $target )
5368      {    // add trailing [dot]
5369          $target = trim( $target, '.' ).'.';
5370      }
5371  
5372      // target should be empty or window.parent.
5373      if( $target && $target != 'window.parent.' )
5374      {
5375          debug_die( 'Unexpected javascript target' );
5376      }
5377  
5378      if( $output )
5379      {    // we have some messages
5380          $output = $target.'DisplayServerMessages( \''.format_to_js( $output ).'\');'."\n";
5381      }
5382  
5383      if( !empty( $methods ) )
5384      {    // we have a methods to call
5385          foreach( $methods as $method => $param_list )
5386          {    // loop through each requested method
5387              $params = array();
5388              if( !is_array( $param_list ) )
5389              {    // lets make it an array
5390                  $param_list = array( $param_list );
5391              }
5392              foreach( $param_list as $param )
5393              {    // add each parameter to the output
5394                  if( !is_numeric( $param ) )
5395                  {    // this is a string, quote it
5396                      $param = '\''.format_to_js( $param ).'\'';
5397                  }
5398                  $params[] = $param;// add param to the list
5399              }
5400              // add method and parameters
5401              $output .= $target.$method.'('.implode( ',', $params ).');'."\n";
5402          }
5403      }
5404  
5405      if( $send_as_html )
5406      {    // we want to send as a html document
5407          headers_content_mightcache( 'text/html', 0 );        // Do NOT cache interactive communications.
5408          echo '<html><head></head><body><script type="text/javascript">'."\n";
5409          echo $output;
5410          echo '</script></body></html>';
5411      }
5412      else
5413      {    // we want to send as js
5414          headers_content_mightcache( 'text/javascript', 0 );        // Do NOT cache interactive communications.
5415          echo $output;
5416      }
5417  
5418      exit(0);
5419  }

5422  /**
5423   * Basic tidy up of strings
5424   *
5425   * @author Yabba
5426   * @author Tblue
5427   *
5428   * @param string $unformatted raw data
5429   * @return string formatted data
5430   */
5431  function format_to_js( $unformatted )
5432  {
5433      return str_replace( array(
5434                              '\'',
5435                              '\n',
5436                              '\r',
5437                              '\t',
5438                              "\n",
5439                              "\r",
5440                          ),
5441                          array(
5442                              '\\\'',
5443                              '\\\\n',
5444                              '\\\\r',
5445                              '\\\\t',
5446                              '\n',
5447                              '\r',
5448                          ), $unformatted );
5449  }

5494  /**
5495   * Converts array to form option list
5496   *
5497   * @param array of option values and descriptions
5498   * @param integer|array selected keys
5499   * @param array provide a choice for "none_value" with value ''
5500   * @return string
5501   */
5502  function array_to_option_list( $array, $default = '', $allow_none = array() )
5503  {
5504      if( !is_array( $default ) )
5505      {
5506          $default = array( $default );
5507      }
5508  
5509      $r = '';
5510  
5511      if( !empty($allow_none) )
5512      {
5513          $r .= '<option value="'.$allow_none['none_value'].'"';
5514          if( empty($default) ) $r .= ' selected="selected"';
5515          $r .= '>'.format_to_output($allow_none['none_text']).'</option>'."\n";
5516      }
5517  
5518      foreach( $array as $k=>$v )
5519      {
5520          $r .=  '<option value="'.format_to_output($k,'formvalue').'"';
5521          if( in_array( $k, $default ) ) $r .= ' selected="selected"';
5522          $r .= '>';
5523          $r .= format_to_output( $v, 'htmlbody' );
5524          $r .=  '</option>'."\n";
5525      }
5526  
5527      return $r;
5528  }

5530  
5531  /**
5532   * Get a value from a volatile/lossy cache.
5533   *
5534   * @param string key
5535   * @param boolean success (by reference)
5536   * @return mixed True in case of success, false in case of failure. NULL, if no backend is available.
5537   */
5538  function get_from_mem_cache($key, & $success )
5539  {
5540      global $Timer;
5541  
5542      $Timer->resume('get_from_mem_cache', false);
5543  
5544      if( function_exists('apc_fetch') )
5545          $r = apc_fetch( $key, $success );
5546      elseif( function_exists('xcache_get') && ini_get('xcache.var_size') > 0 )
5547          $r = xcache_get($key);
5548      elseif( function_exists('eaccelerator_get') )
5549          $r = eaccelerator_get($key);
5550  
5551      if( ! isset($success) )
5552      { // set $success for implementation that do not set it itself (only APC does so)
5553          $success = isset($r);
5554      }
5555      if( ! $success )
5556      {
5557          $r = NULL;
5558  
5559          global $Debuglog;
5560          $Debuglog->add('No caching backend available for reading "'.$key.'".', 'cache');
5561      }
5562  
5563      $Timer->pause('get_from_mem_cache', false);
5564      return $r;
5565  }
5566  
5567  
5568  /**
5569   * Set a value to a volatile/lossy cache.
5570   *
5571   * There's no guarantee that the data is still available, since e.g. old
5572   * values might get purged.
5573   *
5574   * @param string key
5575   * @param mixed Data. Objects would have to be serialized.
5576   * @param int Time to live (seconds). Default is 0 and means "forever".
5577   * @return mixed
5578   */
5579  function set_to_mem_cache($key, $payload, $ttl = 0)
5580  {
5581      global $Timer;
5582  
5583      $Timer->resume('set_to_mem_cache', false);
5584  
5585      if( function_exists('apc_store') )
5586          $r = apc_store( $key, $payload, $ttl );
5587      elseif( function_exists('xcache_set') && ini_get('xcache.var_size') > 0 )
5588          $r = xcache_set( $key, $payload, $ttl );
5589      elseif( function_exists('eaccelerator_put') )
5590          $r = eaccelerator_put( $key, $payload, $ttl );
5591      else {
5592          global $Debuglog;
5593          $Debuglog->add('No caching backend available for writing "'.$key.'".', 'cache');
5594          $r = NULL;
5595      }
5596  
5597      $Timer->pause('set_to_mem_cache', false);
5598  
5599      return $r;
5600  }
5601  
5602  
5603  /**
5604   * Remove a given key from the volatile/lossy cache.
5605   *
5606   * @param string key
5607   * @return boolean True on success, false on failure. NULL if no backend available.
5608   */
5609  function unset_from_mem_cache($key)
5610  {
5611      if( function_exists('apc_delete') )
5612          return apc_delete( $key );
5613  
5614      if( function_exists('xcache_unset') )
5615          return xcache_unset(gen_key_for_cache($key));
5616  
5617      if( function_exists('eaccelerator_rm') )
5618          return eaccelerator_rm(gen_key_for_cache($key));
5619  }

5622  /**
5623   * Generate order by clause
5624   *
5625   * @param string The order values are separated by space or comma
5626   * @param string An order direction: ASC, DESC
5627   * @param string DB prefix
5628   * @param string ID field name with prefix
5629   * @param array Names of DB fields(without prefix) that are available
5630   * @return string The order fields are separated by comma
5631   */
5632  function gen_order_clause( $order_by, $order_dir, $dbprefix, $dbIDname_disambiguation, $available_fields = NULL )
5633  {
5634      $order_by = str_replace( ' ', ',', $order_by );
5635      $orderby_array = explode( ',', $order_by );
5636  
5637      $order_dir = explode( ',', str_replace( ' ', ',', $order_dir ) );
5638  
5639      if( is_array( $available_fields ) )
5640      { // Exclude the incorrect fields from order clause
5641          foreach( $orderby_array as $i => $orderby_field )
5642          {
5643              if( ! in_array( $orderby_field, $available_fields ) )
5644              {
5645                  unset( $orderby_array[ $i ] );
5646              }
5647          }
5648      }
5649  
5650      // Format each order param with default column names:
5651      foreach( $orderby_array as $i => $orderby_value )
5652      { // If the order_by field contains a '.' character which is a table separator we must not use the prefix ( E.g. temp_table.value )
5653          $use_dbprefix = ( strpos( $orderby_value, '.' ) !== false ) ? '' : $dbprefix;
5654          $orderby_array[ $i ] = $use_dbprefix.$orderby_value.' '.( isset( $order_dir[ $i ] ) ? $order_dir[ $i ] : $order_dir[0] );
5655      }
5656  
5657      // Add an ID parameter to make sure there is no ambiguity in ordering on similar items:
5658      $orderby_array[] = $dbIDname_disambiguation.' '.$order_dir[0];
5659  
5660      $order_by = implode( ', ', $orderby_array );
5661  
5662      // Special case for RAND:
5663      $order_by = str_replace( $dbprefix.'RAND ', 'RAND() ', $order_by );
5664  
5665      return $order_by;
5666  }

5698  /**
5699   * Get name of active opcode cache, or "none".
5700   * {@internal Anyone using something else, please extend.}}
5701   * @return string
5702   */
5703  function get_active_opcode_cache()
5704  {
5705      if( function_exists('apc_cache_info') && ini_get('apc.enabled') ) # disabled for CLI (see apc.enable_cli), however: just use this setting and do not call the function.
5706      {
5707          // fp>blueyed? why did you remove the following 2 lines? your comment above is not clear.
5708          $apc_info = apc_cache_info( '', true );
5709          if( isset( $apc_info['num_entries'] ) && ( $apc_info['num_entries'] ) )
5710          {
5711              return 'APC';
5712          }
5713      }
5714  
5715      // xcache: xcache.var_size must be > 0. xcache_set is not necessary (might have been disabled).
5716      if( ini_get('xcache.size') > 0 )
5717      {
5718          return 'xcache';
5719      }
5720  
5721      if( ini_get('eaccelerator.enable') )
5722      {
5723          $eac_info = eaccelerator_info();
5724          if( $eac_info['cache'] )
5725          {
5726              return 'eAccelerator';
5727          }
5728      }
5729  
5730      return 'none';
5731  }

5734  /**
5735   * Invalidate all page caches.
5736   * This function should be processed every time, when some users or global settings was modified,
5737   * and this modification has an imortant influence for the front office display.
5738   * Modifications that requires to invalidate all page caches:
5739   *   - installing/removing/reloading/enabling/disabling plugins
5740   *   - editing user settings like allow profile pics, new users can register, user settings>display
5741   */
5742  function invalidate_pagecaches()
5743  {
5744      global $DB, $Settings, $servertimenow;
5745  
5746      // get current server time
5747      $timestamp = ( empty( $servertimenow ) ? time() : $servertimenow );
5748  
5749      // get all blog ids
5750      if( $blog_ids = $DB->get_col( 'SELECT blog_ID FROM T_blogs' ) )
5751      {    // build invalidate query
5752          $query = 'REPLACE INTO T_coll_settings ( cset_coll_ID, cset_name, cset_value ) VALUES';
5753          foreach( $blog_ids as $blog_id )
5754          {
5755              $query .= ' ('.$blog_id.', "last_invalidation_timestamp", '.$timestamp.' ),';
5756          }
5757          $query = substr( $query, 0, strlen( $query ) - 1 );
5758          $DB->query( $query, 'Invalidate blogs\'s page caches' );
5759      }
5760  
5761      // Invalidate general cache content also
5762      $Settings->set( 'last_invalidation_timestamp', $timestamp );
5763      $Settings->dbupdate();
5764  }

5767  /**
5768  * Get $ReqPath, $ReqURI
5769  *
5770  * @return array ($ReqPath,$ReqURI);
5771  */
5772  function get_ReqURI()
5773  {
5774      global $Debuglog;
5775  
5776      // Investigation for following code by Isaac - http://isaacschlueter.com/
5777      if( isset($_SERVER['REQUEST_URI']) && !empty($_SERVER['REQUEST_URI']) )
5778      { // Warning: on some IIS installs it it set but empty!
5779          $Debuglog->add( 'vars: vars: Getting ReqURI from REQUEST_URI', 'request' );
5780          $ReqURI = $_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'];
5781  
5782          // Build requested Path without query string:
5783          $pos = strpos( $ReqURI, '?' );
5784          if( false !== $pos )
5785          {
5786              $ReqPath = substr( $ReqURI, 0, $pos  );
5787          }
5788          else
5789          {
5790              $ReqPath = $ReqURI;
5791          }
5792      }
5793      elseif( isset($_SERVER['URL']) )
5794      { // ISAPI
5795          $Debuglog->add( 'vars: Getting ReqPath from URL', 'request' );
5796          $ReqPath = $_SERVER['URL'];
5797          $ReqURI = isset($_SERVER['QUERY_STRING']) && !empty( $_SERVER['QUERY_STRING'] ) ? ($ReqPath.'?'.$_SERVER['QUERY_STRING']) : $ReqPath;
5798      }
5799      elseif( isset($_SERVER['PATH_INFO']) )
5800      { // CGI/FastCGI
5801          if( isset($_SERVER['SCRIPT_NAME']) )
5802          {
5803              $Debuglog->add( 'vars: Getting ReqPath from PATH_INFO and SCRIPT_NAME', 'request' );
5804  
5805              if ($_SERVER['SCRIPT_NAME'] == $_SERVER['PATH_INFO'] )
5806              {    /* both the same so just use one of them
5807                   * this happens on a windoze 2003 box
5808                   * gotta love microdoft
5809                   */
5810                  $Debuglog->add( 'vars: PATH_INFO and SCRIPT_NAME are the same', 'request' );
5811                  $Debuglog->add( 'vars: Getting ReqPath from PATH_INFO only instead', 'request' );
5812                  $ReqPath = $_SERVER['PATH_INFO'];
5813              }
5814              else
5815              {
5816                  $ReqPath = $_SERVER['SCRIPT_NAME'].$_SERVER['PATH_INFO'];
5817              }
5818          }
5819          else
5820          { // does this happen??
5821              $Debuglog->add( 'vars: Getting ReqPath from PATH_INFO only!', 'request' );
5822  
5823              $ReqPath = $_SERVER['PATH_INFO'];
5824          }
5825          $ReqURI = isset($_SERVER['QUERY_STRING']) && !empty( $_SERVER['QUERY_STRING'] ) ? ($ReqPath.'?'.$_SERVER['QUERY_STRING']) : $ReqPath;
5826      }
5827      elseif( isset($_SERVER['ORIG_PATH_INFO']) )
5828      { // Tomcat 5.5.x with Herbelin PHP servlet and PHP 5.1
5829          $Debuglog->add( 'vars: Getting ReqPath from ORIG_PATH_INFO', 'request' );
5830          $ReqPath = $_SERVER['ORIG_PATH_INFO'];
5831          $ReqURI = isset($_SERVER['QUERY_STRING']) && !empty( $_SERVER['QUERY_STRING'] ) ? ($ReqPath.'?'.$_SERVER['QUERY_STRING']) : $ReqPath;
5832      }
5833      elseif( isset($_SERVER['SCRIPT_NAME']) )
5834      { // Some Odd Win2k Stuff
5835          $Debuglog->add( 'vars: Getting ReqPath from SCRIPT_NAME', 'request' );
5836          $ReqPath = $_SERVER['SCRIPT_NAME'];
5837          $ReqURI = isset($_SERVER['QUERY_STRING']) && !empty( $_SERVER['QUERY_STRING'] ) ? ($ReqPath.'?'.$_SERVER['QUERY_STRING']) : $ReqPath;
5838      }
5839      elseif( isset($_SERVER['PHP_SELF']) )
5840      { // The Old Stand-By
5841          $Debuglog->add( 'vars: Getting ReqPath from PHP_SELF', 'request' );
5842          $ReqPath = $_SERVER['PHP_SELF'];
5843          $ReqURI = isset($_SERVER['QUERY_STRING']) && !empty( $_SERVER['QUERY_STRING'] ) ? ($ReqPath.'?'.$_SERVER['QUERY_STRING']) : $ReqPath;
5844      }
5845      else
5846      {
5847          $ReqPath = false;
5848          $ReqURI = false;
5849          ?>
5850          <p class="error">
5851          Warning: $ReqPath could not be set. Probably an odd IIS problem.
5852          </p>
5853          <p>
5854          Go to your <a href="<?php echo $baseurl.$install_subdir ?>phpinfo.php">phpinfo page</a>,
5855          look for occurences of <code><?php
5856          // take the baseurlroot out..
5857          echo preg_replace('#^'.preg_quote( $baseurlroot, '#' ).'#', '', $baseurl.$install_subdir )
5858          ?>phpinfo.php</code> and copy all lines
5859          containing this to the <a href="http://forums.b2evolution.net">forum</a>. Also specify what webserver
5860          you're running on.
5861          <br />
5862          (If you have deleted your install folder &ndash; what is recommended after successful setup &ndash;
5863          you have to upload it again before doing this).
5864          </p>
5865          <?php
5866      }
5867  
5868      return array($ReqPath,$ReqURI);
5869  }

5872  /**
5873   * Get htsrv url on the same domain as the http request came from
5874   *
5875   * Note: _init_hit.inc.php should be called before this call, because ReqHost and ReqPath must be initialized
5876   */
5877  function get_samedomain_htsrv_url( $secure = false )
5878  {
5879      global $ReqHost, $ReqPath, $htsrv_url, $htsrv_url_sensitive, $Blog;
5880  
5881      if( $secure )
5882      {
5883          $req_htsrv_url = $htsrv_url_sensitive;
5884      }
5885      else
5886      {
5887          $req_htsrv_url = $htsrv_url;
5888      }
5889  
5890      if( strpos( $ReqHost.$ReqPath, $req_htsrv_url ) !== false )
5891      {
5892          return $req_htsrv_url;
5893      }
5894  
5895      $req_url_parts = @parse_url( $ReqHost );
5896      $hsrv_url_parts = @parse_url( $req_htsrv_url );
5897      if( ( !isset( $req_url_parts['host'] ) ) || ( !isset( $hsrv_url_parts['host'] ) ) )
5898      {
5899          debug_die( 'Invalid hosts!' );
5900      }
5901      $req_domain = $req_url_parts['host'];
5902      $htsrv_domain = $hsrv_url_parts['host'];
5903  
5904      $samedomain_htsrv_url = substr_replace( $req_htsrv_url, $req_domain, strpos( $req_htsrv_url, $htsrv_domain ), strlen( $htsrv_domain ) );
5905  
5906      // fp> The following check would apply well if we always had 301 redirects.
5907      // But it's possible to turn them off in SEO settings for some page and not others (we don't know which here)
5908    // And some kinds of pages do not have 301 redirections implemented yet, e-g: disp=users
5909    /*
5910      if( ( !is_admin_page() ) && ( !empty( $Blog ) ) && ( $samedomain_htsrv_url != $Blog->get_local_htsrv_url() ) )
5911      {
5912          debug_die( 'The blog is configured to have /htsrv/ at:<br> '.$Blog->get_local_htsrv_url().'<br>but in order to stay on the current domain, we would need to use:<br>'.$samedomain_htsrv_url.'<br>Maybe we have a missing redirection to the proper blog url?' );
5913      }
5914      */
5915  
5916      return $samedomain_htsrv_url;
5917  }

5920  /**
5921   * Get secure htsrv url on the same domain as the http request came from
5922   * It is important on login and register calls
5923   * _init_hit.inc.php should be called before this call, because ReqHost and ReqPath must be initialized
5924   */
5925  function get_secure_htsrv_url()
5926  {
5927      return get_samedomain_htsrv_url( true );
5928  }

5947  /**
5948   * Sanitize a comma-separated list of numbers (IDs)
5949   *
5950   * @param string
5951   * @param bool Return array if true, string otherwise
5952   * @param bool Quote each element (for use in SQL queries)
5953   * @return string
5954   */
5955  function sanitize_id_list( $str, $return_array = false, $quote = false )
5956  {
5957      if( is_null($str) )
5958      {    // Allow NULL values
5959          $str = '';
5960      }
5961  
5962      // Explode and trim
5963      $array = array_map( 'trim', explode(',', $str) );
5964  
5965      // Convert to integer and remove all empty values
5966      $array = array_filter( array_map('intval', $array) );
5967  
5968      if( !$return_array && $quote )
5969      {    // Quote each element and return a string
5970          global $DB;
5971          return $DB->quote($array);
5972      }
5973      return ( $return_array ? $array : implode(',', $array) );
5974  }

5976  
5977  /**
5978   * Create json_encode function if it does not exist ( PHP < 5.2.0 )
5979   *
5980   * @return string
5981   */
5982  if ( !function_exists( 'json_encode' ) )
5983  {
5984  	function json_encode( $a = false )
5985      {
5986          if( is_null( $a ) )
5987          {
5988              return 'null';
5989          }
5990          if( $a === false )
5991          {
5992              return 'false';
5993          }
5994          if( $a === true )
5995          {
5996              return 'true';
5997          }
5998          if( is_scalar( $a ) )
5999          {
6000              if( is_float( $a ) )
6001              { // Always use "." for floats.
6002                  return floatval( str_replace( ",", ".", strval( $a ) ) );
6003              }
6004  
6005              if( is_string( $a ) )
6006              {
6007                  $jsonReplaces = array( array( "\\", "/", "\n", "\t", "\r", "\b", "\f", '"' ), array( '\\\\', '\\/', '\\n', '\\t', '\\r', '\\b', '\\f', '\"' ) );
6008                  return '"'.str_replace( $jsonReplaces[0], $jsonReplaces[1], $a ).'"';
6009              }
6010  
6011              return $a;
6012          }
6013          $isList = true;
6014          for( $i = 0, reset($a); $i < count($a); $i++, next($a) )
6015          {
6016              if( key($a) !== $i )
6017              {
6018                  $isList = false;
6019                  break;
6020              }
6021          }
6022          $result = array();
6023          if( $isList )
6024          {
6025              foreach( $a as $v )
6026              {
6027                  $result[] = json_encode($v);
6028              }
6029              return '['.join( ',', $result ).']';
6030          }
6031          else
6032          {
6033              foreach( $a as $k => $v )
6034              {
6035                  $result[] = json_encode($k).':'.json_encode($v);
6036              }
6037              return '{'.join( ',', $result ).'}';
6038          }
6039      }
6040  }
6041  
6042  
6043  /**
6044   * A wrapper for json_encode function
6045   * We need to pass valid UTF-8 string to json_encode, otherwise it may return NULL
6046   *
6047   * @param mixed
6048   * @return string
6049   */
6050  function evo_json_encode( $a = false )
6051  {
6052      if( is_string( $a ) )
6053      { // Convert to UTF-8
6054          $a = current_charset_to_utf8( $a );
6055      }
6056      elseif( is_array( $a ) )
6057      { // Recursively convert to UTF-8
6058          array_walk_recursive( $a, 'current_charset_to_utf8' );
6059      }
6060  
6061      $result = json_encode( $a );
6062      if( $result === false )
6063      { // If json_encode returns FALSE because of some error we should set correct json empty value as '[]' instead of false
6064          $result = '[]';
6065      }
6066  
6067      return $result;
6068  }
6069  
6070  
6071  /**
6072   * A helper function to conditionally convert a string from current charset to UTF-8
6073   *
6074   * @param string
6075   * @return string
6076   */
6077  function current_charset_to_utf8( & $a )
6078  {
6079      global $current_charset;
6080  
6081      if( is_string( $a ) && $current_charset != '' && $current_charset != 'utf-8' )
6082      { // Convert string to utf-8 if it has another charset
6083          $a = convert_charset( $a, 'utf-8', $current_charset );
6084      }
6085  
6086      return $a;
6087  }

6089  
6090  if( !function_exists( 'property_exists' ) )
6091  {
6092      /**
6093       * Create property_exists function if it does not exist ( PHP < 5.1 )
6094       * @param object
6095       * @param string
6096       *
6097       * @return bool
6098       */
6099  	function property_exists( $class, $property )
6100      {
6101          if( is_object( $class ) )
6102          {
6103              $vars = get_object_vars( $class );
6104          }
6105          else
6106          {
6107              $vars = get_class_vars( $class );
6108          }
6109          return array_key_exists( $property, $vars );
6110      }
6111  }

6114  // fp>vitaliy: move to a file that is not included everywhere!
6115  /**
6116   * Update global $http_response_code and call function header()
6117   *
6118   * NOTICE: When you start to use new code please add it to the hits filter "HTTP resp"
6119   *         in the file "/inc/sessions/views/_stats_view.funcs.php",
6120   *         function filter_hits(), array $resp_codes
6121   *
6122   * @param string Header
6123   * @param integer Header response code
6124   */
6125  function header_http_response( $string, $code = NULL )
6126  {
6127      global $http_response_code;
6128  
6129      $string = 'HTTP/1.1 '. $string;
6130  
6131      if( is_null( $code ) )
6132      {
6133          if( preg_match( '/(\d{3})/', $string, $matches ) )
6134          {
6135              $http_response_code = (int)$matches[0];
6136          }
6137      }
6138      else
6139      {
6140          $http_response_code = $code;
6141      }
6142  
6143      header( $string );
6144  }

6147  /**
6148   * Add a trailing slash, if none present
6149   *
6150   * @param string the path/url
6151   * @return string the path/url with trailing slash
6152   */
6153  function trailing_slash( $path )
6154  {
6155      if( empty($path) || utf8_substr( $path, -1 ) == '/' )
6156      {
6157          return $path;
6158      }
6159      else
6160      {
6161          return $path.'/';
6162      }
6163  }

6166  /**
6167   * Remove trailing slash, if present
6168   *
6169   * @param string the path/url
6170   * @return string the path/url without trailing slash
6171   */
6172  function no_trailing_slash( $path )
6173  {
6174      if( utf8_substr( $path, -1 ) == '/' )
6175      {
6176          return utf8_substr( $path, 0, utf8_strlen( $path )-1 );
6177      }
6178      else
6179      {
6180          return $path;
6181      }
6182  }

6184  
6185  /**
6186   * Provide sys_get_temp_dir for older versions of PHP (< 5.2.1)
6187   *
6188   * @return string path to system temporary directory
6189   */
6190  if( !function_exists( 'sys_get_temp_dir' ) )
6191  {
6192  	function sys_get_temp_dir()
6193      {
6194          // Try to get from environment variable
6195          if( !empty($_ENV['TMP']) )
6196          {
6197              return realpath( $_ENV['TMP'] );
6198          }
6199          elseif( !empty($_ENV['TMPDIR']) )
6200          {
6201              return realpath( $_ENV['TMPDIR'] );
6202          }
6203          elseif( !empty($_ENV['TEMP']) )
6204          {
6205              return realpath( $_ENV['TEMP'] );
6206          }
6207          else
6208          {    // Detect by creating a temporary file
6209  
6210              // Try to use system's temporary directory as random name shouldn't exist
6211              $temp_file = tempnam( sha1(uniqid(rand()), true), '' );
6212              if( $temp_file )
6213              {
6214                  $temp_dir = realpath( dirname($temp_file) );
6215                  unlink($temp_file);
6216                  return $temp_dir;
6217              }
6218              else
6219              {
6220                  return false;
6221              }
6222          }
6223      }
6224  }

6226  
6227  /**
6228   * Provide inet_pton for older versions of PHP (< 5.1.0 linux & < 5.3.0 windows)
6229   *
6230   * Converts a human readable IP address to its packed in_addr representation
6231   * @param string A human readable IPv4 or IPv6 address
6232   * @return string The in_addr representation of the given address, or FALSE if a syntactically invalid address is given (for example, an IPv4 address without dots or an IPv6 address without colons
6233   */
6234  if( !function_exists( 'inet_pton' ) )
6235  {
6236  	function inet_pton( $ip )
6237      {
6238          if( strpos( $ip, '.' ) !== FALSE )
6239          {    // IPv4
6240              $ip = pack( 'N', ip2long( $ip ) );
6241          }
6242          elseif( strpos( $ip, ':' ) !== FALSE )
6243          {    // IPv6
6244              $ip = explode( ':', $ip );
6245              $res = str_pad( '', ( 4 * ( 8 - count( $ip ) ) ), '0000', STR_PAD_LEFT );
6246              foreach( $ip as $seg )
6247              {
6248                  $res .= str_pad( $seg, 4, '0', STR_PAD_LEFT );
6249              }
6250              $ip = pack( 'H'.strlen( $res ), $res );
6251          }
6252          else
6253          {    // Invalid IP address
6254              $ip = FALSE;
6255          }
6256  
6257          return $ip;
6258      }
6259  }
6260  
6261  
6262  /**
6263   * Convert integer to IP address
6264   *
6265   * @param integer Number
6266   * @return string IP address
6267   */
6268  function int2ip( $int )
6269  {
6270      $ip = array();
6271      $ip[0] = (int) ( $int / 256 / 256 / 256 );
6272      $ip[1] = (int) ( ( $int - ( $ip[0] * 256 * 256 * 256 ) ) / 256 / 256 );
6273      $ip[2] = (int) ( ( $int - ( $ip[0] * 256 * 256 * 256 ) - ( $ip[1] * 256 * 256 ) ) / 256 );
6274      $ip[3] = $int - ( $ip[0] * 256 * 256 * 256 ) - ( $ip[1] * 256 * 256 ) - ( $ip[2] * 256 );
6275  
6276      return $ip[0].'.'.$ip[1].'.'.$ip[2].'.'.$ip[3];
6277  }
6278  
6279  
6280  /**
6281   * Check if the given string is a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address value
6282   *
6283   * @param string IP
6284   * @return boolean true if valid, false otherwise
6285   */
6286  function is_valid_ip_format( $ip )
6287  {
6288      if( function_exists( 'filter_var' ) )
6289      { // filter_var() function exists we have PHP version >= 5.2.0
6290          return filter_var( $ip, FILTER_VALIDATE_IP ) !== false;
6291      }
6292  
6293      // PHP version is < 5.2.0
6294      if( $ip == '::1' )
6295      {    // Reserved IP for localhost
6296          $ip = '127.0.0.1';
6297      }
6298  
6299      if( strpos( $ip, '.' ) !== false )
6300      { // we have IPv4
6301          if( strpos( $ip, ':' !== false ) )
6302          { // It is combined with IPv6, remove the IPv6 prefix
6303              $ip = substr( $ip, strrpos( $ip, ':' ) );
6304          }
6305          if( substr_count( $ip, '.' ) != 3 )
6306          { // Don't vaildate formats like 'zz.yyyyy' which would be allowed by ip2long() function
6307              return false;
6308          }
6309          $result = ip2long( $ip );
6310          return ( ( $result !== false ) && ( $result !== -1 ) );
6311      }
6312  
6313      // Check if it is a valid IPv6 string
6314      if( preg_match( "/^[0-9a-f]{1,4}:([0-9a-f]{0,4}:){1,6}[0-9a-f]{1,4}$/", $ip ) )
6315      { // $ip has the correct format
6316          if( ( substr_count( $ip, '::' ) > 1 ) || ( strpos( $ip, ':::' ) !== false ) )
6317          { // Not valid IPv6 format because contains a ':::' char sequence or more than one '::'
6318              return false;
6319          }
6320          return true;
6321      }
6322  
6323      return false;
6324  }
6325  
6326  
6327  /**
6328   * Convert IP address to integer (get only 32bits of IPv6 address)
6329   *
6330   * @param string IP address
6331   * @return integer Number
6332   */
6333  function ip2int( $ip )
6334  {
6335      if( ! is_valid_ip_format( $ip ) )
6336      { // IP format is incorrect
6337          return 0;
6338      }
6339  
6340      if( $ip == '::1' )
6341      {    // Reserved IP for localhost
6342          $ip = '127.0.0.1';
6343      }
6344  
6345      $parts = unpack( 'N*', inet_pton( $ip ) );
6346      // In case of IPv6 return only a parts of it
6347      $result = ( strpos( $ip, '.' ) !== false ) ? $parts[1] /* IPv4*/ : $parts[4] /* IPv6*/;
6348  
6349      if( $result < 0 )
6350      { // convert unsigned int to signed from unpack.
6351          // this should be OK as it will be a PHP float not an int
6352          $result += 4294967296;
6353      }
6354  
6355      return $result;
6356  }

6359  /**
6360   * Provide array_combine for older versions of PHP (< 5.0.0)
6361   *
6362   * Creates an array by using one array for keys and another for its values
6363   * @param array Keys
6364   * @param array Values
6365   * @return array Combined array, FALSE if the number of elements for each array isn't equal.
6366   */
6367  if( !function_exists( 'array_combine' ) )
6368  {
6369  	function array_combine( $arr1, $arr2 )
6370      {
6371          if( count( $arr1 ) != count( $arr2 ) )
6372          {
6373              return false;
6374          }
6375  
6376          $out = array();
6377          foreach( $arr1 as $key1 => $value1 )
6378          {
6379              $out[$value1] = $arr2[$key1];
6380          }
6381          return $out;
6382      }
6383  }

6440  /**
6441   * Provide array_walk_recursive for older versions of PHP (< 5.1.0)
6442   *
6443   * Apply a user function recursively to every member of an array
6444   * @param array The input array
6445   * @param string Funcname
6446   * @param string If the optional userdata parameter is supplied, it will be passed as the third parameter to the callback funcname.
6447   * @return TRUE on success or FALSE on failure
6448   */
6449  if( !function_exists( 'array_walk_recursive' ) )
6450  {
6451  	function array_walk_recursive( &$input, $funcname, $userdata = '' )
6452      {
6453          if( !is_callable( $funcname ) )
6454          {
6455              return false;
6456          }
6457  
6458          if( !is_array( $input ) )
6459          {
6460              return false;
6461          }
6462  
6463          foreach( $input AS $key => $value )
6464          {
6465              if( is_array( $input[$key] ) )
6466              {
6467                  array_walk_recursive( $input[$key], $funcname, $userdata );
6468              }
6469              else
6470              {
6471                  $saved_value = $value;
6472                  if( !empty( $userdata ) )
6473                  {
6474                      $funcname( $value, $key, $userdata );
6475                  }
6476                  else
6477                  {
6478                      $funcname( $value, $key );
6479                  }
6480  
6481                  if( $value != $saved_value )
6482                  {
6483                      $input[$key] = $value;
6484                  }
6485              }
6486          }
6487  
6488          return true;
6489      }
6490  }

6493  /**
6494   * Save text data to file, create target file if it doesn't exist
6495   *
6496   * @param string data to be written
6497   * @param string filename (full path to a file)
6498   * @param string fopen mode
6499   */
6500  function save_to_file( $data, $filename, $mode = 'a' )
6501  {
6502      global $Settings;
6503  
6504      if( ! file_exists($filename) )
6505      {    // Create target file
6506          @touch( $filename );
6507  
6508          // Doesn't work during installation
6509          if( !empty($Settings) )
6510          {
6511              $chmod = $Settings->get('fm_default_chmod_dir');
6512              @chmod( $filename, octdec($chmod) );
6513          }
6514      }
6515  
6516      if( ! is_writable($filename) )
6517      {
6518          return false;
6519      }
6520  
6521      $f = @fopen( $filename, $mode );
6522      $ok = @fwrite( $f, $data );
6523      @fclose( $f );
6524  
6525      if( $ok && file_exists($filename) )
6526      {
6527          return $filename;
6528      }
6529      return false;
6530  }

6548          $ajax_content_mode === true &&
6549          !in_array( $template_name, $content_templates );

6553  /**
6554   * Insert system log into DB
6555   *
6556   * @param string Message text
6557   * @param string Log type: 'info', 'warning', 'error', 'critical_error'
6558   * @param string Object type: 'comment', 'item', 'user', 'file' or leave default NULL if none of them
6559   * @param integer Object ID
6560   * @param string Origin type: 'core', 'plugin'
6561   * @param integer Origin ID
6562   */
6563  function syslog_insert( $message, $log_type, $object_type = NULL, $object_ID = NULL, $origin_type = 'core', $origin_ID = NULL )
6564  {
6565      global $servertimenow;
6566  
6567      $Syslog = new Syslog();
6568      $Syslog->set_user();
6569      $Syslog->set( 'type', $log_type );
6570      $Syslog->set_origin( $origin_type, $origin_ID );
6571      $Syslog->set_object( $object_type, $object_ID );
6572      $Syslog->set_message( $message );
6573      $Syslog->set( 'timestamp', date2mysql( $servertimenow ) );
6574      $Syslog->dbinsert();
6575  }

6578  /**
6579   * Get a param to know where script is calling now, Used for JS functions
6580   *
6581   * @return string
6582   */
6583  function request_from()
6584  {
6585      global $request_from;
6586  
6587      if( !empty( $request_from ) )
6588      { // AJAX request
6589          return $request_from;
6590      }
6591  
6592      if( is_admin_page() )
6593      { // Backoffice
6594          global $ctrl;
6595          return !empty( $ctrl ) ? $ctrl : 'admin';
6596      }
6597      else
6598      { // Frontoffice
6599          return 'front';
6600      }
6601  }

6613  /**
6614   * Flush the output buffer
6615   */
6616  function evo_flush()
6617  {
6618      global $Timer;
6619  
6620      $zlib_output_compression = ini_get( 'zlib.output_compression' );
6621      if( empty( $zlib_output_compression ) || $zlib_output_compression == 'Off' )
6622      { // This function helps to turn off output buffering
6623          // But do NOT use it when zlib.output_compression is ON, because it creates the die errors
6624  
6625          // fp/yura TODO: we need to optimize this: We want to flush to screen and continue caching.
6626          //               This needs investigation and checking other similar places.
6627          global $PageCache;
6628          if( ! ( isset( $PageCache ) && ! empty( $PageCache->is_collecting ) ) )
6629          { // Only when page cache is not running now because a notice error can appears in function PageCache->end_collect()
6630              @ob_end_flush();
6631          }
6632      }
6633      flush();
6634  
6635      if( isset( $Timer ) && $Timer->get_state( 'first_flush' ) == 'running' )
6636      { // The first fulsh() was called, stop the timer
6637          $Timer->pause( 'first_flush' );
6638      }
6639  }

6685  /**
6686   * Send a cookie (@see setcookie() for more details)
6687   *
6688   * @param string The name of the cookie
6689   * @param string The value of the cookie
6690   * @param integer The time the cookie expires
6691   * @param string The path on the server in which the cookie will be available on
6692   * @param string The domain that the cookie is available
6693   * @param boolean Indicates that the cookie should only be transmitted over a secure HTTPS connection from the client
6694   * @param boolean (Added in PHP 5.2.0) When TRUE the cookie will be made accessible only through the HTTP protocol
6695   * @return boolean TRUE if setcookie() successfully runs
6696   */
6697  function evo_setcookie( $name, $value = '', $expire = 0, $path = '', $domain = '', $secure = false, $httponly = false )
6698  {
6699      if( version_compare( phpversion(), '5.2', '>=' ) )
6700      { // Use HTTP-only setting since PHP 5.2.0
6701          return setcookie( $name, $value, $expire, $path, $domain, $secure, $httponly );
6702      }
6703      else
6704      { // PHP < 5.2 doesn't support HTTP-only
6705          return setcookie( $name, $value, $expire, $path, $domain, $secure );
6706      }
6707  }

6715  function echo_editable_column_js( $params = array() )
6716  {
6717      $params = array_merge( array(
6718              'column_selector' => '', // jQuery selector of cell
6719              'ajax_url'        => '', // AJAX url to update a column value
6720              'options'         => array(), // Key = Value of option, Value = Title of option
6721              'new_field_name'  => '', // Name of _POST variable that will be send to ajax request with new value
6722              'ID_value'        => '', // jQuery to get value of ID
6723              'ID_name'         => '', // ID of field in DB
6724              'tooltip'         => TS_('Click to edit'),
6725              'colored_cells'   => false, // Use TRUE when colors are used for background of cell
6726              'print_init_tags' => true, // Use FALSE to don't print <script> tags if it is already used inside js
6727              'field_type'      => 'select', // Type of the editable field: 'select', 'text'
6728              'field_class'     => '', // Class of the editable field
6729              'null_text'       => '', // Null text of an input field, Use TS_() to translate it
6730          ), $params );
6731  
6732      // Set onblur action to 'submit' when type is 'text' in order to don't miss the selected user login from autocomplete list
6733      $onblur_action = $params['field_type'] == 'text' ? 'submit' : 'cancel';
6734  
6735      if( $params['field_type'] == 'select' )
6736      {

6738          foreach( $params['options'] as $option_value => $option_title )

6740              $options .= '\''.$option_value.'\':\''.$option_title.'\','."\n";
6741          }

6743  
6744      if( $params['print_init_tags'] )
6745      {
6746  ?>

6748  jQuery( document ).ready( function()
6749  {
6750  <?php
6751      }
6752  ?>
6753      jQuery( '<?php echo $params['column_selector']; ?>' ).editable( '<?php echo $params['ajax_url']; ?>',
6754      {
6755          data: function( value, settings )
6756          {
6757              value = ajax_debug_clear( value );
6758              <?php if( $params['field_type'] == 'select' ) { ?>
6759              var result = value.match( /rel="([^"]*)"/ );
6760              return { <?php echo $options; ?>'selected' : result[1] }
6761              <?php } else { ?>
6762              var result = value.match( />\s*([^<]+)\s*</ );
6763              return result[1] == '<?php echo $params['null_text'] ?>' ? '' : result[1];
6764              <?php } ?>
6765          },
6766          type       : '<?php echo $params['field_type']; ?>',
6767          class_name : '<?php echo $params['field_class']; ?>',
6768          name       : '<?php echo $params['new_field_name']; ?>',
6769          tooltip    : '<?php echo $params['tooltip']; ?>',
6770          event      : 'click',
6771          onblur     : '<?php echo $onblur_action; ?>',
6772          callback   : function ( settings, original )
6773          {
6774              <?php
6775              if( $params['colored_cells'] )
6776              { // Use different color for each value
6777              ?>
6778              jQuery( this ).html( ajax_debug_clear( settings ) );
6779              var link = jQuery( this ).find( 'a' );
6780              jQuery( this ).css( 'background-color', link.attr( 'color' ) == 'none' ? 'transparent' : link.attr( 'color' ) );
6781              link.removeAttr( 'color' );
6782              <?php
6783              }
6784              else
6785              { // Use simple fade effect
6786              ?>
6787              evoFadeSuccess( this );
6788              <?php } ?>
6789          },
6790          onsubmit: function( settings, original ) {},
6791          submitdata : function( value, settings )
6792          {
6793              return { <?php echo $params['ID_name']; ?>: <?php echo $params['ID_value']; ?> }
6794          },
6795          onerror : function( settings, original, xhr )
6796          {
6797              evoFadeFailure( original );
6798              var input = jQuery( original ).find( 'input' );
6799              if( input.length > 0 )
6800              {
6801                  jQuery( original ).find( 'span.field_error' ).remove();
6802                  input.addClass( 'field_error' );
6803                  if( typeof( xhr.responseText ) != 'undefined' )
6804                  {
6805                      input.after( '<span class="note field_error">' + xhr.responseText + '</span>' );
6806                  }
6807              }
6808          }
6809      } );
6810  <?php
6811      if( $params['print_init_tags'] )
6812      {
6813  ?>
6814  } );
6815  </script>
6816  <?php
6817      }
6818  }

6821  /**
6822   * Get a button class name depending on template
6823   *
6824   * @param string Type: 'button', 'button_text', 'button_group'
6825   * @param string TRUE - to get class value for jQuery selector
6826   * @return string Class name
6827   */
6828  function button_class( $type = 'button', $jQuery_selector = false )
6829  {
6830      // Default class names
6831      $classes = array(
6832              'button'       => 'roundbutton', // Simple button with icon
6833              'button_red'   => 'roundbutton_red', // Button with red background
6834              'button_green' => 'roundbutton_green', // Button with green background
6835              'text'         => 'roundbutton_text', // Button with text
6836              'text_primary' => 'roundbutton_text', // Button with text with special style color
6837              'text_success' => 'roundbutton_text', // Button with text with special style color
6838              'text_danger'  => 'roundbutton_text', // Button with text with special style color
6839              'group'        => 'roundbutton_group', // Group of the buttons
6840          );
6841  
6842      if( is_admin_page() )
6843      { // Some admin skins may have special class names
6844          global $AdminUI;
6845          if( ! empty( $AdminUI ) )
6846          {
6847              $template_classes = $AdminUI->get_template( 'button_classes' );
6848          }
6849      }
6850      else
6851      { // Some front end skins may have special class names
6852          global $Skin;
6853          if( ! empty( $Skin ) )
6854          {
6855              $template_classes = $Skin->get_template( 'button_classes' );
6856          }
6857      }
6858      if( !empty( $template_classes ) )
6859      { // Get class names from admin template
6860          $classes = array_merge( $classes, $template_classes );
6861      }
6862  
6863      $class_name = isset( $classes[ $type ] ) ? $classes[ $type ] : '';
6864  
6865      if( $jQuery_selector && ! empty( $class_name ) )
6866      { // Convert class name to jQuery selector
6867          $class_name = '.'.str_replace( ' ', '.', $class_name );
6868      }
6869  
6870      return $class_name;
6871  }
6872
